DoughMain Financial Literacy Foundation Inc. (DMFLF), a 501(c)(3) organization is working to close the financial literacy gap in our country and build stronger, financially literate communities -- one student, one classroom, one school at a time. DoughMain Financial Literacy Foundation created and provides an eight-unit curriculum which includes lessons, activities, and highest quality to schools and teachers at no cost. We have developed a student-centered financial literacy curriculum for high school students. It is a 60-hour program that meets all national standards. We are presently engaging with schools and educators within central New Jersey communities and would appreciate your support in expanding our financial literacy education program for teens and advance our vision of \"A Financially FIT America.\" The Foundation works closely with educators, opinion makers, business leaders and families to dramatically improve financial literacy and better prepare the next generation for a lifetime of better financial decisions. Requirements of the Foundation: Be able to work 15-22 Hours per week during regular business hours at DMFLF HQ in Princeton, NJ Have excellent verbal and written communication skills and a high level of computer and subject matter competency Be motivated, organized, willing to help with any project no matter how large or small, and be able to balance multiple priorities at once Have a strong desire to make a difference, a passion for the DMFLF mission, a positive attitude, and a sense of humor Location of Internship: DoughMain Financial Literacy Foundation 189 Wall Street Princeton, NJ 08540 Office Number: 609-751-3300 To Whom will the intern report for this position? Robert M. Church, Executive Director rchurch@doughmainfoundation.org Cell: 908-240-9694 Office: 609-751-3300 ext. 301 Qualifications, Skills, and Characteristics required: We are looking for an intern or volunteer who is responsible, has good time management and communication skills, and can work well on their own. Because the position will be both in the office and within the community, it is important the intern or volunteer is an independent worker and has the ability to complete tasks on a timely manner. In the very least DMFLF interns or volunteers must be able to work with staff, volunteers, potential donors and major donors and develop any needed documents when asked. Intern or volunteer should be at least 18 years of age, have excellent reading, writing and communication skills, have reliable transportation and a good working phone number. Interns or volunteers are required to have the ability to follow directions, speak about the organization, research, enter and track donor information utilizing various database systems. Understanding of the Following: Grant research and writing process Understanding of the foundation’s message and vision Importance of a clear concise timeline/building schedule Specific duties and tasks: Working with the Executive Director to create a database of potential grants and timelines for the writing process Create and Maintain a Grant Calendar which shows when a grant application and or report is due and the contact information Review funder websites, printed application guidelines and determining mission alignments of potential funder Work with staff and volunteers to identify areas of needs where a grant would help solve a problem of fill a need Learn how to research and write grants Research and help write, review and edit all affiliate grant proposals Evaluate grant writing strategy to adapt to the organization’s strategic plan Learn how to communicate with interested parties about what we do in-person, via telephone and e-mail Work with staff to develop a clear message Attend Community and related activities Work with staff to engage in outreach to local newspapers, news stations, and radio stations to convey message. Benefits to the intern / compensation: Although this in not a paid internship position, interns or volunteers will gain first-hand, individualistic experience in working in all facets of a non-profit organization, including within their focus areas. Interns or volunteers will be able to attend our functions and other events and activities as identified. Interns or volunteers will participate and become actively involved in the actual operational activities of the organization and will leave this experience with a professional understanding of the non-profit world that will serve them as they proceed professionally. Interns or volunteers will also leave this experience with a professional reference upon request. What will the Service Learning Intern Learn? How to work with individuals to develop documents which provide guidance and direction. How to give a public presentation. How to plan and execute fundraising event. How to communicate with the community about our organization. How to develop a list of contacts and organizations. How to engage donors and major donors. How to connect and communicate with media outlets. How a non-profit works. How DoughMain Financial Literacy Foundation serves the community.
08540.title: Grants Writer and Researcher (Spring/Summer)

08540.description: GrandPals read to children in kindergarten, first and second grades in the Princeton schools. Each GrandPal is paired with one or two children for the entire year.We read once a week for 30 minutes in the school library during the school day. A strong intergenerational bond is built between the children and the GrandPal.
08540.title: GrandPals

08540.description: Rewarding. Meaningful. Fun. These are some of the words our volunteers use to describe working with the teens at our centers. Can you: tutor lead a small class offer a workshop offer an internship, volunteer or work experience We are always looking for volunteers to help. For more information, see our center-specific volunteer pages: Princeton: http://princetonlearningcooperative.org/volunteer/ Bucks: http://buckslearningcooperative.org/volunteer/ Raritan: http://raritanlearningcooperative.org/volunteer/
08540.title: Share your time and talents with teens

08540.description: MusicLink is in need of experienced music teachers in New Jersey. With MusicLink, students (children under 18 years old) who show an interest in taking music lessons, but cannot afford full fee lessons, are linked with qualified music teachers willing to reduce their fee by at least half to make the lessons more affordable. MusicLink teachers are able to take advantage of a variety of offers and discounts from our growing list of Business Partners as well as additional benefits directly from our foundation. MusicLink teachers are qualified, professional teachers seeking to share their love of music with a deserving child. All MusicLink teachers are required to pass a criminal background check. Please see our website for more information: www.musiclinkfoundation.org .
08540.title: Music Teachers for Underprivileged Children

08540.description: We are the Princeton Integral Yoga Community Center (Princeton IYCC) which is a 501(c)(3) non-profit ecumenical community center which offers yoga, meditation, spirituality and social programming. OUR NEEDS: We are in need of artistic individuals to document via photo / video / social media our programming in order to promote our activities and share our good works with our membership and the public. We are looking for someone with visual and/or technical skills who would help document with camera and video our concerts, workshops, classes and special events. Expertise in photo-editing, video editing, web-streaming / live-streaming, and graphic design would all be of utility in this opportunity. YOUR BENEFITS: We offer access freely to our yoga classes for those who help us with these services! See our Schedule on our website: www.IYCCprinceton.org, and also take a look at all the services we are offering. We also are a great resource / credential to solidify your portfolio of skills to enhance your own resume / credentials, and we are a FUN place to work / volunteer! After an on-site meeting and orientation, work may be done from home on one's own computer as well as on-site.
08540.title: Photography and/or Videography

08540.description: Princeton Senior Resource Center (PSRC) needs volunteer office support to be the first point of contact for our participants. It would include front desk reception, answering the phone, preparing class materials, computer data entry, work on mailings, and assisting people who are inquiring about services. This is a busy social environment! Flexible schedule Monday-Friday. Immediate need for the following shifts: Tuesday, Wednesday, or Thursday morning ! Volunteering for only one shift is recommended.
08540.title: Senior Center/Front Desk support needed

08540.description: Are tech gadgets and computers your passion? Volunteers are needed to help us in our on-sight Computer Lab! Volunteers assist older adults 1-1 on various devices, including desktops in the lab, laptops, tablets and phones, on all operating systems. Sample questions include \"how do I do email and Skype\",\"how do I organize my photos\" and \"how do I use my new gadget?\" We need volunteers for 3 different Computer Lab sessions. Each session is approximately 2.5 hours. Tuesday beginning at 1:00 pm, Wednesday beginning at 1:30 pm and Friday beginning at 10:00 am.
08540.title: Computer Lab Assistance Needed For Older Adults

08540.description: The Family Support Counselor works with families that have recently suffered the loss of an infant child. They will facilitate dialogue with the family, funeral home and medical institution to provide full support in the immediate aftermath of the death of their infant. This individual also assists families in completing the application and getting the required paperwork together to be eligible to receive funds and take full advantage of the services The Luca John Foundation offers.
08540.title: Family Case Officer

08540.description: The volunteer experience at Good Grief is life changing. The children and families teach our volunteers a great deal about life, resiliency, hope, and the need for supporting each other. Many volunteers say they receive much more than they give. This meaningful experience not only impacts the children of Good Grief, but most volunteers attest to the ways in which this experience has drastically changed and improved their lives, as this work is both personally transformative and rewarding. Good Grief's nationally respected programs provide free peer support to children, teens, young adults, and families after the death of a parent or sibling. Our programs equip grieving families with the support and tools they need to face their grief. We help families develop healthy coping skills, provide a caring environment to process feelings and fears, and create a sense of hopefulness during a very difficult and uncertain time. #CHC
08540.title: Help make a difference in the lives of grieving children!

08540.description: Nature Abounds, a national 501c3 non-profit organization, is looking for senior aged volunteers (55 yrs of age) to serve as Environmental Science Teachers onboard the Steamboat Floating Classroom (SPLASH), or on land, adjacent to the steamboat dock in Hamilton, NJ. Environmental Science classes include: Enviroscape/Watershed Studies; Chemistry of the River; Shad Migration and the Environmental History of the Delaware River; Macroinvertebrates. Most classes are 3 rd grade through 6 th grade, some classes are older. Class size: 8 to 12. Class is taught 3 times per trip. Availability: Trips are by charter arrangement. Most trips are Monday-Friday, with departure times of 10am and 12:30pm. Teachers need to arrive approximately 45 minutes before departure time, to set up teaching station. Season starts in early May and ends in October. Trip schedule is available online, science teachers can indicate their availability to teach in the online document, or email the trip scheduler. Responsibilities: Set up teaching station; Dry and put away teaching materials after the trip. Training: Lesson plans provided. Training arranged with Education Director. Qualifications: Passion for sharing environmental science with young people. Sense of adventure and fun. A background check is required.
08540.title: Environmental Science Teacher on Refurbished Steamboat

08540.description: Protect our environment and the special place in which we live! Citizens’ Climate Lobby (CCL) wants you! As a volunteer, you’ll be a member of the fastest growing and most effective climate advocacy group. You will work with concerned New Jersey citizens to slow the effects of climate change. Let's work together to protect our beautiful ecosystems, livelihoods and way of life. Please respond to our posting for an invitation to learn more. You will: Meet with Congressional leaders. Write letters to the editors and op-eds. Meet with local media. Educate your community about global warming and legislative solutions. We provide: Monthly national conference calls with expert guest speakers. Weekly skill building sessions. On-line network with CCL volunteers across the U.S. National conference and lobby week in D.C. Volunteers commit to an average of 4-6 hours a month. Some of our volunteers dedicate more time than that. We hold no upper limit on your dedication to a stable climate and livable world. To learn more about us, please join an Introductory Conference Call. The next call is Wednesday at 5:00 p.m. Pacific/6:00 p.m. Mountain/7:00 p.m. Central/8:00 p.m. Eastern. This is an opportunity to learn about CCL. It is one hour, and there will be opportunities to ask questions. The conference call number is 1-866-642-1665, passcode 440699#.
08540.title: Sustainable Climate Environment Advocate Princeton NJ

08540.description: Welcome to the ASD Climber Foundation! ASD stands for Autism Spectrum Disorders. We are working with a family in your area with a child on the autism spectrum. The family wants to train volunteers to help them run a home based social skills program called the Son-Rise Program. No experience necessary. Free training provided. Time commitment is 2-4 hours a week for 6 months or more. PLEASE READ: After completing the \"I want to help\" page, you will immediately receive an auto reply email with our Volunteer Profile. Please fill this out, and we will forward it directly to the family in your area that requires help. ***please add asdclimberfoundation@me.com to your safe list and check your junk mail if you do not see an immediate response in your inbox*** Thank you for your time!
08540.title: Princeton, NJ: Autism Volunteer

08540.description: Thank you for your interest in becoming a volunteer with the Home Friends Program. The Home Friends program was created in 1987 to provide companionship and support for the senior citizens of the Princeton area. Home Friend volunteers are matched with a Princeton or surrounding area senior. Home Friends provide weekly visits which may involve conversation, walks, assistance with routine errands or work on a mutually enjoyed hobby. The minimum time commitment is one hour a week. Many meaningful and lasting friendships have developed with HomeFriends over the years. Thank you for your willingness to give of yourself. Do you speak a language other than English? Let us know! Here are a just a few things people have shared about their HomeFriends Experience: \"K is a ray of sunshine and just what I needed.\" \"M is Unbelievable. She has been a better friend to me than friends I have had for ages\"
08540.title: HomeFriends Volunteers to visit Seniors

08542.description: Senior Care Services of New Jersey seeks volunteers to provide transportation for seniors to health and medical-related appointments and food shopping. Friendly visits are always welcome as well. We serve clients within a 10 mile radius of Princeton. Volunteers are the lifeblood of Senior Care Services of New Jersey. Our volunteers are a diverse group: many work full time; others are college students and professors; some are parents with young children; others are grandparents and retirees. All are united by the passion to help their neighbors age with dignity and independence in the comfort of their own homes.
08542.title: Volunteer Drivers to Assist Seniors to Age in Place
08542.org: Senior Care Services of New Jersey

08542.description: Outreach Supervisor (Volunteer Position) Position Summary : The Disability Allies (DA) is dedicated to providing social opportunities to connect young adults and children with and without disabilities. The Outreach Supervisor i s a part time volunteer position that involves a commitment of a few hours a week. You must be willing to join us at our monthly committee meetings at the Milltown Public Library at 10am on the Second S aturday of the Month. The Outreach Supervisor will lead a team in charge of building strategic relationships, conduct ing a variety of outreach ac tivities, and the recruitment of volunteers and members . Responsibilities: The Outreach Supervisor will lead a team in charge of building strategic relationships, conduct ing a variety of outreach ac tivities, and the recruitment of volunteers and members . The Community Outreach Team will be responsible for the following tasks: Create and implement our outreach plan Develop and strengthen relationships between the Disability Allies and the community Develop partnerships with universities, social groups and community organizations, in particular those that provide social opportunities to young adults with disabilities Recruit and place Disability Allies volunteers within our committees Qualifications & Competencies: Excellent public speaking and presentation skills Must be able to meet deadlines and adjust to changing priorities Must be proficient in Microsoft Office Able to effectively communicate both verbally and in writing Ability to connect with others and develop relationships Committed to the mission of serving young adults with disabilities Ability to perform several tasks concurrently Strong time management and organizational skills Ability to maintain detailed records and confidential information About the Disability Allies : The purpose of the Disability Allies is to plan team building activities that connect young adults and children with and without disabilities.   At our events we pair each individual up with a mentor. The job of the mentor is to help the participants with their social skills and insure that everyone interacts with each other. Our events are open to any young adult that has a disability, knows someone with a disability or is supportive of people with disabilities. Please visit www.disabilityallies.com to learn more. Disability Allies Anti-Discrimination statement : Disability Allies shall not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion (creed), gender, age, national origin (ancestry), disability, marital status, sexual orientation, political affiliation, gender identification or expression, or military status in any of its activities of operations. These activities include, but are not limited to, hiring and firing of staff, selection of volunteers, and selection of ven dors and provision of services.
08542.title: Outreach Supervisor

08542.description: Community Coordinator Job Description Position Summary : The Disability Allies (DA) is dedicated to providing social opportunities to connect young adults and children with and without disabilities. The Commu nity Relations Coordinator is a part t ime position. The Community Relations Coordinator reports to the Director and is responsible for DA outreach and recruitment. Responsibilities: The Community Coordinator’s primary responsibilities are to build strategic relationships, conduct a variety of outreach ac tivities, and recruit volunteers and members . Create and implement our outreach plan Develop and strengthen relationships between the Disability Allies and the community Develop partnerships with universities, social groups and community organizations, in particular those that provide social opportunities to young adults with disabilities Recruit and place Disability Allies volunteers within our committees Qualifications & Competencies: Excellent public speaking and presentation skills Must be able to meet deadlines and adjust to changing priorities Must be proficient in Microsoft Office Able to effectively communicate both verbally and in writing Ability to connect with others and develop relationships Committed to the mission of serving young adults with disabilities Ability to perform several tasks concurrently Strong time management and organizational skills Ability to maintain detailed records and confidential information About the Disability Allies : The purpose of the Disability Allies is to plan team building activities that connect young adults and children with and without disabilities.   At our events we pair each individual up with a mentor. The job of the mentor is to help the participants with their social skills and insure that everyone interacts with each other. Our events are open to any young adult that has a disability, knows someone with a disability or is supportive of people with disabilities. Please visit www.disabilityallies.com to learn more . Disability Allies Anti-Discrimination statement : Disability Allies shall not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion (creed), gender, age, national origin (ancestry), disability, marital status, sexual orientation, political affiliation, gender identification or expression, or military status in any of its activities of operations. These activities include, but are not limited to, hiring and firing of staff, selection of volunteers, and selection of ven dors and provision of services.
08542.title: Community Coordinator

08542.description: The Volunteer Manager is responsible for managing our volunteer roles and requirements. This position would work with the different teams within the Foundation to make sure that role requirements are being filled. This role is also responsible for initial volunteer vetting and on-boarding. This is a great role for an office manager, recruiter, or HR.
08542.title: Volunteer Manager

11542.description: We are a Christian transitional home for women struggling with drug/alcohol addictions. We help them regain their lives by providing shelter, food, emotional support and basic life skills to succeed. We need people to be mentors and lead workshops on recovery, self esteem, health, finance management job search, & computer skills. We need help in designing a new website for us- one that we can update ourselves!
11542.title: Help us give women back their dignity at our transitional home

11542.description: A museum and nature preserve emphasizing the geology of Long Island and American Indian archaeology..
11542.title: Garvies Point Museum and Preserve

07512.description: Office Support: Provide clerical support by assisting with filing, mailings, and making calls from our Totowa office location. Bereavement Support: Bereavement support is provided to families after the death of their loved one. Help the bereaved through making calls, assisting with support groups, or assist with our periodic memorial services.
07512.title: Clerical and Office Volunteers Needed, Great Experience in Patient Services
07512.org: VHS Hospice Services of New Jersey

07512.description: Volunteer Opportunities: We at VHS Hospice Services of NJ are looking for talented volunteers to provide companionship and respite by demonstrating their Music & Art skills, to families and patients at their end of life stage. Training: Volunteers are required to complete our training program, designed to prepare the individual for working with families and patients. Training is free of service. VHS Hospice Services of NJ serves patients in Passaic and Bergen counties. We are an affiliate of Hackensack Meridian Health. Hospice is care for individuals who are terminally ill with six months or less to live. Hospice is a philosophy of care that focuses on the comfort of the patient and not curative treatment. Hospice care is provided in the home, hospital, or a facility setting. Additionally, a great opportunity for students completing Internships, field placements, or volunteer service hours with hospice, can expect to gain experience working with patients in a companionship role as well as the administrative functions of hospice. Training is provided both in the field and in the office with team members. Students may choose the role in which they wish to complete their hours in.
07512.title: Musical and Artistic Volunteers Needed for Patient Support
07512.org: VHS Hospice Services of New Jersey

07512.description: Great opportunity for students completing Internships, field placements, or volunteer service hours with hospice, can expect to gain experience working with patients in a companionship role as well as the administrative functions of hospice. Free training is provided both in the field and in the office with team members. Students may choose the role in which they wish to complete their hours in. Volunteer Opportunities: We at VHS Hospice Services of NJ are looking for hospice volunteers to provide vital services such as: Providing companionship and respite by visiting patients and families Office and clerical support Bereavement support Making phone calls Music therapy Pet, Music, and Art therapy *(Volunteers may have other interests or professional skills that can be utilized by patients and families, such as landscaping, barber, art therapy, musical training, or are bi-lingual.) Training: Volunteers are required to complete a free comprehensive training program designed to prepare the individual for working with families and patients. Along with the required training for a new volunteer, additional workshop trainings are offered throughout Hackensack Meridian Health, for volunteers to perform complementary therapies. These include 11th Hour, Pet Therapy, and Reiki Therapy .
07512.title: Opportunity for Students in Passaic and Bergen County
07512.org: VHS Hospice Services of New Jersey

07512.description: Volunteer Opportunities: We at VHS Hospice Services of NJ are looking for hospice volunteers to provide vital services such as: Providing companionship and respite by visiting patients and families Office and clerical support Bereavement support Making phone calls Music therapy Pet therapy Art therapy Reiki therapy *(Volunteers may have other interests or professional skills that can be utilized by patients and families, such as landscaping, barber, art therapy, musical training, or are bi-lingual.) Training: Volunteers are required to complete a free comprehensive training program designed to prepare the individual for working with families and patients. Along with the required training for a new volunteer, additional workshop trainings are offered throughout Hackensack Meridian Health, for volunteers to perform complementary therapies. These include 11th Hour, Pet Therapy, and Reiki Therapy . Great opportunity for students completing Internships, field placements, or volunteer service hours with hospice, can expect to gain experience working with patients in a companionship role as well as the administrative functions of hospice. Training is provided both in the field and in the office with team members. Students may choose the role in which they wish to complete their hours in.
07512.title: Hospice Volunteer - Companionship, Clerical, Music, Pet Therapy - Totowa
07512.org: VHS Hospice Services of New Jersey

07512.description: Enjoy shopping? Love to help people? HomeCare Options in Totowa, New Jersey is seeking new volunteer shoppers for their House Call Groceries for Seniors program. This all volunteer shopping group provides a very practical service for Seniors and handicapped residents throughout Passaic County who are homebound and no longer able to get out to shop for their own groceries. Each shopper, simply by making themselves available to these clients to shop, also brings an extra ray of caring and sunshine into the lives of people who often have less and less contact with the outside world as they age. Individual shoppers, husband/wife teams, and parent/teen shopping pairs are all welcome to apply. Can you share a few hours of your time each week? every other week? each month? to help? We will find a match for you! Shop in your own town, or shop in a town nearby. You choose how far you can travel to help, and which town(s) you are able to shop in. For more information about this program, call Julie Ford at (973) 523-1224, Ext. 229. The stories we hear from shopping clients, and individual shopping volunteers are so heartwarming! So many matches seem to be made in heaven when you hear how appreciative clients are, and how relationships are built over time between each shopping client and shopping volunteer! Please call and give this a try!
07512.title: HomeCare Options', House Call Groceries for Seniors, Volunteer Shoppers

07512.description: HomeCare Options, an accredited and licensed not-for-profit Health Care Service Firm located in Northern New Jersey is seeking volunteer Board candidates who have experience in Banking, Fundraising, Marketing or Philanthropy.
07512.title: Seeking Volunteer Board of Trustee Candidates

07512.description: The Chapter office needs volunteer assistance for: -Town Fair, mall events and Health Fair events to raise awareness for the Alzheimer's Association programs and services throughout North and Central NJ -Promotional events throughout North and Central NJ to raise awareness for our Walk To End Alzheimer's events in Ridgefield Park, Mercer County, Bradley Beach and one other location TBA in early 2018 -Office help in Totowa, NJ
07512.title: Alzheimer's Association Greater NJ Chapter Volunteer Assistance

07512.description: We are seeking certified yoga instuctors who are interested in sharing their passion for teaching yoga with individuals who are striving to embark on having a more active and healthy lifestyle through our Active Life for a Healthy Mind program. We have a variety of regularly scheduled activities for individuals who self-identify with anxiety and/or depression. Volunteers would be expected to lead a yoga class on weekday evenings and/or weekends, based on thier availability. Candidates volunteering in this capacity should be proficient in teaching yoga to individuals with little or no experience with them. You should also hold the appropriate certification(s) and be willing to provide them for our records. These yoga sessions are open, free of charge, to individuals living with anxiety and/or depression, who are seeking an outlet for an active and healthy lifestyle.
07512.title: Volunteer Yoga Instuctor

10960.description: We are looking for enthusiastic volunteers who are interested in advocating on behalf of individuals who use and inject drugs. There is a public health need to increase access to sterile hypodermic needles for people who inject drugs, as a means to reduce the spread of HIV, hepatitis C and other bacterial infections. Volunteers would be involved in registering independent pharmacies across Rockland County in a New York State Department of Health program that would authorize these pharmacies to dispense hypodermic needles without a prescription. Volunteers would be traveling across Rockland County, so a car is preferred.
10960.title: Syringe Access Advocate

10805.description: United Hebrew is expanding!!! At this time, we need clerical help at our Home Health Care Agency.. The requirements are listed below. Please note the hours can be flexible-- as long as you are here during business hours a few days a week. The role of Home Health Care Aides is extremely important after our short-term residents get discharged to the community.. So your role as a volunteer in our home health care agency is very crucial in making the process run smoothly. We are looking for someone with great organizational skills who is responsible and articulate! - help the Home Health Aides in their application forms, references, etc. -make copies of their certificates, SSS card, driving license, passport, etc. -make charts for new hires, filing paperwork -call the Aides for scheduled in-service training, making phone calls to follow-up Aides’ requirements , etc. We need somebody who can come 11-3 preferably but anytime in the daytime is good, 3 or more days is excellent.
10805.title: United Hebrew Home Healthercare Clerical Support

10805.description: United Hebrew of New Rochelle is an outstanding, five-star nursing home and rehabilitation facility where teamwork and dedication are the two essential components of everyday operations. We are currently looking for someone with great clerical and organizational skills to assist our skilled health care agency in helping those residents who are successfully discharged from the facility to get back to their normal, everyday lives! Would you like to be a part of our caring, rewarding, ever-growing, and fun family? The hours are very flexible-- as long as you can help out Monday through Friday during regular, 9-5 business hours. Two days a week, 9-5-- would be ideal, but we are willing to consider ANY kind of regular schedule-as the demand for assistance is truly overwhelming! Responsibilities will including but are not limited to - Filing - Preparing admissions packets - Basic data entry of new residents - Insurance verification. Please feel free to e-mail mlevine@uhgc.org. We look forward to hearing from you!!!
10805.title: Our Skilled Health Care Agency Needs You!

10805.description: United Hebrew of New Rochelle--a five-start nursing home and rehabilitation facility in the Westchester, NY is looking for weekend volunteers. Our fun recreation department is especially interested in mature and responsible volunteers who would like to help with transporting/escorting residents to and from different units for facility-wide events/activities, conducting games, visits, or other activities, and simply enhancing the residents’ lives and safety through interacting and assisting our recreation staff. The most crucial hours when volunteers are needed are 1PM to 4PM on weekends, but we are open to other options as morning hours are also important! Please note that while we really need volunteers on weekends, we also need volunteers throughout the week-- especially when conducting visits and collecting resident stories. We look forward to hearing from you!
10805.title: Weekend FUN with Seniors!

10805.description: We are looking to add volunteers to our newly-developed dementia unit as well as to other units throughout the facility! We are looking for people with special talents to provide alternative therapies, such as yoga and tactile stimulation to our elderly residents. We are also looking for art music, and drama therapists or simply artists, musicians and actors to volunteer their time. This could be a great opportunity for a student to gain valuable or a senior yoga instructors looking to contribute to the community. You will be working side-by-side with amazing recreation staff. We are also looking for art therapy volunteers to assist our talented Art Therapists on the dementia floor and other units. We offer at truly friendly and supportive environment! Joins our team and you will see what teamwork is all about! We currently have Music, Art, and Dance/Movement Therapists on our team, and ALL of them would LOVE your assistance! We also have numerous volunteer opportunities available in ALL DEPARTMENTS! NO MATTER HOW YOU DECIDE TO CONTRIBUTE, YOU ARE GUARANTEED TO HAVE A REWARDING AND VALUABLE EXPERIENCE! WE LOOK FORWARD TO HEARING FROM YOU! Please call/e-mail Mila Levine at 914-632-2804x1234/mlevine@uhgc.org
10805.title: Call for ALL Creative Talents/Therapists: music, arts, drama, etc.

10805.description: We are looking for a number of computer instructors to assist our nursing staff with a basic computer-based in-services program. The program is very simple to use for anyone who uses computer on a daily basis. We are looking for someone who is willing to share his/her computer knowledge with our hard-working nursing staff that do not get to use computer frequently. Very basic computer/internet knowledge, patience, and desire to provide basic training to others are required. This opportunity offers flexible hours-- possibly -- one hour in the afternoon and one in the evening. We will work with your schedule. This is a great opportunity for a student or anyone who desires to enhance their resume with teaching experience! Our nursing department needs your help in expediting this computer in-service program, so that the staff they can dedicate more time to our elderly residents! This is an on-going opportunity, as there will be several learning modules required completion. You will be working side-by-side with the most hard-working, friendly, and supportive team! We look forward to hearing from you! We also have numerous volunteer opportunities available in ALL DEPARTMENTS! NO MATTER HOW YOU DECIDE TO CONTRIBUTE, YOU ARE GUARANTEED TO HAVE A REWARDING AND VALUABLE EXPERIENCE! WE LOOK FORWARD TO HEARING FROM YOU! Please call/e-mail Mila Levine at 914-632-2804x1234/mlevine@uhgc.org
10805.title: Computer Instructors Needed for our Nursing Deparment!

10805.description: Our Administration/Security Department is looking for volunteers to greet visitors, sort mail, and, occasionally, answer phones at the very busy front desk. Your primary responsibility will be assisting our amazing front desk staff. Friendly disposition is a must, and experience in the hospitality industry is strongly preferred. You will, at times, be escorting visitors and delivering packages or mail to the residents on the floors. You will also get a chance to work with numerous departments, family members, and residents. You will get to know virtually everyone in the facility! This is a one of those fun opportunities where no two days are alike! Are you ready to have some fun and fall in love with our five-star, customer-focused facility?! PREFERRED HOURS ARE WEEKDAYS 11AM-3PM (PLEASE NOTE THAT WEEKEND VOLUNTEERS ARE ALSO VERY MUCH NEEDED IN MANY DIFFERENT AREAS!) In addition, we have numerous volunteer opportunities available in ALL Departments! NO MATTER HOW YOU DECIDE TO CONTRIBUTE, YOU ARE GUARANTEED TO HAVE A REWARDING AND VALUABLE EXPERIENCE! WE LOOK FORWARD TO HEARING FROM YOU! Please call/e-mail Mila Levine at 914-632-2804x1234/mlevine@uhgc.org
10805.title: Are You Great at Customer Service?

10805.description: United Hebrew of New Rochelle is looking for greeters/ambassadors who will 1) Greet visitors at the front door; 2) Assist visitors and residents coming in the lobby; 3) Escort visitors and residents to their destinations within the facility; 4) Answer any questions visitors, family members, and newly-admitted residents may have upon arrival; 5) Serve as a liaison between newly-admitted residents and department representative to expedite residents/families’ requests in a timely fashion; 6) Perform other duties as required by administrative staff. The hours are flexible. We understand other commitments our volunteers may have. If you are available any time during the week between the hours of 1PM and 5PM and on weekends between 10AM and 6PM, we would love to hear from you!! Even one day a week will make a difference! Please contact Mila Levine, Director of Volunteers at 914-632-2894x1234 or at mlevine@uhgc.org. Visit us at http://www.unitedhebrewgeriatric.org
10805.title: Are You a Good Host/Hostess?

10805.description: United Hebrew of New Rochelle is a top-notch rehabilitation and long-term healthcare facility that offers fun, supportive, and creative environment for both its employees and volunteers!! Join our amazing team and see how you can make a difference in people's lives on a daily basis! Currently, our Admissions and Social Work Departments are looking for a number of assistants. While assisting our Admissions and Social work departments you will 1) Copy and organize admission packets (red folders with admissions materials) for use by the social workers/intake coordinator 2) Send faxes on behalf of social worker to: (a) request equipment needed on discharge; (b) paperwork to resident family members/attorneys etc. 3) Do post discharge phone calls (follow a set script and notate responses of residents who have gone home regarding their experience) 4) Computer data entry (enter info from resident psychosocial into computer). If you prefer to volunteer EXCLUSIVELY with our Social Work Department, so you can get to know our residents through one-on-one interaction, you will: 1) Visit with a number of the same residents on a regular basis; 2) Report to the Director of Social Services about the progress you made with long-term and short-term rehabilitation residents; 3) Complete clerical tasks, such as faxing, copying, and filing. NO MATTER HOW YOU DECIDE TO CONTRIBUTE, YOU ARE GUARANTEED TO HAVE A REWARDING AND VALUABLE EXPERIENCE! WE LOOK FORWARD TO HEARING FROM YOU!
10805.title: Caring Admissions Assistants Needed

10805.description: United Hebrew - a five-star nursing home and rehab facility in New Rochelle, NY- has a rehabilitation department affiliated with the nationally-renown Burke Rehabilitation Center. We are currently looking for mature, responsible, and, preferably, long-term volunteers who would be able to assist with transporting residents to and from rehabilitation activities. We are especially interested in WEEKEND VOLUNTEERS who would be available Saturday and Sunday 9:30AM to 3:30PM. This role is crucial in helping our rehab residents get better faster and keep our amazing rehab staff on schedule! Join us in this rewarding role, and you will get to work with truly compassionate, hard-working, and FUN people! You will get to see how your efforts can have a direct effect on people's lives! You will also get to work side by side with our rehabilitation experts that will allow you to gain valuable experience. We look forward to hearing from you!
10805.title: Weekend Helpers for the Top-Notch Rehab Department!

07044.description: VOLUNTEERS for Set-up: includes tents, tables/chairs, signs, balloons, registration, mission, and children's activity areas prior to event. Food donations from vendors: subs, sandwiches and/or pizza cotton candy machine and supplies kid's craft corner clown/character photographers
07044.title: Donations of goods/services for Great Strides-VERONA
07044.org: Cystic Fibrosis Foundation Greater New Jersey

07044.description: The American Liver Foundation Greater New York Division is looking for volunteers to help out at the 2018 Liver Life Walk in New Jersey. Event duties include: Event Set-up Duties: Assist in hanging banners, setting up tables and chairs, decorating etc. Registration Duties: Welcome participants as they check-in, pick-up their t-shirts and receive detailed information about the day. Parking Attendants Duties: Direct vehicles to empty parking spaces one at a time. There will be an area for volunteers to park separate from participant parking. Also, parking attendants will assist with placing directional signs to designate where the event is being held. Course Set-up Duties: Place route markers and educational signs throughout the walk course approximately every few blocks so walkers/runners are able to stay on the course. Responsibilities also include: 1. Deliver tables, water and cups to water stations 2. Drop-off water station volunteers and course monitors 3. During the Walk, patrol the course to pick-up any tired walkers 4. Follow the final walkers to pick up the course monitors and water stop volunteers 5. Return to the course to pick up the remaining water, cups, tables and signage Course Monitors Duties: As a Course Monitor, you will be stationed at specified intersections along the course to help participants cross any busy intersections and cheer them on to the finish. You might be asked to wear a bright orange vest to distinguish yourself. Greeters Duties: This is every participant's first impression of the event! Greet participants after they have parked and direct them to the registration area. T ent Supervisors Duties: We will be having several tents with food, drinks, games, etc. so we will need people to oversee that everything is going smoothly. We are happy to provide proof of volunteer time for those who need it for schools, community service, etc. If interested, please contact Logan Moore at lmoore@liverfoundation.org.
07044.title: 2018 Liver Life Walk New Jersey
07044.org: American Liver Foundation Greater New York Division

07044.description: Welcome to the ASD Climber Foundation! ASD stands for Autism Spectrum Disorders. We are working with a family in your area with a child on the autism spectrum. The family wants to train volunteers to help them run a home based social skills program called the Son-Rise Program. No experience necessary. Free training provided. Time commitment is 2-4 hours a week for 6 months or more. PLEASE READ: After completing the \"I want to help\" page, you will immediately receive an auto reply email with our Volunteer Profile. Please fill this out, and we will forward it directly to the family in your area that requires help. ***please add asdclimberfoundation@me.com to your safe list and check your junk mail if you do not see an immediate response in your inbox*** Thank you for your time!
07044.title: Verona, NJ: Autism Volunteer

07045.description: Be our community champion! Community Options seeks business people to help further its mission. Among the goals set for the Business Advisory Council, or COBAC: To assist Community Options staff in its fundraising endeavors, To assist Community Options staff in networking with the business community, To help individuals with disabilities integrate into their communities, To ensure utmost quality in Community Options services, To educate local business owners and the corporate sector about persons with disabilities and the role that the business community can play in their lives, To attain a societal understanding and acceptance of a person with a disability as a productive member of the community. As a member of COBAC in your community, you're our champion! Join us today. Learn more about COBAC here: http://www.comop.org/get-involved/cobac/
07045.title: Business Advisory Council Committee - NNJ

07045.description: If you have an hour or more per week to give, Grace Healthcare Services welcomes your gifts of time and compassion. Whether you choose to work directly with patients and families or to volunteer in one of many other ways, you can make a profound difference in someone's life, including your own. Volunteers are an integral part of the hospice team. Volunteer Opportunities: Companionship Volunteers work directly with patients providing companionship, offering friendly visits, reading to patients, writing letters, offering a gentle touch or sharing a quiet moment. Complementary Volunteers are certified/trained professionals who can provide complementary modalities of reflexology, music, imagery and touch therapies such as Reiki, massage, therapeutic touch and healing hands. Pet Therapy Volunteers provide certified/trained pets who visit with patients. These animals provide loving memories for some and give unconditional love helping our patients feel connected to a larger world. Administrative Volunteers provide help to the staff in our Edison office by assisting with typing, addressing cards, organizing newsletters, creating packets, collating manuals and other varied clerical duties Craft Volunteers consist of individuals or groups who touch patients in a special way by making lap blankets, shawls, huggable dolls/bears and other articles for patients to enjoy. Junior Volunteers consist of groups such as girl/boy scouts or young people who wish to honor our patients by making holiday cards, posters, wall hangings and memory books. Bereavement Volunteers offer support to the families and friends of patients who have passed. During the grieving process the bereavement volunteer can be a valuable resource, especially for those who lack a solid support network. Hospice training classes are required for Companionship and Complementary Volunteers. They are free of charge and offered on an ongoing basis. Grace Healthcare Services serves counties throughout New Jersey. Areas where you are needed include: Atlantic County, Bergen County, Cape May County, Essex County, Hudson County, Mercer County, Middlesex County, Monmouth County, Morris County, North Passaic County, Ocean County, Somerset County, South Passaic County, Burlington County, Camden County and Union County. For more information about our free volunteer training and available opportunities, contact our Volunteer Department or visit our website at Gracehcs.com!
07045.title: Become a Hospice Volunteer!

07046.description: Be a mentor. Change a life. Bring the magic of mentoring to a child, age 7-18, from Bergen, Hunterdon, Morris, Passaic, Somerset, Sussex and Warren counties (N.J.), by becoming a Big Brother or Big Sister. Being a Big Brother or Big Sisters is one of the most enjoyable things you'll ever do. Not to mention, one of the most fulfilling. You have the opportunity to help shape a child's future for the better by empowering him or her to achieve. And the best part is, it's actually a lot of fun. You and your Little can share the kinds of activities you already like to do. Mentors meet with their Little Brothers or Little Sisters for 2-3 hours weekly. Find out how you can change a life!
07046.title: Be a mentor and help change a child's life
07046.org: Big Brothers Big Sisters of Northern NJ

07047.description: Grace Healthcare Services is looking for Hospice Volunteers! We welcome your gifts of time and compassion. Whether you choose to work directly with patients and families or to volunteer in one of many other ways, you can make a profound difference in someone's life, including your own. Volunteers are an integral part of the hospice team. Volunteers are needed in all areas of NJ! Volunteer Opportunities: Companionship Volunteers work directly with patients providing companionship, offering friendly visits, reading to patients, writing letters, offering a gentle touch or sharing a quiet moment. Complementary Volunteers are certified/trained professionals who can provide complementary modalities of reflexology, music, imagery and touch therapies such as Reiki, massage, therapeutic touch and healing hands. Pet Therapy Volunteers provide certified/trained pets who visit with patients. These animals provide loving memories for some and give unconditional love helping our patients feel connected to a larger world. Administrative Volunteers provide help to the staff in our Edison office by assisting with typing, addressing cards, organizing newsletters, creating packets, collating manuals and other varied clerical duties Craft Volunteers consist of individuals or groups who touch patients in a special way by making lap blankets, shawls, huggable dolls/bears and other articles for patients to enjoy. Junior Volunteers consist of groups such as girl/boy scouts or young people who wish to honor our patients by making holiday cards, posters, wall hangings and memory books. Bereavement Volunteers offer support to the families and friends of patients who have passed. During the grieving process the bereavement volunteer can be a valuable resource, especially for those who lack a solid support network. Hospice training classes are required for Companionship and Complementary Volunteers. They are free of charge and offered on an ongoing basis. Grace Healthcare Services serves counties throughout New Jersey. Areas where you are needed include: Atlantic County, Bergen County, Cape May County, Essex County, Hudson County, Mercer County, Middlesex County, Monmouth County, Morris County, North Passaic County, Ocean County, Somerset County, South Passaic County, Burlington County, Camden County and Union County. For more information about our free volunteer training and available opportunities, contact our Volunteer Department or visit our website at Gracehcs.com! We look forward to hearing from you!
07047.title: Become a Hospice Volunteer!

07047.description: Our immediate goal is partnerships and collaborations with like minded groups and sponsors to expand and sustain our mission. We are looking for program directors to expand our apiary programs to new educational and municipal markets. Our focus is on training and assisting disadvantaged population, veterans and all students to support sustainable programs that teach a basic business model based on honey products and preserving honey bees as part of an environmental action. Our programs encompass interdisciplinary learning including business planning management and development, teaching, wood working, environmental, agriculture, health, habitat, food chain, apitherapy, apiculture, biology, and cross over into emotional support therapy and and treatments.
07047.title: Educating the public on preservation of honey bees through community actions

07040.description: Are you organized? Detail oriented? Not spatially-challenged? Good at herding cats? Are you able to be kind, yet firm? We want you! On June 10th, North Jersey Pride will hold its 6th Pride Festival in Memorial Park in Maplewood. Several thousand LGBTQ people and supportive allies will be joining us for an afternoon of family-friendly celebration, music, food and, yes, shopping at more than 100 vendors and merchants. That's where you come in. We are seeking a volunteer to join our 2018 Pride Festival planning team as official Vendor Coordinator. The VC will: Solicit merchants with fun, fresh items to sell-art, jewelry, clothing, etc. Collect applications and curate the vendor court Notify vendors who have been accepted; return checks to those who haven't Allocate space to vendors, arranging them for maximum flow and general happiness Be on site by 7am the morning of June 10th to receive delivery of tents/tables/chairs Coordinate check-in, with the help of volunteers who will be assigned to you Handling all the little inevitable bumps (\"But I don't like my spot!\" \"He's too close to me!\" \"I forgot my table!\") with a friendly, calm, yet firm, demeanor. Celebrate with us when it's all over. Benefits: Meet some amazing people (LGBTQ and ally) and make new friends Put it on your resume in the event you choose to pursue a career in actual cat-herding Be a part of an incredible celebration Fulfill your community service requirement Get to carry a clipboard (whistle is optional) Get a tan North Jersey Pride is a 501(c)3, all volunteer nonprofit that aims to be \"Pride with a Purpose.\" Our Festival is a way of reaching a wider audience to raise visibility around the challenges faced by LGBTQ youth. It's also a heck of a lot of fun. If this sounds like something you'd be interested in, please get in touch! Pride planning has already begun...
07040.title: Help an LGBTQ nonprofit!

07042.description: We are an organization located in northern NJ focused on building self-sufficiency among recently resettled Syrian families. We are an event-driven fundraising organization and are looking for someone with excellent communication skills to manage our social media strategy. We estimate about 10 hours a week and would prefer to work in-person (Montclair NJ ) a couple of times a month. Execute social media strategy on WIX website, Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, Snap and other media channels. Review reports to establish and monitor audience engagement. Generate, edit, publish and share daily content (original text, images, video or HTML) that builds meaningful connections and encourages the community to take action. Maintain Wix website; optimize company pages within each platform to increase the visibility of company’s social content Moderate all user-generated content in line with policies Create editorial calendars and syndication schedules Continuously improve by capturing and analyzing the appropriate social data/metrics, insights and best practices, and then acting on the information Collaborate with small team to manage reputation and protect sensitive community members.
07042.title: Social Media Marketing Specialist

07042.description: Hello Eager Volunteers! We are looking for volunteers that can help the American Cancer Fund raise money via sponsorship, event vendors, endowments, and in-kind donations. This person should be local to New Jersey and be willing to go out and speak with people about our organization (after training) with our Development Director to solicit new partners, brands and companies looking for philanthropic efforts. Individuals just need to have a passion for helping people, working with a non-profit cancer charity, have their own reliable transportation, and be a people person with excellent communication skills (verbal and written).
07042.title: Volunteer Fundraisers

07042.description: We are an organization located in northern NJ focused on building self-sufficiency among recently resettled Syrian families. We are looking for someone who will help with our accounting and QuickBooks data entry. We'd love if you are a bookkeeper, accountant and understand fund-raising and non-profit finances. We have our current files organized but are open to suggestions. QuickBooks experience is essential. We estimate about 5 hours a week and prefer to work in-person (Montclair NJ) a couple of times a month.
07042.title: Quickbooks bookkeeper for a program helping resettled Syrian families in NNJ

07042.description: Be a Hospice Volunteer! Hospice Volunteers are needed for supportive visits to patients, offering emotional support and companionship. Volunteers can read to patients, hold their hand, talk and pray with them, write letters, be a good listener, or various other supportive acts. We offer free Hospice training. Compassionate Care Hospice is recruiting volunteers to work with our hospice patients and their families in home settings, assisted living settings, and nursing facilities near you! (Passaic County, Bergen County, Essex County, Hudson County, Union County) Please Call Volunteer Coordinator Shweta Sharma 973-916-1400 or email shweta.sharma@cchnet.net
07042.title: Be a hospice volunteer in Essex County

07042.description: If you have an hour or more per week to give, Ascend Hospice welcomes your gifts of time and compassion. Whether you choose to work directly with patients and families or to volunteer in one of many other ways, you can make a profound difference in someone's life, including your own. Volunteers are an integral part of the hospice team. Ascend Hospice serves counties throughout New Jersey. Areas where you are needed include: Atlantic County, Bergen County, Cape May County, Essex County, Hudson County, Mercer County, Middlesex County, Monmouth County, Morris County, North Passaic County, Ocean County, Somerset County, South Passaic County, Burlington County, Camden County and Union County. Sometimes all it takes is a smile or sharing a story to make somone feel important. All Modalities are welcome. Volunteer Opportunities: Companionship Volunteers work directly with patients providing companionship, offering friendly visits, reading to patients, writing letters, offering a gentle touch or sharing a quiet moment. Complementary Volunteers are certified/trained professionals who can provide complementary modalities of reflexologly, music, Reiki, & massage. Ascend Hospice is seeking certified Reiki practioners to serve our end of life population in finding comfort, relaxation and peace during their final time with us. Your assistance is needed with reducing anxiety, relieving pain and providing a safe , comfortable environment. Training provided for volunteers. Reiki Certification is required. Pet Therapy Volunteers provide companionship from our certified therapy dogs. Pet therapy provides numerous benefits like encouraging movement and physical stimulation and it provides mental benefits like socialization, mental stimulation, companionship, and unconditional love. Please consider sharing your loving pet with us and bring some much needed smiles. Pets must be certified as therapy animals by an organization like TDI Therapy Dogs International- see website here http://www.tdi-dog.org/ Music Volunteers are volunteers who specialize in sharing songs or instrumental music with patients and their loved ones. Whether the Music Volunteer is sharing an existing musical skill or playing music via the radio or digital device, the goal is to enhance the quality of life of our patients. Often, regularly scheduled visits are requested, however Music Volunteers may also be asked to provide musical visits on an occasional basis for one patient/family or for a group of patients at a facility as outreach for the local hospice agency. Hospice is built on the philosophy that we care for our patients in mind, body and soul. Craft Volunteers consist of individuals or groups who touch patients in a special way by making lap blankets, shawls, memory bears and other articles for patients to enjoy. Bereavement Volunteers offer support to the families of patients who have passed. During the grieving process the bereavement volunteer can be a valuable resource, especially for those who lack a solid support network. They often make phone calls to check up on family members and also send cards of comfort and care. For more information about our free volunteer training and available opportunities, call our Volunteer Department or visit our website at Ascendhospice.com! We look forward to hearing from you! Please do not contact me with unsolicited services or offers.
07042.title: Hospice Volunteers - Companion, Music, Pet Therapy, Reiki - Montclair

07042.description: The ultimate goal of our program is to help young people become productively engaged adult citizens-law-abiding, connected to meaningful work, in healthy relationships, and living in healthy environments. African American boys are likely to experience different outcomes as adults as, they face disproportionately high rates of suspension, expulsion, and drop out from high school, and are more likely to go to prison than to go to college, and to father children they will not live with or parent. We welcome all young men in the program, no matter their background, and look forward to inspiring them to reach for their personal greatness.
07042.title: Do you have a passion for working with teens?
07042.org: STRATEGIC MENTORING / Brother to Brother Mentoring Program

07042.description: Start Out Fresh Intervention Advocates, fondly referred to as S.O.F.I.A., is a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization that provides advocacy, support services, and referrals for temporary housing for \"at risk\" women and children of domestic violence. S.O.F.I.A is seeking volunteers. We are looking for empathetic individuals with great administrative, organizational, social media, marketing and communication skills. We are also seeking individuals to train to become certified domestic violence advocates and/or to answer calls for general inquiries. Ideally, we would like volunteers to start as soon as possible. Once you contact us, we will send you a brief volunteer application and be in touch with you shortly. Thank you!
07042.title: Start Out Fresh Intervention Advocates Seeks Volunteers!
07042.org: SOFIA - Start Out Fresh Intervention Advocates

07042.description: Retired & Senior Volunteer Program (RSVP) RSVP Center of Essex and Hudson Counties is a comprehensive community service organization sponsored by JFS MetroWest designed to mobilize members of the community who are 55+ to give back to their own neighborhoods in Essex and Hudson counties through volunteer services. For potential volunteers, RSVP Center of Essex and Hudson Counties provides a single location where they can review a number of local volunteer opportunities and receive the help of a trained Volunteer Coordinator. This assistance ensures that volunteers are placed in a position that matches their skills, desired time commitment and interests. Eligibility Adults who are at least 55 years of age are eligible for the RSVP program Benefits Participate in meaningful, challenging, and interesting volunteer opportunities Meet new people and make new friends Learn new skills or share current abilities with others Receive free supplemental accident, liability, and automobile insurance while traveling to and from volunteer assignments Attend an annual recognition event RSVP Center of Essex and Hudson Counties has numerous volunteer opportunities available throughout our service area. Each volunteer opportunity is different; requiring different skills, level of commitment, and training.A few examples of some of the opportunities available are: Be a mentor to a student who is struggling in school Aid seniors with daily tasks such as bill paying Provide support to victims of domestic violence IF YOU WOULD LIKE TO LEARN MORE ABOUT THESE OR OTHER OPPORTUNITIES CONTACT STEPHANIE GROVE AT 973-637-1766 OR SGROVE@JFSMETROWEST.ORG.
07042.title: Volunteer Center for 55+

07042.description: Volunteers needed to tutor children afterschool Monday - Friday between the hours of 3PM - 6PM. Children range in age from 1st grade through high school depending on the program. Volunteers must commit to a minimum of volunteering one day a week. When able, volunteers will be matched with the same student each week. Students mostly need assistance with homework and staying on task. Volunteers with experience in math and science are especially in demand. Volunteers must be age 55 or over.
07042.title: Tutor Children

07042.description: We are looking for academic tutors, as well as squash volunteers in Montclair, NJ! StreetSquash-Newark is an academic and athletic after-school program serving students in the 7th-12th grade. We are looking for volunteer tutors, and volunteer squash players for all weekdays in Montclair. Tutors: StreetSquash Newark Academic Tutors work with 1-2 students during after-school homework sessions. Our tutors assist 9th - 12th-grade students with math, English, history and science homework. These sessions occur from 3:45-6:00 pm every weekday at the Montclair YMCA under the supervision of our Academic Director. Squash Coaches: StreetSquash Newark Volunteer Squash Players join StreetSquash students on the courts for basic drills, training, and games. Squash players of all levels are needed for our practice from 3:45-6:00 pm every weekday at the Montclair YMCA. These sessions are led and supervised by our Squash Director. The best thing about becoming a StreetSquash volunteer is meeting great young people and making a difference in their lives - whether you can make it once a week or once in awhile, we encourage you to get involved. Please contact us with your interest and availability to tutor in our academic sessions, or to assist with Squash practices! If you are interested in volunteering with StreetSquash Newark at our Montclair facility, please complete our volunteer application here: http://streetsquash.org/newark/volunteer/. If you have questions, please e-mail Bomaya at bomaya@streetsquashnj.org or call 973.848.9600.
07042.title: Change a life- become a tutor or squash coach!

07043.description: Welcome to Savannah’s Cards’ 4 Kids, Volunteers! It is an amazing program with amazing results, lifting the hearts and spirits of children in need! Click \"I Want to Help!\" to receive our Program's Informational PDF file! Represent your School, Club, Organization or yourself on our website with a Gallery of your Cards' 4 Kids! Put a smile on a Kid's face with a personal handmade card from YOU! Earn your Certificate of Appreciation and Community Service Hours. Meet great Volunteers like you and share your experience. Join Savannah’s Cards’ 4 Kids Program Today! Please visit up on Our Website: http://mycharity4kids.org/savannahscardsandcakes4kids/ So get your supplies and be creative! Take pictures of the Before and After so we can upload them on our Cards 4 Kids Gallery! As always, we thank you very much and wish you a beautiful day everyday! Thank you, Volunteer One
07043.title: Cards 4 Kids! Make a Child smile TODAY! =D

07043.description: MusicLink is in need of experienced music teachers in New Jersey. With MusicLink, students (children under 18 years old) who show an interest in taking music lessons, but cannot afford full fee lessons, are linked with qualified music teachers willing to reduce their fee by at least half to make the lessons more affordable. MusicLink teachers are able to take advantage of a variety of offers and discounts from our growing list of Business Partners as well as additional benefits directly from our foundation. MusicLink teachers are qualified, professional teachers seeking to share their love of music with a deserving child. All MusicLink teachers are required to pass a criminal background check. Please see our website for more information: www.musiclinkfoundation.org .
07043.title: Music Teachers for Underprivileged Children

07043.description: The Arts Unbound Showcase on Bellevue Ave is looking for new volunteers. We have a rotating inventory of fine art, prints, ceramics, jewelry, and gifts by artists with disabilities. Volunteers staff the store, help people select art, ring up sales, and answer questions about our artist coaching and arts education programs. Volunteers must take at least one 2-hour shift per month. Training times are flexible.
07043.title: Store Volunteers

07043.description: Volunteer to post our Online Opportunities and gain Community Service hours! We want this to go Viral by 2018 ! Help us reach 1Mill Contact your friends and everyone you know on Social Media and Join in on ths Event! Face Book Instagram Twitter other Social Media Send us pictures and clips of your Postings! Be part of Americas fasting growing Virtual On-Line Opportunity Charitable Organization! Have some Fun with us while Helping our Charity Grow! Interns and Team Leaders needed for this Campaign! Sign on NOW!
07043.title: ONLINE VOLUTEERING

07043.description: Protect our environment and the special place in which we live! Citizens’ Climate Lobby (CCL) wants you! As a volunteer, you’ll be a member of the fastest growing and most effective climate advocacy group. You will work with concerned New Jersey citizens to slow the effects of climate change. Let's work together to protect our beautiful ecosystems, livelihoods and way of life. Please respond to our posting for an invitation to learn more. You will: Meet with Congressional leaders. Write letters to the editors and op-eds. Meet with local media. Educate your community about global warming and legislative solutions. We provide: Monthly national conference calls with expert guest speakers. Weekly skill building sessions. On-line network with CCL volunteers across the U.S. National conference and lobby week in D.C. Volunteers commit to an average of 4-6 hours a month. Some of our volunteers dedicate more time than that. We hold no upper limit on your dedication to a stable climate and livable world. To learn more about us, please join an Introductory Conference Call. The next call is Wednesday at 5:00 p.m. Pacific/6:00 p.m. Mountain/7:00 p.m. Central/8:00 p.m. Eastern. This is an opportunity to learn about CCL. It is one hour, and there will be opportunities to ask questions. The conference call number is 1-866-642-1665, passcode 440699#.
07043.title: Sustainable Climate Environment Advocate Montclair NJ

11545.description: On June 14, AHRC Nassau will be hosting an all day Staff Appreciation Event, celebrating our staff and all of the amazing work that they do. We are looking for volunteers to assist with the days festivities. Possible ways to help include: collecting and distributing raffle tickets signing people up for wellness opportunities such as massages and yoga helping with badminton and volleyball tournaments assisting with other games and entertainment activities. This is a perfect opportunity for groups or people seeking community service hours. The event will take place from 11am to 7pm at our Brookville Campus and we can tailor your time slot to match your availability. No application needed simply contact the volunteer coordinator to discuss your availability. Help us remind our staff of how important they are. For more information about this or other volunteer opportunities contact Justin McDannell at 516-626-1000 ext. 1303 or jmcdannell@ahrc.org.
11545.title: Help Us Celebrate Our Staff!

11545.description: AHRC Nassau serves the developmentally and intellectually disabled throughout Nassau County. In partnership with families and local community leadership we strive to promote independence and inclusion for the people that we support. Currently our accounting department, located on our main campus in Brookville, is looking for volunteers to assist with the sorting, organizing and storing of files. Volunteers may also be asked to assist with answering phones or other general office tasks. Volunteers will need to be available at least once or twice a week between the hours of 9am and 5pm. Other requirements: submit an online application attend a one hour orientation For more information about this or other volunteer opportunities please contact the volunteer coordinator at jmcdannell@ahrc.org or 516-626-1000 ext. 1303. To apply today go to www.ahrc.volunteerhub.com.
11545.title: Assist our Accounting Department

11545.description: Help us to create experiences that will increase peoples independence and confidence. You can play an important role in the life of a person with a disability and give them something to look forward to every week. This is an amazing opportunity for you to share skills, passions and interests with the people supported by this agency. Volunteer opportunities are available in the evenings and on the weekends at group homes throughout Nassau and Suffolk Counties. ComeUnity Recreation and Sports is always looking for enthusiastic and active volunteers to assist with one of many ongoing opportunities. From September through June there are recreation nights twice a week, dances three times a month, the social exchange group as well as other events, trips and outings. We have multiple sports teams that practice and compete throughout the year including Basketball, Track and field, Softball and Skiing. Our members are adults with developmental disabilities looking for fun ways to get moving, get some exercise and learn some new dance moves. The club will be starting up again on February 27th and will meet every Tuesday starting at 6:30pm on our Brookville campus. The culmination for the club is a performance at the agencies annual Rose Bud Ball in the spring. Applicants must be at least 16 years old and must complete: online application orientation training For more information about this or other volunteer opportunities contact Justin McDannell at 516-626-1000 x. 1303 or jmcdannell@ahrc.org. 10708.description: Do you enjoy making a difference with interesting conversation, and helping students over a cup of coffee or chocolate? Sign up for Table Wisdom's innovative online program to mentor a recently admitted international student as he or she attends a university in the U.S. or a young professional. You will video-chat with your mentee and provide them with an opportunity to practice conversational English, learn about American culture and practical living, and share information about their own culture. Some of the mentees in the past have attended U.S. schools like the University of Southern California and Washington University in St. Louis. You (or someone you know) must be a native (or fluent) English language speaker, 50+ years old, know how to video-chat (Skype, Face Time, or a similar program), be available once a week for 55 minutes at a time, and willing to work with the time zone difference of your mentee. After four weeks, you can decide if you would like to continue. If not, then simply let us know and we'll take care of the rest! If you find fulfillment in chatting, learning about different cultures, and sharing your wisdom, then this is the perfect program for you. Please watch this short 1-minute video to give you an idea: http://bit.ly/2pBMKEb Thanks and we look forward to hearing from you!
10708.title: Do You Like to Chat?  Have Fun and Video-chat with Our Foreign-Born Students!

07950.description: This outdoor hands-on class teaches the safe, easy and effective way to learn to ride on two wheels. Using this \"balance first\" method, parents help get their children rolling while the child does most of the work. Participants learn the basics of balancing, starting, stopping and steering a bike as well as proper helmet fit and adjustment. Volunteers will be given training on how to fit a helmet and how to make minor bike adjustments. As a volunteer at this event, we need your help with the following: o Assist instructors with bicycle preparation o Removing bike pedals o Lowering seats o Bike sizing o Tire inflation o Brake check o Provide assistance guiding children through the course o Ability to work and stand in the sun for 3-4 hours o Ability to bend o Ability to jog behind the children’s bikes if necessary
07950.title: Help Kids Learn to Ride a Bike!
