10474.title: CHURCH TOUR GUIDE

10474.description: West Side Campaign Against Hunger Mission Through a supermarket-style food pantry, West Side Campaign Against Hunger alleviates hunger and creates a culture that promotes self-reliance and works for change. West Side Campaign Against Hunger changes our perception of hungry people by working in partnership with them, providing food with dignity, and empowering customers to find solutions. Mobile Pantry Program Overview Our new Mobile Pantry Program works in partnerships with other agencies (Community Based Non-profits, Health Centers, Churches, and Senior Centers) bringing our customer-choice pantry model to neighborhoods in need, while making sure our customers are connected to resources in their neighborhoods. The Mobile Pantry is a specially designed truck staffed with a Pantry Manager/Driver, Community Resource Counselor, and Program Manager. Location & Shifts: 309 Drake Street Bronx, NY, 10474 Mondays, 9:30am-1pm/1:30-5pm Qualifications/Requirements: Must be at least 18 years old Experience working at a supermarket or food pantry preferred, though not required. Excellent communication and organizational skills Ability to lift up to 25lbs Can-do attitude and flexibility General understanding of food income insecurity and how it affects New York City. Responsibilities: Participate in an orientation before start date Assist MP staff with receiving food from our suppliers Ensure food is examined and apply quality control as needed Organize and repack inventory Assist with cleaning Participate in special projects based on need HOW TO APPLY Please contact Becker Rosales at brosales@wscah.org.
10474.title: Volunteer with WSCAH Mobile Pantry!

10471.description: On Saturday, June 9, 2018 at 9:00 a.m., the Cristian Rivera Foundation is having their 1 st Annual Cristian Rivera Foundation 5K Walk/Run and we need your help. We are looking for volunteers to help with various tasks before, during and after the 5K. For your help, breakfast and lunch will be provided. All shifts start at 6:30 a.m., please note that all volunteers need to be 18 and over. For more information email us your name and # to: volunteers@cristianriverafoundation.org. Be a part of our team to help find a cure for DIPG. Thank you in advance. \"Full Steam Ahead\"
10471.title: Volunteers for 1st Annual Cristian Rivera Foundation 5K Walk/Run

10471.description: If you are patient, caring, understanding, friendly, and available one just morning per week, you can make a real difference in the lives of those we serve. Our wonderful volunteers provide personalized weekday calls to homebound elderly, providing social contact, while also listening for signals indicating a homebound participant requires additional support. In many cases, this weekly phone call is the only outside contact these people have all week. We provide all training and support. Your fellow volunteers on the team are a really friendly, fun group. You'll have a great time interacting with them as you do this important work. Also, as a thank you, we take our volunteers on special outings, whether to the New York Botanical Gardens for a private tour and lunch, a holiday luncheon, or other activities.
10471.title: Senior Telephone Reassurance Program

10471.description: The Riverdale Neighborhood House is seeking a Marketing and Promotion Associate to get involved in all marketing aspects of our highly successful Health & Harmony Programs. Launched in October of 2015, we offer classes geared to nourishing people's spiritual selves, and to fortify and improve mind and body to enable a longer, healthier and more fulfilling life. Meditation, yoga, coping with grief workshops, high intensity interval training, Pilates and a theater group constitute only a partial list of our offerings. The ideal candidate will have marketing/promotion experience, social media expertise, an entrepreneurial and creative spirit, and want a hands-on role. This is an amazing opportunity to have an exciting, well-rounded experience as we take the Health & Harmony programs to the next level. You'll strategize, apply your marketing and promotion ideas, knowledge and experience, and see results very quickly! Here is the link to our facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/HealthHarmonyNH/
10471.title: Marketing and Promotion Associate

07109.description: Hospital Elder Life Program: Recipient of the 2017 Hospital Award for Volunteer Excellence The Hospital Elder Life Program is a program that aims to provide extra attention and care to patients admitted to the hospital. Program goals Maintain physical and cognitive functioning throughout hospitalization Provide excellent care to the older adult population What can I gain as a volunteer? Experience working with older adults Interest and experience in the field of healthcare Confidence working with patients Satisfaction in knowing you helped improve the hospital stay of older adults by providing healing music therapy Clara Maass Medical Center was able to launch HELP through a generous grant from The Healthcare Foundation of New Jersey.
07109.title: Music therapy for older adults

11561.description: MJHS Hospice provides a specialized program of care and services for end-of-life patients. MJHS Hospice provides care for pediatric and adult patients in homes, nursing homes, assisted living communities, inpatient facilities and hospitals. MJHS Hospice Volunteer opportunities include: Providing support and companionship to patients and their families Participating in leisure activities such as reading, listening to music, playing games with patients Supporting or organizing group activities for patients Listening compassionately to patients and their families Providing office or clerical support for our hospice team Complementary therapies Requirements for all categories of volunteers: 18 years or older 15 hours of training (4 hours training for clerical/office volunteers) Background Check (no charge to applicant) Medical Clearance (no charge to applicant) 3-4 hours per week 1 year commitment Required skills for patient visits: discretion, patience, compassion and dedication Preferred clerical and office support skills include: receptionist skills, computer skills, organizational skills and filing For more information on how to become a MJHS Hospice Volunteer please call: Queens and Nassau: Denise Jones, Volunteer Coordinator; 347-633-3421 or DEJONES@MJHS.ORG
11561.title: Be Part of Someone's Legacy--Become a Hospice Volunteer in Nassau County!

10577.description: Take Steps for Crohn's & Colitis Foundation is a charity fundraising 5K Run/Walk that celebrates the dedication to the IBD community. Our walk festival is an afternoon filled with games for the whole family, music, bounce house, face painting and great food.
10577.title: Volunteers needed for Take Steps for Crohn's & Colitis 5K Run/Walk on Sunday, June 10, 2018

10577.description: The ALS Association Greater New York Chapter needs YOUR help! With the 2018 Westchester Walk to Defeat ALS approaching, we hope you will be able to volunteer with us to help make this year’s Walk a success. Almost 190 walkers have raised over $40,000 dollars to date! We need your help on the day of the event to ensure that everyone has a great experience. Because of the energy and support that our volunteers provide on the day, our walkers come back year after year to enjoy the Walk! When: Sunday, June 24th Where: Manhattanville College, Purchase, NY Registration opens at 9:00AM, opening ceremonies are at 10:30AM and the Walk begins at 11:00AM, so we’ll need people to volunteer before and/or during the Walk. You can pick whichever time slot that would work best for you! We can provide up to 6 hours of community service! _________________________________________________________________________ If you are interested, please email vjung@als-ny.org with: 1. Full Name (and those volunteering with you) 2. Walk(s) you would like to volunteer at 3. Cell Phone # 4. What time slot between 8:00AM-1:00PM are you available? (Time slots include 8AM-11AM, 11AM-1PM, 8AM-1PM) 5 . Do you have any physical limitations? 6. Are you (or anyone with you) under 18? *If under 18, we need to have a signed permission slip prior to volunteering _________________________________________________________________________ Positions include**: Registration Food Parking Marshal Walk Marshal Water Station T-Shirts Kids Zone Tribute Banner Cheer Photographer Assistant Early Bird Set-Up **will be chosen based on availability and time commitment If you have any questions or concerns, please contact Vivian Jung at 212-720-3043 _________________________________________________________________________ You can register for the Walks at alswalks.org or call Meg Emery at 212-720-3049 Interested in becoming a local partner? Learn more about our Chapter's Corporate Partnership Opportunities and the impact your company can have right here in our community. Contact Jillian Saperstein 212-720-3052 | jsaperstein@als-ny.org
10577.title: Westchester Walk to Defeat ALS
10577.org: The ALS Association Greater New York Chapter

10570.description: American Youth Table Tennis Organization and/or ZYP! Sports LLC seeks an aspiring college intern or senior adult with an interest in business and finance to assist the organization with its accounting, bookkeeping, and financial reporting. Primary Duties: Bank Reconciliation, Posting Journal Entries, an Generating Financial Reports, and Assisting The Director. Candidate will learn business accounting and gain valuable business insight into online software - Xero or Quickbooks. As a successful volunteer you will receive full acknowledgement of contributed hours, and opportunity to obtain future references. Position is unpaid, but may lead to a paid position in the future.
10570.title: Financial Reporting, Accounting, Bookkeeping

10570.description: Opportunity: American Youth Table Tennis (AYTTO) and or ZYP! Sports seeks one or two dedicated high school, college or senior volunteers to assist in building the organization / company existing social media and digital marketing strategy. AYTTO is a not for profit organization committed to providing school aged children in New York City an opportunity to participate in engaging after school programs. Our website is www.aytto.org AYTTO. We work in partnership with ZYP Sports, an online table tennis company that has national website. Expectations: The individual who applies for this volunteer position should have an interest and aptidude in social media - YouTube, Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and in Google, Bing and Amazon digital marketing platforms. As an Intern, you will choose, develop and implement a small marketing campaign and track and analyze results. In the process you learn key marketing, implementing and evaluation techniques prevalent in today's business marketplace. Interns will receive full acknowledgement contributed hours, name recognition on finished product and opportunity to network amongst our friends and ability obtain future references. Position is unpaid (or stipend based), but may lead to a paid position in the future, depending on whether the project can drive additional dollars. For more information contact bennisbet@aytto.org.
10570.title: Social Media,  Digital Media, Data Analytics Internship Positions

10570.description: Opportunity: American Youth Table Tennis (AYTTO) and or ZYP! Sports seeks one or two dedicated high school, college or volunteers to create short table tennis instruction films at the Westchester Table Tennis Center and/or PS 126 in lower Manhattan. About Us: AYTTO is a not for profit organization committed to providing school aged children in New York City an opportunity to participate in engaging after school programs. Our website is www.aytto.org AYTTO has a working partnership with two premier New York City Table tennis clubs - Westchester Table Tennis Center. / www.westchestertabletennis.com/ and SPiN New York www.spinyc.com/. We also have a for profit business, TableTennisStore that sells table tennis equipment nationally. The two businesses are linked. Expectations: The individual who applies for this volunteer position should have an interest in film and film editing and posting these videos to social media. Footage will be shot of children or elite athletes playing table tennis and then edited using computer software and loaded up onto a \"Youtube\" account. As a successful volunteer you will receive full acknowledgement contributed hours, name recognition on finished product and opportunity to future references. Position is unpaid, but may lead to a paid position in the future, depending on whether the project can drive additional donation dollars. For more information contact bennisbet@aytto.org.
10570.title: Film Production - Social Media Internship

07764.description: We're looking to raise funds, awareness, and Bike MS to support the thousands of people living multiple sclerosis in our NJ Metro Area. Join us as a volunteer to do your part! The luggage team is responsible for helping move participants bikes on and off our truck. This includes heavy lifting! We hope you enjoy a workout!
07764.title: We Need a Luggage Team for Bike MS!
07764.org: National Multiple Sclerosis Society - New Jersey Metro Chapter

07764.description: Monmouth University 400 Cedar Avenue West Long Branch, NJ 07764 You can bring us closer to a world free of MS. Volunteering for Bike MS is fun with an important purpose. We unite as a community during Bike MS to make a powerful statement - to pedal toward a cure. Bike MS Coast the Coast will take place on Saturday, May 19 and Sunday, May 20. Cyclists and volunteers will participate in support of our mission to mobilize people and resources to drive research for a cure and to address the challenges of everyone affected by MS. We are looking for massage therapists for our finish line celebration! (business cards, flyers). SATURDAY, May 19 2018 FINISH LINE @ Monmouth University, West Long Branch, NJ 10:00AM - 3:00PM
07764.title: Volunteer at Bike MS as a Massage Therapist!
07764.org: National Multiple Sclerosis Society - New Jersey Metro Chapter

07764.description: We need volunteers to help us; Set-up and break down tables, tents, and chairs Check-in cyclists Cheer at the start line Pass out t-shirts, water, and snacks This is a great opportunity to bond with groups of friends and or coworkers while joining the movement to end MS forever. If you are interested, contact Michelle Almeida at Michelle.Almeida@nmss.org or visit BikeMS.org!
07764.title: Volunteer at Bike MS Coast the Coast 2018!!
07764.org: National Multiple Sclerosis Society - New Jersey Metro Chapter

07764.description: We are in need of SAG (Saftey and Gear Support) drivers for our Coast the Coast Bike MS! Our bike starts at Monmounth University and ends in Point Pleasant Beach. SAG drivers follow cyclists throughout this sceneic route to provide support if needed. If a participant's tire pops, or if they are tired and need to be picked up and taken to the next rest stop, the SAG drivers will assist. We do ask that our drivers complete a background and motorvehicle check. You will be provide with a one of our company vehicles, bike equipment, refreshments, a radio, and a volunteer t-shirt! If you are interested please contact Michelle Almeida at Michelle.Almeida@nmss.org or call 732-660-1005.
07764.title: Route Support Drivers for Bike MS Needed!
07764.org: National Multiple Sclerosis Society - New Jersey Metro Chapter

11249.description: Note: we are seeking \"otherwise-employed\" volunteers, but our goal is for the position to become a paid full time position by January. The Development Director will develop and implement fundraising strategies for the Autoimmune Registry. The position reports to the Executive Director and is located in New York City. Job Duties: Develop and implement fundraising strategies and campaigns to find donors, including companies and individuals, whose philanthropic goals align with ARI. Build relationships with donors to retain and upgrade their financial involvement. Work with the Executive Director to set annual fundraising goals and implement business strategies and best practices to achieve those goals. Coordinate volunteer efforts to leverage their help in fundraising activities Continually seek to improve and maintain fundraising skills, including maintaining knowledge of current trends in fundraising. Other related duties as assigned. Required Skills Ability to learn quickly by researching new concepts and organizations Strong written and oral communication skills Experience in fund raising or outside sales that involves building and maintaining sales relationship Ability and willingness to travel as position demands Ability to work outside standard hours as needed, including occasional evenings and weekends Proficiency in common business technologies. Basic website management skills a plus. Ability to balance priorities and track progress towards goals Additional Requirements Initiative Metacognition Passion
11249.title: Development Director - Volunteer to Full Time

11249.description: We are seeking board members with a personal connection to someone suffering from one of the 140 autoimmune diseases that we track in our Autoimmune Registry. Prior board experience required. We are just getting started and need someone who can provide insights into board development.
11249.title: Board Members

07760.description: Join us for our annual Bike MS: Coast the Coast 2018 as one of our Rest Stop volunteers! Rest Stop volunteers liven up our Bike MS route for our cyclists! Assist with rest stop set up, water and snack replenishment, cheering on our cyclists and rest stop breakdown. We very much want our rest stops to be a celebration, as we are trying to support those whose lives are affected by MS. THIS YEAR WE WANT YOU TO DECORATE OUR REST STOP! Along the route there will be themed rest stops from Mardi Gras, Super Heroes to the Royal Wedding. Feel free to choose one of our themes or pick your own! Groups are welcome!
07760.title: Join the party! Volunteer at our Bike MS Rest Stop in Sea Bright!
07760.org: National Multiple Sclerosis Society - New Jersey Metro Chapter

07407.description: If you have an hour or more per week to give, Ascend Hospice welcomes your gifts of time and compassion. Whether you choose to work directly with patients and families or to volunteer in one of many other ways, you can make a profound difference in someone's life, including your own. Volunteers are an integral part of the hospice team. Ascend Hospice serves counties throughout New Jersey. Areas where you are needed include: Atlantic County, Bergen County, Cape May County, Essex County, Hudson County, Mercer County, Middlesex County, Monmouth County, Morris County, North Passaic County, Ocean County, Somerset County, South Passaic County, Burlington County, Camden County and Union County. Sometimes all it takes is a smile or sharing a story to make somone feel important. All Modalities are welcome. Volunteer Opportunities: Companionship Volunteers work directly with patients providing companionship, offering friendly visits, reading to patients, writing letters, offering a gentle touch or sharing a quiet moment. Complementary Volunteers are certified/trained professionals who can provide complementary modalities of reflexologly, music, Reiki, & massage. Ascend Hospice is seeking certified Reiki practioners to serve our end of life population in finding comfort, relaxation and peace during their final time with us. Your assistance is needed with reducing anxiety, relieving pain and providing a safe , comfortable environment. Training provided for volunteers. Reiki Certification is required. Pet Therapy Volunteers provide companionship from our certified therapy dogs. Pet therapy provides numerous benefits like encouraging movement and physical stimulation and it provides mental benefits like socialization, mental stimulation, companionship, and unconditional love. Please consider sharing your loving pet with us and bring some much needed smiles. Pets must be certified as therapy animals by an organization like TDI Therapy Dogs International- see website here http://www.tdi-dog.org/ Music Volunteers are volunteers who specialize in sharing songs or instrumental music with patients and their loved ones. Whether the Music Volunteer is sharing an existing musical skill or playing music via the radio or digital device, the goal is to enhance the quality of life of our patients. Often, regularly scheduled visits are requested, however Music Volunteers may also be asked to provide musical visits on an occasional basis for one patient/family or for a group of patients at a facility as outreach for the local hospice agency. Hospice is built on the philosophy that we care for our patients in mind, body and soul. Craft Volunteers consist of individuals or groups who touch patients in a special way by making lap blankets, shawls, memory bears and other articles for patients to enjoy. Bereavement Volunteers offer support to the families of patients who have passed. During the grieving process the bereavement volunteer can be a valuable resource, especially for those who lack a solid support network. They often make phone calls to check up on family members and also send cards of comfort and care. For more information about our free volunteer training and available opportunities, call our Volunteer Department or visit our website at Ascendhospice.com! We look forward to hearing from you! Please do not contact me with unsolicited services or offers.
07407.title: Hospice Volunteers - Companion, Music, Pet Therapy, Reiki - Elmwood Park

10080.description: This event is available at different times throughout the week! 5-5:30 PM, every Monday-Friday OR 6-6:30 PM, every Saturday & Sunday! Help get excess bagels donated from a really great food business! The final destination will be the NYC Rescue Mission at 90 Lafayette Street. Middleweight: the average amount of food is 15-20 pounds. Sign up directly on our calendar: http://www.rescuingleftovercuisine.org/calendar
10080.title: Stop Food Waste & Feed the Hungry in FiDi!

07401.description: Be a Hospice Volunteer! Hospice Volunteers are needed for supportive visits to patients, offering emotional support and companionship. Volunteers can read to patients, hold their hand, talk and pray with them, write letters, be a good listener, or various other supportive acts. We offer free Hospice training. Compassionate Care Hospice is recruiting volunteers to work with our hospice patients and their families in home settings, assisted living settings, and nursing facilities near you! (Passaic County, Bergen County, Essex County, Hudson County, Union County) Please Call Volunteer Coordinator Shweta Sharma 973-916-1400 or email shweta.sharma@cchnet.net
07401.title: Be a hospice volunteer in Bergen County

Volunteers can read to patients, hold their hand, talk and pray with them, write letters, be a good listener, or various other supportive acts. We offer free Hospice training. Compassionate Care Hospice is recruiting volunteers to work with our hospice patients and their families in home settings, assisted living settings, and nursing facilities near you! (Passaic County, Bergen County, Essex County, Hudson County, Union County) Please Call Volunteer Coordinator Shweta Sharma 973-916-1400 or email shweta.sharma@cchnet.net

08817.description: Voluntees are needed to visit group homes for adults with developmental disabilities to play games, lead socialization activities, share an interest or skill with the group like arts and crafts, music , mild exercise etc.
08817.title: Friendly  Visitor

08817.description: Assist taxpayers with completing Intake forms, including conducting interviews Assist Tax Preparers & Quality Reviewers by getting taxpayers documents ready Scan/Copy and prepare virtual tax packages Have taxpayers sign returns, prepared completed packages and provide mailing information. Please visit bit.ly/2yiPVDN for more information
08817.title: Client Intake/Interview Specialists for VITA - 2018 Tax Season - Training

08817.description: Protect our environment and the special place in which we live! Citizens’ Climate Lobby (CCL) wants you! As a volunteer, you’ll be a member of the fastest growing and most effective climate advocacy group. You will work with concerned New Jersey citizens to slow the effects of climate change. Let's work together to protect our beautiful ecosystems, livelihoods and way of life. Please respond to our posting for an invitation to learn more. You will: Meet with Congressional leaders. Write letters to the editors and op-eds. Meet with local media. Educate your community about global warming and legislative solutions. We provide: Monthly national conference calls with expert guest speakers. Weekly skill building sessions. On-line network with CCL volunteers across the U.S. National conference and lobby week in D.C. Volunteers commit to an average of 4-6 hours a month. Some of our volunteers dedicate more time than that. We hold no upper limit on your dedication to a stable climate and livable world. To learn more about us, please join an Introductory Conference Call. The next call is Wednesday at 5:00 p.m. Pacific/6:00 p.m. Mountain/7:00 p.m. Central/8:00 p.m. Eastern. This is an opportunity to learn about CCL. It is one hour, and there will be opportunities to ask questions. The conference call number is 1-866-642-1665, passcode 440699#.
08817.title: Sustainable Climate Environment Advocate Edison NJ

11412.description: About Are you interested in a rewarding field that works closely with individuals who have intellectual and developmental disabilities? Would you like to share your interests with someone who enjoys it just as much as you? Partners Health Plan, a not for profit health plan that supports the lives of individuals with developmental and intellectual disabilities, is looking for volunteers for The PAL Program. The PAL Program discovers a member’s passion, interests, and matches up the individual with a person or place in the community sharing a similar passion or interest. We discover what you enjoy and how it could potentially match with a member of PHP. Member Information 25 year old male who would like to spend time with someone who he goes to the movies with, shopping at the mall, and bowling. He has a mild intellectual disability, is very ambitious and sweet, and is also very independent! How does it work? Meet with individual once a week, or once bi-weekly depending on schedule flexibility First outing will always be accompanied by Community Resource Coordinator Provide your own transportation to meet the individual at the destination Provide your own funding for outings (will only be paying for self, individuals expenses are covered by themselves) Report to community resource coordinator with updates on the progress of outings Form natural friendship with individual based on similar interests Benefits Receive an optional professional reference upon completion of program Join an incredible community of passionate staff and volunteers Hours: Approximately one a week depending on the activity and volunteer schedule Suggested Commitment: 6 months - 1 year PHP provides equal opportunity for all volunteers.
11412.title: Movies, Bowling, Dancing!

11413.description: Our objective is to provide a positive, nurturing and artistic atmosphere. We are endeavoring to serve you and our community by sharing the gift of dance, helping each person to discover their authentic talent within, and to build confidence in presenting and promoting artistic creativity. Our vision is to see the youth of the Community uplifted, motivated and educated. We believe this will boast self-esteem and confidence. Our goal is to mold individuals that will become assets to the communities in which they reside. This is also an opportunity for all of us to work together to reinforce morals, values, and to help achieve excellence through dance and performing Arts. We trust that as we all work together we will enhance personal and social growth, foster leadership skills, promote self-worth, teamwork, pride, respect, discipline and appreciation of music among dancers.
11413.title: "I BELIEVE IN ME" DANCE PROGRAM
11413.org: THE ARMS OF LOVE COMMUNITY OUTREACH INC

11413.description: Volunteer with Habitat for Humanity in Queens! Habitat for Humanity New York City transforms lives by building quality homes with families in need, and by uniting all New Yorkers around the cause of affordable housing. We build year round to move waiting families into their new homes and repair homes still badly damaged by Hurricane Sandy. Volunteers are at the heart of everything we do and we need YOU to help us continue making an impact throughout NYC! As a volunteer you will have the opportunity to: Make your own schedule - volunteer as little or as much as you would like Receive on-site training in construction - learn new skills or enhance the ones you already have Meet other volunteers committed to affordable housing Give back to your community in an amazing way Make a positive difference in the lives of others No construction experience is necessary -- just enthusiasm! _______________________________________________________________ How to Sign Up: Learn more before signing up by visiting our website (habitatnyc.org) OR create a profile on volunteerhub and sign up for a volunteer orientation (see instructions below). Please note: orientations are optional and are not required for Construction volunteers. If you are ready to start making a difference, follow the steps below to create your volunteerhub account: 1. Log on to habitatnyc.volunteerhub.com 2. Click the \"Create an Account\" button to create a new profile Choose a username and password Leave the Join Code field blank and click \"Next\" Input your full name, contact information, date of birth, and emergency contact's information 3. Select \"Construction\" and click on the event that interests you 4. Click on the \"Sign Up\" button and follow the directions to register for the event 5. You will receive a confirmation email letting you know you successfully signed up for a volunteer day! Please email volunteer@habitatnyc.org with any questions We hope to see you soon!
11413.title: Build with Habitat for Humanity in Queens!
11413.org: Habitat for Humanity New York City

11414.description: GallopNYC uses therapeutic horsemanship to help riders in NYC with disabilities walk, talk and learn,inspiring them to live their lives as fully, independently and productively as possible. GallopNYC's vision is that every child with a disability in New York City has access to therapeutic horseback riding. Tasks Available for Volunteers Side Walking: Assist the instructor during therapeutic riding sessions by working directly with the riders. Act as an intermediary between the rider and instructor by assisting the rider in carrying out the instructor’s directions. Help prepare riders for lessons Assist with rider support during mounting and dismounting Walk (and jog) next to the rider throughout the class and provide physical support as necessary Help the rider follow directions given by the instructor Lead Walking: Volunteer will lead horses during therapeutic riding classes, working with a group of side-walkers, keeping primary focus on assigned horse (and not the rider) while maintaining communication with team Executes directions of the instructor during therapeutic riding sessions Depending on site, will bring horses in and out of arena We conduct lessons six days a week at locations in Forest Hills, Queens and Howard Beach on the cusp of Brooklyn and Queens. Check out our Volunteer page to learn more about the program, and how volunteers help with lessons. The process to volunteer with GallopNYC is quite simple: 1. Go to: https://volunteer.gallopny c.org/HOC__Volunteer_Registration_Page, and make an account. 2. Complete the online orientation. 3. Sign up to volunteer by choosing your preferred day and location. After you sign up on the website, you will receive further updates on how to complete your registration. That’s it! *Experience with horses is helpful but not at all necessary. Please feel free to contact us for more info at volunteer@gallopnyc.org.
11414.title: Volunteer with a Therapeutic Horsemanship Program in Queens (Howard Beach)

11415.description: Gentleman Senior Citizen would like some socialization volunteer, preferably one who speaks Hebrew or Yiddish. Would like to play scrabble, cards and learn more about his computer. If this is an opportunity that interests you, please call Suzanne Windland at 718 454-2100,ext 136.
11415.title: Friendly Visitor for Kew Garden Hills Senior

11793.description: The National MS Society is looking for volunteers to help with general registration at Walk MS: Jones Beach! Walk MS: Jones Beach 2018 will be held on Saturday, May 19th at Jones Beach - Field 1 on Long Island. We need over 200 volunteers for this exciting event - we welcome groups and individuals of all ages & abilities to join us as volunteers! Walk MS is a charity walk series that takes place in over 550 locations with more than 300,000 people participating annually. When you participate in Walk MS, you are helping create a world free of multiple sclerosis. Together, we become a powerful force. Together, we will end MS forever. If you are interested in volunteering, please review the position below and register online here: http://main.nationalmssociety.org/site/TR/Walk/NYHWalkEvents?pg=entry&fr_id=29834 General Registration Team Date: Saturday, May 19 Location: Jones Beach, Field 1 (1 Ocean Parkway, Wantagh, NY 11793) Time: General Registration - 7:00am-11:00am Description: Greet and sign-in walkers as well as help registration run efficiently- Volunteers must be 18+ & Background Check If you have any questions, please contact: Amber Young - Manager, Volunteer Engagement at Amber.Young@nmss.org
11793.title: General Registration Volunteers Needed at Walk MS: Jones Beach!

11791.description: Can your dog become a C.A.T.T.? We are looking for beloved pets, retirees from breeding or competition, released service dogs, registered therapy dogs and/or rescues. We welcome Puppies (beginning at 12 weeks) to Adults! Qualify your dog for our innovative canine-assisted activities program where children and adults come to interact with our certified dogs. You and your dog will engage with our participants (with and without special needs) who come to DogAbility Center by appointment. Our certified canine teams are taught to manage a small obstacle course, ride in a wagon, play tug games, run relay races, play \"find the ball\" and other assorted tricks, as well as assist in \"fear of dogs\" sessions. Very young puppies are introduced gradually in our supervised Puppy Pals activity. To become certified, all teams must pass an initial evaluation and then attend training sessions where our DogAbility Certified Training Staff will offer personal assistance. See website for fees ~ Fully insured
11791.title: WANTED - Great Dogs and Handlers

11791.description: Are you a professional who wants to give back? A retiree or stay-at-home parent looking to keep your skills fresh? A college student hoping to build your resume? DogAbility Center is looking for skilled volunteers and individuals with just the right expertise to join our team. We are looking for interested individuals with initiative to help steer the direction of our organization with your time and talents. Your skills will help form our team and will ensure that our organization remains effective and carries forward our mission of bettering the lives and well-being of children and adults of all abilities in our community. We are seeking volunteers for the following reasons: To increase awareness and understanding of our organization through the work that our volunteers do. To give our volunteer staff additional manpower to do more work and get as much done as possible within the confines of our budget. To act together to achieve a shared purpose.
11791.title: Volunteers Needed for Canine-Assisted Therapeutic Program for Kids & Adults of All Abilities

11791.description: Who are we? The Young Center for Immigrant Children's Rights is a non-profit organization whose mission is to advocate for the rights of unaccompanied immigrant children. The Young Center provides volunteer Child Advocates (guardians ad litem) for trafficking victims and unaccompanied immigrant children. We serve children from our Chicago, Harlingen, Houston, Los Angeles, New York, Phoenix, San Antonio, and Washington, DC offices. Who are our Child Advocates? Our Child Advocates are adults who volunteer to spend time with and advocate on behalf of an individual unaccompanied immigrant child while he or she is in federal custody and subject to immigration proceedings. We welcome volunteers from all cultures, professions, races, ethnicities and social backgrounds. We have a particular need for bilingual volunteers who speak Spanish, Mam, K'iche', or other languages indigenous to Central America and Mexico. How can I become a Child Advocate? Before being assigned, Advocates must apply and complete a two-day training session. New volunteers must be 21 years old, undergo a federal and state background check, and be willing to commit approximately one hour per week to visit with an unaccompanied child. Once assigned to an individual child, each Advocate receives continuing training, support, and supervision from the Young Center. The Young Center is currently recruiting new Child Advocates in the New York area (particular need for volunteers who can serve in Westchester County and Long Island) for a training on May 19-20, 2018 on Long Island. This will be one of only two trainings held during the year, and space is limited.
11791.title: Volunteer with Unaccompanied Immigrant Children on Long Island
11791.org: The Young Center for Immigrant Children's Rights

11797.description: In order to provide additional support to our patients and their families, we have a dedicated group of Volunteers for our Hospice Angels Network. 10019.description: Together One New York (TONY) is starting a new program for English classes. The opportunity will generally run on Monday to Thursday evenings from 6 to 9 PM. Teachers are expected to volunteer in hour and a half increments from 6-7:30 or 7:30-9:00. As a teacher you will be responsible for compiling a lesson plan, but you are welcome to use our extensive teaching material to structure classes. Prior teaching experience is a plus, but certainly not required as we have many first time teachers who have come in and successfully led our classes. TONY is a non-profit organization whose volunteers are passionate about providing vital resources to all members of the NYC community, with a special emphasis on immigrants and language learning. In addition to language classes, we offer a variety of programs such as Citizenship Prep, TASC (high school equivalency), and beginner ESOL conversation. We look forward to expanding our outreach and positively impacting a greater portion of our city's immigrant community. For more information, please visit: http://togetheronenewyork.org/

10019.description: It is difficult and sometimes impossible for seniors to travel by themselves to necessary appointments such as doctors and dentist appointments, and on necessary errands such as food shopping. The Senior Escort program makes these crucial trips possible. Encore’s Senior Escort Program is a volunteer program designed to give much needed assistance and support to aging members of our community. Otherwise, due to physical frailty and disability, vision or hearing impairment, and cognitive problems, our senior neighbors are forced to cancel their trips - which leads to rapid decline in health and quality of life. Things to know: As a volunteer, you will meet the senior at their front door, accompany them to their appointment or errand, and then accompany them back to their home. Trips typically take 1-3 hours, depending on the circumstance. You will travel via public transportation (each individual is responsible for their own metro card) or via cab (the senior participant is responsible for cab fees) The clients we serve live in Manhattan south of 110th Duties include: Helping the older person dress in outerwear such as coat, sweater or hat for the trip Helping the older person lock and unlock his/her residence Helping the older person with physical strains such as assistance on stairs and carrying/pushing the grocery cart Requirements: Commitment of at least 6 months Weekly commitments, preferred Successful criminal background check & reference check Flexible hours Monday-Friday and/or available at least one day a week Attend program orientation & training Must be at least 18 years old Sensitive and empathic with the senior population *Important* Schedule: The program is not a fixed schedule. Requests come in every week, at different times and days Monday-Friday. Volunteers must have flexibility during the work week, i.e. a part-time job, or flexible work hours. It is required that you have at least one entire day free from Monday-Friday, we will place the volunteer on an on-call basis depending on the requests that come in that week. Your role as a volunteer in this program is incredibly valuable and rewarding. Senior program participants are so grateful for your time and help. It is a simple but vital service.
10019.title: URGENT NEED! Encore’s Shop & Escort Program. Accompany Seniors To Medical Appointments. Thank You!

10019.description: Estamos buscando un voluntario para acompañar a un encantador señor de 90+ años. Él vive en la parte sureste de la ciudad de New York. A él le encanta jugar domin ó , mirar noticias y novelas. Él te necesita solo una hora a la semana. GRACIAS. We match isolated and lonely seniors with volunteers in the community who make weekly visits in the senior’s home. The Friendly Visiting program is an opportunity to form rewarding relationships and ongoing companionship for both seniors and volunteers. Seniors and their visitor can converse and enjoy the company, take part in activities like going to cafes and museums, share stories, learn new skills, and a variety of other things based on the desires of the companions. You will be matched with a senior who has a similar personality and interests and you can decide together how to spend your time. Visits can easily fit into your schedule because matches are made based on your availability. We ask for a minimum commitment of 6 months or 1 year. Your time as a friendly visitor is invaluable, and you gain a new friend!
10019.title: Necisitamos Voluntario Para Acompañar Encantador Caballero De 90 Años - Adora Jugar Dominó ¡Gracias!

10019.description: Bunker Labs NYC is need of a highly motivated individual who has knowledge and experience in event planning and project management. The candidate should have relationships in Manhattan who can help produce fun, unique, and entertaining events at amazing locations-we have some of the existing relationships with WeWork, Google, and eBay but we're looking to diversify our options-with some education and speaking elements at each production. The candidate should also have a strong social media background and like to have fun with marketing the events and current chapter news. Understanding MailChimp is a plus as the position requires a monthly draft of our newsletter. What’s more, they will oversee the coordination of programming with our current volunteer staff. The ideal match is someone with a strong and diverse social media background, event planning, and a great relationship builder, and who understands Google Drive, knows Google Calendar, has great time management skills, and one who can address miscellaneous needs as they arise. The position calls for about 15 hours per week but might become fulltime as we grow. Right now, this is considered a volunteer position but with the idea that it will be a paid position in the near future as our donations grow. We might be able to negotiate a small stipend in the interim. The candidates will work out of our WeWork location in Midtown Manhattan and may work on their own projects or coursework which, is welcomed and encouraged. Veterans and/or military spouses or family members are not necessary, as we are community driven and inclusive.
10019.title: Volunteer-to-Paid Position - Entrepreneurship Non-Profit for Veterans

10019.description: The Chad Foundation is seeking volunteer cardiologists, ultrasound echo technicians and nurses to help provide cardiovascular screenings for young athletes and students in the 5 boroughs of NY to help prevent Sudden Cardiac Death by identifying structural heart anomalies such as HCM (hypertrophic cardiomyopathy), the leading silent killer of SCD in young athletes and premature cardiovascular risk factors such as hypertension, high cholesterol, obesity and diabetes. Thanks to the donated services of cardiologists from some of the leading hospitals in the country such as \"Childrens Hospital Los Angeles,\" \"Childrens National Medical Center,\" Wash. D.C., \"Johns Hopkins Medical Center,\" Baltimore, and \"Columbia Presbyterian,\" NYC, Chad has provided overr 6,000 echocardiograms to young athletes and students in 5 states and abroad in Austria and Sweden (16 and 26 countries of athletes participating in the \"1st and 2nd Homeless Streetsoccer World Cups.\") Thanks to recent grants, we are expanding our heart screenings to include tests for cholesterol and diabetes in youth utilizing state-of-the-art Cholestech machines. In a recent pilot study, Chad and the Living Heart screened 250 high school students in Holyoke, MA and found one-third were at risk for hypertension, high cholesterol, diabetes, obesity and/or structural abnormalities. Also, we are glad to tell you, Johns Hopkins Heart Hype Program, will house collected data from Chad screenings for future research. Typically, a Chad screening is held on a Saturday, for 4 or 5 hours at a school gym or community center, often honouring a child who succumbed to Sudden Cardiac Death or a survivor, who through preventive screenings, is alive and thriving with appropriate medical treatment and lifestyle change. Ultrasound manufacturers donate their latest portable ultrasound equipment for the events. We invite you to visit our website, www.chadfoundation.org to view the \"Chad Preventive Heart Screenings\" in action. Thank you.
10019.title: Volunteer Cardiologists, Echo Technicians and Nurses Needed
10019.org: The Chad Foundation for Athletes and Artists

07101.description: JerseySTEM is looking for community volunteers with local familiarity of the Newark, NJ area to develop relationship with community stakeholders, other non profits, community centers, local libraries, and places of worship, You will be reporting to the site manager. The volunteer will field calls and emails, reach out and identify opportunities of partnership. Will help with local fundraising efforts, which includes reaching out to local businesses and merchants. Finally, you will help with publicizing the JerseySTEM program with local communities. JerseySTEM is a network co-op of parents, professionals, students and educators whose goal is to promote excellence in Science, Technology, Engineering and Math (\"STEM\") education. We are dedicated to partnering with local schools and other organizations to create and enhance STEM-oriented educational opportunities as part of students' paths towards college and career readiness, and to develop effective STEM programs and initiatives that engage students and educators. JerseySTEM is also committed to bridging the gender gap in STEM education and sharing STEM-related opportunities with underprivileged students and communities.

07102.description: CASA volunteers are community members who have a sincere desire to make a difference in the life of a child in foster care by becoming an advocate in court on the child's behalf. They are responsible adults who care deeply about the welfare of children and know that when they take on a case, they have the opportunity to change a child's life. As an advocate, a CASA volunteer will read Division of Child Protection and Permanency case files and interview all parties associated with the child and the case, such as biological parents, foster parents, school personnel, medical and mental health professionals and relatives. A CASA volunteer visits the child in the foster home every month in order to be familiar with what he or she needs. After gathering information, a CASA volunteer writes a report to be sent to the Family Court Judge who is presiding over the case. CASA volunteers are invited to appear at the actual Court hearing on the case to provide in-person testimony related to the report. CASA volunteers come from all walks of life and all kinds of educational, ethnic, and social backgrounds. Most work full time but some are students and some are retired. Objectivity and good communication skills are essential since a CASA volunteer must be able to work with a variety of people from child welfare professionals to birth parents. You must be at least 21 years old to volunteer. Completion of 30 hours of training in addition to a formal background check, references, and an interview are required. The first step in becoming an advocate is attending an information session. Visit www.tinyurl.com/CASAEssex for all upcoming dates and times. Can't make any of these? Email Jess at jearl@casaessex.org to schedule a phone call.
07102.title: Make a difference in a child's life - become a volunteer advocate
07102.org: CASA for Children of Essex County

07102.description: MusicLink is in need of music teachers in New Jersey. MusicLink teachers are able to take advantage of a variety of offers and discounts from our growing list of Business Partners as well as additional benefits directly from our foundation. MusicLink teachers are qualified, professional teachers seeking to share their love of music with a deserving child. All MusicLink teachers are required to pass a criminal background check.

07102.description: Volunteers are needed to assist the Upward Bound Program, a grant-funded college preparatory program that serves highly motivated, low-income and first -generation college bound high school students. Upward Bound is organized as a partnership between Rutgers University - Newark and the East Orange School District, and is funded through a grant by the United States Department of Education. Volunteers are needed to assist the Upward Bound Program, a grant-funded college preparatory program that serves highly motivated, low-income and first -generation college bound high school students. Upward Bound is organized as a partnership between Rutgers University - Newark and the East Orange School District, and is funded through a grant by the United States Department of Education. The program’s goal is to provide fundamental support to participants in their preparation for success in secondary and post-secondary education. Scholars of the program participate in a year-long program (two Saturdays per month during the academic year and summer school for six-weeks during the summer). Volunteer tutors should be proficient in one of the following: S cience (Biology, Chemistry, Physics) T echnology E nginerring M athematics (Pre-Algebra, Algebra I and II, Geometry) Former volunteer experience in tutoring is necessary to being a susccessful volunteer at this opporunity and p revious exposure to low-income, first -generation youth is highly recommended. Volunteers are expected to help students learn independently. Volunteers are not expected to provide answers, but rather they should provide the necessary steps that students can use to find their own answers. NOTE: To participate in this project you must be a Jersey Cares volunteer. To sign up as a Jersey Cares volunteer: 1. Visit www.jerseycares.org 2. Click on \"Log-In\" 3. Click on \"Not a Member? Register\" 4. Fill out all necessary information. 5. Register for a project!

07102.description: The Borgen Project is an innovative, national campaign that is working to make poverty a focus of U.S. foreign policy. This is a part-time 14-hours per week, unpaid telecommuting internship. The internship is 4-months and responsible for leading public and political outreach in the state and district assigned to. Key Responsibilities: - Must be available Mondays 4:30-6:00 PM PST for The Borgen Project’s national conference call. - Meet with members of Congress and/or Congressional staffers in your State and District. - Represent The Borgen Project at various business, political and community events. - Assist with fundraising. Create a personal fundraising campaign and meet targets. - Mobilize individuals to contact their members of Congress in support of key poverty-reduction legislation. - As needed, speak to groups, classes and organizations. - Write letters of support for key programs to political leaders, media and other groups. Qualifications: - Outstanding writing skills. - Self-starter who can produce great results with limited supervision. - Strong oral communication skills and ability to lead meetings and give speeches.
07102.title: Political Affairs Internship

07102.description: The Borgen Project is an innovative, national campaign that is working to make poverty a focus of U.S. foreign policy. This is a 12-week, part-time, unpaid internship. The selected candidate will be able to work from home and set their own schedule, but must meet weekly deadlines. Articles submitted will appear on BORGEN Magazine or The Borgen Project Blog. Key Responsibilities: - Interview sources and research topics in-depth. - Write one well-researched article per week. - Communicate with editors and supervisors. - Assist with fundraising. Create a personal fundraising campaign and meet targets. - Attend national conference call and/or training every Monday at 4 - 5:30 PM PST. Qualifications: Strong journalism writing skills. Must be able to work independently and meet deadlines with very little supervision. Experience writing for newspapers is helpful, but not required.
07102.title: Journalism Internship

07102.description: The Borgen Project is an innovative, national campaign that is working to make poverty a focus of U.S. foreign policy. This is a 12-week, part-time, unpaid internship. The selected candidate will be able to work from home and pick their own schedule, but must meet weekly deadlines. Articles submitted will appear on BORGEN Magazine or The Borgen Project Blog. Key Responsibilities: - Write one article per week. - Research topics. - Assist with advocacy efforts. - Assist with fundraising. Create a personal fundraising campaign and meet targets. - Attend national conference call and/or training every Monday at 4 - 5:30 PM PST. Qualifications: Strong research and writing skills. Must be able to work independently and meet deadlines with very little supervision. Experience writing SEO friendly content is helpful, but not required.
07102.title: Writer Internship

07102.description: The Borgen Project is an innovative, national campaign that works with U.S. leaders to improve their response to the global poverty crisis. 07102.description: The Borgen Project is an innovative, national campaign that works with U.S. leaders to improve their response to the global poverty crisis. 07102.description: The Borgen Project is an innovative, national campaign that works with U.S. leaders to improve their response to the global poverty crisis. You don’t need to be a lobbyist to help influence foreign policy. As a Regional Director, you’ll serve as a Borgen Project Ambassador in your city - mobilizing your friends, family and colleagues to contact Congress in support of key poverty reduction legislation. This is an unpaid, volunteer position. Key Responsibilities: - Attend one (30-60 minute) national conference call per month: 5PM PDT 6PM MDT 7PM CDT 8PM EDT - Meet with local congressional leaders and lobby for legislation that improves living conditions for the world’s poor. - Mobilize people in your community to contact their congressional leaders to support poverty reduction legislation. - Manage and implement fundraising campaigns. - Build a network of people engaged in the cause. - Serve as The Borgen Project’s ambassador in your city. Qualifications: - Basic understanding of U.S. Politics and international development. - Highly organized with the ability to prioritize multiple functions and tasks while managing their work time efficiently. - Strong team player that loves to bring new ideas to the table. - Ability to demonstrate frequent independent judgment with decisiveness. - Excellent overall communication skills: oral, written, presentation.
07102.title: Regional Director

07102.description: The Borgen Project is an innovative, national campaign that works with U.S. leaders to improve their response to the global poverty crisis. Key Responsibilities: - Attend one (30-60 minute) national conference call per month: 5PM PDT 6PM MDT 7PM CDT 8PM EDT - Serve as an ambassador for the world’s poor. Build awareness of the issues and ways people can help. - Manage and implement fundraising campaigns. - Represent The Borgen Project in your city - attend events and engage people in the cause. - Contact congressional leaders in support of key poverty-reduction programs. Qualifications: - Excellent overall communication skills: oral, written, presentation. - Ability to self-manage and prioritize assignments.

Whether you choose to work directly with patients and families or to volunteer in one of many other ways, you can make a profound difference in someone's life, including your own. Volunteers are an integral part of the hospice team. Ascend Hospice serves counties throughout New Jersey. Areas where you are needed include: Atlantic County, Bergen County, Cape May County, Essex County, Hudson County, Mercer County, Middlesex County, Monmouth County, Morris County, North Passaic County, Ocean County, Somerset County, South Passaic County, Burlington County, Camden County and Union County. Sometimes all it takes is a smile or sharing a story to make somone feel important. All Modalities are welcome. Volunteer Opportunities: Companionship Volunteers work directly with patients providing companionship, offering friendly visits, reading to patients, writing letters, offering a gentle touch or sharing a quiet moment. Complementary Volunteers are certified/trained professionals who can provide complementary modalities of reflexologly, music, Reiki, & massage. Ascend Hospice is seeking certified Reiki practioners to serve our end of life population in finding comfort, relaxation and peace during their final time with us. Your assistance is needed with reducing anxiety, relieving pain and providing a safe , comfortable environment. Training provided for volunteers. Reiki Certification is required. Pet Therapy Volunteers provide companionship from our certified therapy dogs. Pet therapy provides numerous benefits like encouraging movement and physical stimulation and it provides mental benefits like socialization, mental stimulation, companionship, and unconditional love. Please consider sharing your loving pet with us and bring some much needed smiles. Pets must be certified as therapy animals by an organization like TDI Therapy Dogs International- see website here http://www.tdi-dog.org/ Music Volunteers are volunteers who specialize in sharing songs or instrumental music with patients and their loved ones. Whether the Music Volunteer is sharing an existing musical skill or playing music via the radio or digital device, the goal is to enhance the quality of life of our patients. Often, regularly scheduled visits are requested, however Music Volunteers may also be asked to provide musical visits on an occasional basis for one patient/family or for a group of patients at a facility as outreach for the local hospice agency. Hospice is built on the philosophy that we care for our patients in mind, body and soul. Craft Volunteers consist of individuals or groups who touch patients in a special way by making lap blankets, shawls, memory bears and other articles for patients to enjoy. Bereavement Volunteers offer support to the families of patients who have passed. During the grieving process the bereavement volunteer can be a valuable resource, especially for those who lack a solid support network. They often make phone calls to check up on family members and also send cards of comfort and care. For more information about our free volunteer training and available opportunities, call our Volunteer Department or visit our website at Ascendhospice.com! We look forward to hearing from you! Please do not contact me with unsolicited services or offers.
07662.title: Hospice Volunteers - Companion, Music, Pet Therapy, Reiki - Rochelle Park

07663.description: The ALS Association Greater New York Chapter needs YOUR help! With the 2018 North Jersey Walk to Defeat ALS approaching, we hope you will be able to volunteer with us to help make this year’s Walk a success. Almost 190 walkers have raised over $40,000 dollars to date! We need your help on the day of the event to ensure that everyone has a great experience. Because of the energy and support that our volunteers provide on the day, our walkers come back year after year to enjoy the Walk! When: Sunday, June 3rd Where: Saddle River County Park Registration opens at 9:00AM, opening ceremonies are at 10:30AM and the Walk begins at 11:00AM, so we’ll need people to volunteer before and/or during the Walk. You can pick whichever time slot that would work best for you! We can provide up to 6 hours of community service! _________________________________________________________________________ If you are interested, please email vjung@als-ny.org with: 1. Full Name (and those volunteering with you) 2. Walk(s) you would like to volunteer at 3. Cell Phone # 4. What time slot between 8:00AM-1:00PM are you available? (Time slots include 8AM-11AM, 11AM-1PM, 8AM-1PM) 5 . Do you have any physical limitations? 6. Are you (or anyone with you) under 18? *If under 18, we need to have a signed permission slip prior to volunteering _________________________________________________________________________ Positions include**: Registration Food Parking Marshal Walk Marshal Water Station T-Shirts Kids Zone Tribute Banner Cheer Photographer Assistant Early Bird Set-Up **will be chosen based on availability and time commitment If you have any questions or concerns, please contact Vivian Jung at 212-720-3043 _________________________________________________________________________ You can register for the Walks at alswalks.org or call Meg Emery at 212-720-3049 Interested in becoming a local partner? Learn more about our Chapter's Corporate Partnership Opportunities and the impact your company can have right here in our community. Contact Jillian Saperstein 212-720-3052 | jsaperstein@als-ny.org
07663.title: North Jersey Walk to Defeat ALS
07663.org: The ALS Association Greater New York Chapter

07666.description: Female volunteers are needed to sort and manage clothing donations as they come into this 24 hour womens' shelter.
07666.title: Caring Closet in Teaneck

07666.description: We are an independent living facility in Teaneck, NJ that targets the critical need for affordable senior housing in Bergen County. Some of our residents have expressed interest in learning to play guitar. We are looking for anyone who would love to spend one on one time with a senior to teach guitar.
07666.title: One on One Guitar Lesson with Senior

07666.description: We are a non-profit organization looking for a Yoga or Zumba instructor to run a class for Seniors. Weekly volunteer would be great, but one time volunteers much appreciated as well!
07666.title: Yoga or Zumba

07666.description: Looking for volunteer who can help some senior residents strengthen their English. Most residents who are looking for this opportunity are Korean.
07666.title: ESL for Seniors

07666.description: Looking for a volunteer to instruct Zumba classes for seniors. The seniors have been following Zumba classes instructed via TV, but an in person instructor would be much more preferred! Classes that work best are Wednesdays at 10:30 am. Looking for someone who might be able to come on a weekly basis, but would also appreciate anyone who is able to come in once or so. These seniors love Zumba!!
07666.title: Zumba for Seniors!

07666.description: Looking for a volunteer to hold organized sessions of aromatherapy for senior citizens. After orientation, these visits may take place during business hours, during early evening hours, or over the weekend
07666.title: Aromatherapy

07666.description: Bright Side Manor is a non-profit organization that provides housing and medical care for seniors in need. One of our residents receives medical treatment 3 times a week, and is feeling pretty down. We are looking for a dedicated volunteer that can cheer him up! He loves movies and baseball. Looking for a patient person that can come at least once a week to spend quality time with this resident. Thank you!!
07666.title: One on One Time with a Senior

07666.description: I am looking for someone that can facilitate a musical class with our residents at Bright Side Manor! At Bright Side Manor we provide affordable housing and support services to older adults of all income levels in our clean, charming, converted Victorian home in Teaneck, NJ. We have musical instruments but require someone who can help us find a beat! Thank you! Liz
07666.title: Music Class for Seniors

07666.description: Please join us at Bright Side Manor to put smiles on the faces of our seniors, many of whom are suffering from dementia. We hope that you will bring your talents to us and perform for the residents! Singers, dancers, comedians, actors, musicians.... come all!
07666.title: Senior Entertainment

07666.description: This is a perfect opportunity for someone who loves to write and pass that love on to others, especially seniors who take pride in having a voice through the newsletter. Articles include interviews, experience sharing, book/movie/restaurant reviews
07666.title: Resident Newsletter Coordinator

07666.description: Our residents love crafts! If you love crafts too and would like to spend an afternoon with older adults sharing your talents, we promise you a rewarding experience. They love to cut and paste and color. Quite simple, but a lot of fun with materials you can pick up in a dollar store-or we will supply. Come alone...or organize a group.
07666.title: Crafty Volunteers

07666.description: We're looking for people of all ages to come spend time with our seniors through volunteer activities scheduled by our Activities Director. After orientation, these visits may take place during business hours, during early evening hours, or over the weekend. Chat about the weather, art, or current events. Watch a movie together. Play games. If you can think of it, we probably have someone who is interested in doing it.
07666.title: Activities Volunteers for Elderly

07666.description: Can you sing, dance, play a musical instrument? Maybe you're into magic or \"clowning.\" If so and you would love to see a room full of seniors smile, then Bright Side Manor is the place for you. Our residents love to have fun and become easily engaged. Weekdays, weeknights, weekends, we're flexible.
07666.title: Entertainers, Performers, Musicians

07666.description: Today's senior citizens are active, vibrant, and are poised to teach us great things. Bright Side Manor is a non-profit assisted living facility dedicated almost exclusively to older adults of low and moderate income. Our community is homelike, our staff is caring, and our residents thrive! We're seeking a yoga instructor, a physical therapist, or someone who is knowledgeable in teaching light exercise and stretching to the elderly. Days and times are flexible!
07666.title: Light Exercise & Stretching Instructor

07666.description: Today's senior citizens are active, vibrant, and are poised to teach us great things. Bright Side Manor is a non-profit assisted living facility dedicated almost exclusively to older adults of low and moderate income. Our community is homelike, our staff is caring, and our residents thrive! We're looking for men and women of all ages to spend time with our elderly residents. If you'd prefer to visit with one resident or a group of residents, there are opportunities for you to come by weekdays, evenings, and weekends.
07666.title: Friendly Visitors for the Elderly

07666.description: Assist clients and staff with recreation program activities including games, arts and crafts, woodworking activities, painting, jewelry making, and more.
07666.title: ACTIVITIES/RECREATION ASSISTANT

07666.description: Today's senior citizens are active, vibrant, and are poised to teach us great things. Bright Side Manor is a non-profit assisted living facility dedicated almost exclusively to older adults of low and moderate income. Our community is homelike, our staff is caring, and our residents thrive! Do you have a pet that's certified for pet therapy? The senior citizens living at Bright Side Manor love animals! Days and times are flexible!
07666.title: Certified Pet Therapists

10013.description: Volunteers that are passionate about technology and sharing their knowledge with the next generation of leaders and doers are at the core of our mission. CodeNow brings tech industry professionals, bootcamp grads, and CS college student together with local high schools students who have a curiosity for problem-solving. By working side-by-side with CodeNow volunteers the teens are transformed into coders, designers, and entrepreneurs. The process of registering to be a part of the CodeNow Workshop continues by filling out the Volunteer Information Form. Workshop Overview CodeNow's Workshop will take place on May 12th & 13th, and May 19th & 20th. Instructors will lead a small group of students (about 6-8) through different presentations, learning activities, and programming projects during these sessions. Our workshops are approximately 30-40, boys and girls, and most of our students qualify for free or reduced-price lunch at school. Volunteer Requirements Employees working in design and product management are preferred for Weekend 1, and employees who are software developers/engineers are needed for Weekend 2. The commitment for each volunteer is a single Saturday and single Sunday from 8:30 am to 4:30 pm. For Weekend 1, volunteers should have a working knowledge of design thinking and product management processes, and an intermediate understanding of HTML & CSS. For Weekend 2, volunteers should have programming experience in any language. One-third of our volunteers do not know Ruby before taking part in a Workshop and have found the experience of picking up a new language rewarding. Teaching experience is helpful to have but not necessary. We provide all our volunteers with a training session, the CodeNow Handbook, and unlimited access to our Learning Platform in preparation for working with our students and our curriculum. A volunteer's responsibilities include attending an instructors’ training session (virtual using Amazon Chime), reviewing the curriculum, instructor's guides, and reading the CodeNow Handbook beforehand (accessible on our Learning Platform). Please remember to fill out the Volunteer Information Form!
10013.title: Spring NYC Coding Workshop - Weekend 1

10013.description: Welcome summer in NYC’s backyard playground! Help support the Park's premiere summer fundraising event involving a BBQ and cocktails, kids entertainment and live music along Hudson River Park’s sparkling waterfront to support the Park’s ongoing free programming for families and children, ensuring a fun and enriching experience for all. Entryway/Greeter Volunteers - Greeting guests, directing attendees toward check-in, and providing basic event information Check-In Volunteers - Greet guests, hand out wristbands to attendees after check-in, ensure all attendees sign waivers, and general guest management Curated Care - Support Curated Care staff as needed Super Soccer Stars - Support Super Soccer Stars staff as needed Bubble Dad - Support Bubble Dad staff as needed Big City Fishing - Support Environment and Education staff as needed Face Painting - Line control, manage waiting guests and ensure organization Stroller Parking - Encourage guests to leave strollers, highlight that volunteers will not be responsible for watching strollers (leave at own discretion) Info Table - Distribute collateral, answer guest questions, and direct partners Perimeter Marshalls - Ensure/direct all guests to use main entrance at check-in, answer basic event questions, and block key entryways
10013.title: Hudson River Park Friends Backyard BBQ

10013.description: For many new immigrants, learning English is a first step to full participation in American society. Help them take that first step by becoming a volunteer teacher in English or Citizenship classes. English classes help students improve their communication skills. Citizenship classes help students prepare for the U.S. citizenship test. Volunteers work in teams to plan lessons and teach the class. This fun and rewarding experience gives you a chance to make a difference in the lives of others. Individuals with an interest in education careers are encouraged to apply. Requirements Must have good communication skills and a strong desire to help and work with new immigrants Prior teaching experience is preferred. Bilingual skills are a plus. We prefer volunteers who can commit to teaching at least two semesters Prospective volunteers must complete application and be interviewed. Volunteer Schedule: 9:30 am-11:30am (Tues or Thurs) 10:30 am-12:30 pm (Tues or Thurs) 1pm to 4pm (Saturday) 6:30pm to 8:30 pm (Mon, Tues or Wed) Spring 2018 - February 27, 2018 to June 7, 2018 Summer 2018 - July 9, 2018 to August 18, 2018 Prospective volunteers must complete application and will be interviewed. Please contact us at cpanyc@cpanyc.org for an application OR apply on-line here: http://bit.ly/volunteerteacherapplication For more information: http://bit.ly/VolunteerToTeachEnglishorCitizenshipClass
10013.title: Teach English or Citizenship Class in Chinatown

10013.description: Help rescue catered lunch leftovers from 2 offices in Greenwich Village! We will deliver the food to NYC Rescue Mission, located at 90 Lafayette St, New York, NY 10013. Mediumweight: the average amount of food rescued from this event is 25-50 pounds.
10013.title: Fight Food Waste in Greenwich on Fridays 3:30PM!

10013.description: VOLUNTEER NEEDED FOR OUR MANHATTAN OFFICE INSIDE OF FEDCAP. DUTIES: --Greet the client --Explain that we take pictures and they have to sign a waiver [(we can cut their heads off on the picture, should they not want to be seen) Not mandatory for receiving services] --Measure assist them in tying a tie (if they do not know how) finding a suit, shirt, slacks, shoes, etc. that fits. (They can try on the clothing in the restroom.) --Arrange for the hemming of pants or the sewing on of buttons with the tailor and set a date for the client to pick up the tailored items. If no alterations are needed, then fold up the items and place in a bag for the client. --Keep records of activities and calls in the log. --Be able to work alone, with minimal supervision or with others We are doing one day a week, for now (date to be discussed), but the time will be 10 AM to 3 PM. This is a great opportunity for anyone wanting to go into law enforcement and who wants to see \"the other side\" after a person comes home, someone that wants to be in the fashion industry, or social services/non-profit sector. You will be networking with everyday people, politicians, individuals from different programs (formerly incarcerated individuals, etc.), City organizations/programs, and pastors. There is a possibility that you will be helping with administrative work and our events as well. You must be neat and presentable. We also will need you to assist in pop-up shops and the occasional donation pick up. Check out what we do to get a better feel for 100 Suits http://www.100suits.org/100-suits-speaks Please be reliable! SERIOUS INQUIRIES ONLY!!!
10013.title: Fashion and Justice Volunteer (Queens)

10013.description: Lenox Hill Neighborhood House, widely recognized as one of New York's premier human services providers, is a 123-year-old settlement house that provides an extensive array of effective and integrated services which significantly improve the lives of 15,000 people in need each year on the East Side of Manhattan. Our Senior Center at East 54th Street and Lexington Avenue is a vibrant program that provides hundreds of older adults with educational, cultural, health and social activities every week. We are seeking instructors for a variety of classes and activities including: Zumba Chair Yoga Mah Jong Line Dancing Conversational Italian Book Discussion Group Digital Photography Instructors lead their respective classes/activities once per week on weekdays. If you have one of the skills above and are interested in sharing your time and knowledge with active and enthusiastic older adults please contact Anthony Snowden, Volunteer Director at asnowden@lenoxhill.org or 212-218-0487.
10013.title: Instructor for Senior Center

10013.description: Every year CMP, (formerly known as the Chinatown Manpower Project) hosts our annual Career Building Awards Gala, recognizing leaders in their respective fields. This year we will be honoring individuals of the Food Service Industry. This gala acts as a major fundraiser to support our programs and services that provide economic empowerment and encourage economic self-sufficiency. We will need about 3 volunteers to assist the Silent Auction, a key component of our Gala. Prior to the gala we will need volunteers to pack and label silent auction items, and the day of place and distribute items to auctions winners. Looking for volunteers who enjoy working with people and can think on their feet.
10013.title: Gala Silent Auction Volunteer

10013.description: In preparation for our annual Career Building Awards Gala, CMP is seeking 2 volunteers to translate a few short articles and items for our silent auction from Chinese to English. Interested volunteers should send a short writing sample with a document translated from Chinese to English. Volunteer service can be completed digitally.
10013.title: Chinese to English Document Translator

10013.description: Are you an Accounting major with a passion for nonprofit work? The CMP, formerly known as the Chinatown Manpower Project is seeking an intern to assist our fiscal director in managing multiple budgets for our services and programs. Schedule will be flexible and intern will be expected to dedicate one to two days a week for a few hours.
10013.title: Non-Profit Accounting Intern
