07928.description: Grace Healthcare Services is looking for Hospice volunteers! We welcome your gifts of time and compassion. Whether you choose to work directly with patients and families or to volunteer in one of many other ways, you can make a profound difference in someone's life, including your own. Volunteers are an integral part of the hospice team. Volunteer Opportunities: Companionship Volunteers work directly with patients providing companionship, offering friendly visits, reading to patients, writing letters, offering a gentle touch or sharing a quiet moment. Complementary Volunteers are certified/trained professionals who can provide complementary modalities of reflexology, music, imagery and touch therapies such as Reiki, massage, therapeutic touch and healing hands. Pet Therapy Volunteers provide certified/trained pets who visit with patients. These animals provide loving memories for some and give gunconditional love helping our patients feel connected to a larger world. Administrative Volunteers provide help to the staff in our Edison office by assisting with typing, addressing cards, organizing newsletters, creating packets, collating manuals and other varied clerical duties Craft Volunteers consist of individuals or groups who touch patients in a special way by making lap blankets, shawls, huggable dolls/bears and other articles for patients to enjoy. Junior Volunteers consist of groups such as girl/boy scouts or young people who wish to honor our patients by making holiday cards, posters, wall hangings and memory books. Bereavement Volunteers offer support to the families and friends of patients who have passed. During the grieving process the bereavement volunteer can be a valuable resource, especially for those who lack a solid support network. Hospice training classes are required for Companionship and Complementary Volunteers. They are free of charge and offered on an ongoing basis. Grace Healthcare Services serves counties throughout New Jersey. Areas where you are needed include: Atlantic County, Bergen County, Cape May County, Essex County, Hudson County, Mercer County, Middlesex County, Monmouth County, Morris County, North Passaic County, Ocean County, Somerset County, South Passaic County, Burlington County, Camden County and Union County. For more information about our free volunteer training and available opportunities, contact our Volunteer Department or visit our website at Gracehcs.com!
07928.title: Hospice Volunteers Needed!

During your shift you will beengaging in friendly conversations and assisting with their comfort needs. We would love to hearfrom you if you are: friendly, kind and empathetic. 11803.description: Your unique collection of life experiences can make a tremendous impact on the lives of young people new to America. By volunteering as a mentor with Table Wisdom you will have the chance to cultivate invaluable relationships as a mentor while helping foreign born students and young professionals practice their conversational English skills. It's as easy as signing up, getting paired, and starting a conversation. You and your mentee set the schedule and the student is expected to prepare topics for conversation. Our pairs talk about everything: from sports and culture to industry-specific skills and knowledge, what you discuss is up to you and your mentee. We do our best to pair people in similar disciplines so our mentees can learn from your career-specific experience, and you can learn more about what's new in your field. By having fun yet meaningful conversations you will help students build their confidence and fluency in English. All you need is the ability to video chat and the desire to meet someone new. Help a young foreign born person improve their quality of life in America. Join Table Wisdom: https://www.table-wisdom.org/join-us \"Although our lives are so different and perhaps distant, it is encouraging that there is so much that we share trying to be our best selves and making this a better world.\" -- Alan, mentor \"I feel so blessed to have met my excellent English language mentor. He always encourages me to speak out and taught me some idiomatic English which I didn't learn from a textbook.\" -- Zachary, mentee
11803.title: Share your experience! Mentor foreign born students and young professionals

11801.description: We are looking for special families to open their hearts and homes and join our family of puppy raisers. Four-month-old Bosley is a puppy with a special mission. One day, he will provide enhanced independence and mobility to a person with disabilities - whether they're blind or visually impaired, or have a disability other than blindness. But Bosley isn't growing up at the Guide Dog Foundation for the Blind. Each year, the Guide Dog Foundation breeds about 300 exceptional puppies, and it's vital that Bosley and other pups like him spend the first year of their lives with surrounded by the love and security of volunteer foster families called puppy walkers. Puppy walkers help Foundation puppies grow up to be confident dogs. What's involved in raising a Guide Dog Foundation puppy? Bosley went to live with his puppy walkers when he was about nine weeks old. He's learning basic obedience and social skills while being exposed to many different situations. People who raise Guide Dog Foundation puppies say it is the most rewarding thing they've ever done. Puppy raisers come from everywhere - stay-at-home moms or dads, teachers, college students, retirees, people with flexible work environments - and are crucial members of the Guide Dog Foundation family. By opening their hearts and homes to a puppy, a puppy raiser plays a crucial role in helping a person with disabilities live an independent life. Every puppy walker family works with a Guide Dog Foundation puppy adviser, who is available to answer questions and offer guidance and support. When he is about 14 months old, Bosley will return to the Guide Dog Foundation's Smithtown campus to begin his training as a guide or service dog. Puppy raisers will admit it's tough to say good-bye, but when they see the pup they raised take its place at the side of someone with disabilities, the ache they feel turns pride. There are puppies waiting now to join your loving home for a chance to start their careers. For more info, call or e-mail the Guide Dog Foundation's Puppy Department at 866-282-8046 or puppies@guidedog.org. Or visit www.GuideDog.org and click on the Puppy Program link. For over 60 years, the Guide Dog Foundation for the Blind has provided guide and service dogs and training free of charge to people with disabilities who seek the enhanced mobility, independence, and companionship only an assistance dog can provide.
11801.title: Must Love Dogs in Nassau County! Seeking volunteers to raise puppies!!

11201.description: eBay Foundation in collaboration with GriffinWorx is hosting an Extreme Build-A- Business Workshop, aimed at developing innovation entrepreneurs and business builders through a highly experiential visual thinking, mentor-driven program. This kick-off event for the NYC StartUp Cup is being held April 28 and 29 at LIU in Brooklyn and we will have over 100 business builders in attendance. As a mentor you will: Learn the six core entrepreneur mentoring principles Enhance your insights into business building and customer development Learn strategies for accelerating startups and new business development Integrate the use of visual thinking tools to accelerate better decision making Learn \"Old School\" Silicon Valley Business building methods No previous experience is required to be a mentor and all mentors will be certified in the GriffinWorx methodology at the weekend. Please note that the time commitments can be flexible. Your availability can be communicated with the local team when they confirm you. However, for consistency on the evaluation of the startups, they would appreciate it if you can make it to most of the event.

11201.description: About A Free Bird Organization As a 100% volunteer-based 501(c)(3) non-profit arts education organization, A Free Bird strives to empower pediatric cancer patients by inspiring and nourishing their artistic passions. A Free Bird has been supported by brands like Google, Amazon, Rite Aid, Chipotle, Macy’s, Barnes and Noble amongst many others, and was recognized by the Department of Education and Department of Cultural Affairs, and honored by Mayor Bill De Blasio at the NYC Mayoral Recognition Award for 2 consecutive years in a row for NYC Volunteer Service. Responsibilities Provide non-classroom one to one instructions to our young students Assess the appropriate ability level of each student Teach students violin mechanics including name of strings and other parts of the violin Help students learn how to read and play music on the violin Teach students study skills, note taking skills and performance skills Monitor the progress of the students so their needs can be identified Give timely and honest feedback to students and parents Communicate with creativity and clarity Arrange recitals and concerts for pupils' families and friends

11201.description: A Free Bird is a 501(C)(3) non-profit organization based in New York City. Our focus is to provide children, ages 6-18 who are patients or survivors of juvenile cancer, the opportunity to explore their artistic passions and give them the strength to fight their disease. We believe that artistic expression is critical for healing! A Free Bird supports children affected by cancer in their exploration of art, music, acting, poetry, writing, singing and any other artistic passion they may have. After a very incredible and successful year, we are seeking a highly skilled Human Resources Assistant who can commit 5-10 hours per week for a minimum of 3 months. Overall Responsibilities: Provides support to the HR Director for all administrative purposes. The assistant will research information pertaining to the Human Resources Department. The Volunteer/Intern will maintain records and information for the HR Director. The assistant will schedule appointments, have the ability to work independently and within a team environment; ability to efficiently organize materials and information, ability to easily adjust to changing conditions, maintain effective working relationships with employees, and any other individuals. Responsibilities: Creating charts, spreadsheets, documents within google drive and Microsoft office. Assisting with Calendar appointments. Organizing materials for the information that is within emails, google drive, etc. Scanning/Faxing information through phone or iPad. Effective email communication between volunteers/interns and outside representatives. Researching information on Human Resources Creating files on the computer, potentially sharing material with other volunteers/interns Creating emails Must support and maintain mission goal and statement of organization. Competencies: Ability to Research information on the internet. Working towards a degree in Human Resources. Understanding Google Drive Understanding Microsoft Office, PowerPoint, Excel, Word, etc. Highly organized.

11201.description: A Free Bird is a 501(C)(3) non-profit organization based in New York City. Our focus is to provide children, ages 4-18 who are patients or survivors of juvenile cancer, the opportunity to explore their artistic passions and give them the strength to fight their disease. We believe that artistic expression is critical for healing! A Free Bird supports children affected by cancer in their exploration of art, music, acting, poetry, writing, singing and any other artistic passion they may have. Consisting of, but not limited to: scheduling appointments for Fundraising Coordinator, assisting in reaching out to donors, supporters for companies, researching information, creating documents, sending emails, setting up meetings with other department heads, reaching out to other departments for information. Responsibilities: Supports Candidate Fundraising Director in organizing meetings, staffing events and preparing materials Prepares donor meeting and event materials as necessary Plays lead role in scheduling for the department Make phone calls and send emails to lists of identified prospective donors, including keeping track of the call history. Help develop other lists of potential donors where the names are known but not contact information. Internet searching Keeping consistent relations with donors and future donors/sponsors. Assists in the development of Brochures, flyers, posters, etc. Must support and maintain mission goal and statement of organization. Meet at least once per week meet with Fundraising Coordinator. Competencies: Understanding of Google Docs Understanding of Microsoft Office, PowerPoint, Excel, Word, etc. Friendly phone personality, etiquette on being able to write emails. Highly organized. Experience with Internet Searching. Ability to multitask and help manage a few projects at once.

The candidate must be willing to travel to distribute the instruments and take photos with the children for the social media pages. Be organized and keep track of the instruments that are available.

11201.description: The objective of the \"Kids Supporting Kids\" program is for these students to be able to express their own artistic and creative side in a group setting as a way to engage in an authentic dialog around their life-altering experience due to cancer. The program focuses on building self-esteem, barrier breaking and education of children affected by cancer, their siblings, classmates and schoolmates. The overarching goal of this program is to increase awareness and sensitize students about the effects of this life-threatening disease on children. We believe that introducing an open conversation about the implications of cancer and its struggle will prove to be a stepping-stone towards achieving a more harmonious and understanding atmosphere for all the students. +Reach out to schools whether through emails, phone calls, social media, in person, etc. +Be comfortable around children, families, and adults to have a conversation with them and get them excited about the program! +Have 5-10 hours per week available to research, email, make phone calls, and create incredible event ideas for the schools. +Creating documents and implementing other volunteers to partake in the events. + Understanding of Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Google Drive. +Be organized, professional, on time, and have the understand this is a volunteer opportunity and taking every opportunity you may have as your last. + Be comfortable with reaching out to vendors, schools, teachers, etc. to make the events happen. +Be able to work independently and in a group setting but also be able to be self motivated to do the work. +Support AFB Mission
11201.title: Kids Supporting Kids Volunteer Coordinator

11201.description: A Free Bird is launching a new program \"AFB Support Group\" which is designed to provide emotional support for the families of the children through the arts. Just like we empower the children of A Free Bird to fight their disease through the arts, we want to empower the family to feel the love and support of one another through all types of art mediums. Since 2008, we have seen how receiving a cancer diagnosis can put a great amount of pain and stress on a family's emotional well being. Though the children are working with art tutors, the parents and children are missing their own form of art therapy. +Giving them the skills to empower them and to use in their everyday life so when they speak to their children they are good and well and can use the skills they used to speak and do not have to unload on others- these parents dont have time of their own so to properly sit down w their kids using movement skills Acquire skills that lead to a healthier lifestyle for individuals and when speaking to children +Finding health and wellness teachers +Must have 3 month availability +Must be able to work on their own and be able to attend the events created +Assist and work with setting up for the event if need be. +Be comfortable with phone calls, emails, and speaking to people in person +Be comfortable speaking with speaking to the parents of the children

A Free Bird has been supported by brands like Google, Amazon, Rite Aid, Chipotle, Macy’s, Barnes and Noble amongst many others, and was recognized by the Department of Education and Department of Cultural Affairs, and honored by Mayor Bill De Blasio at the NYC Mayoral Recognition Award for 2 consecutive years in a row for NYC Volunteer Service. 11201.description: ***Serious inquiries only, please only respond with a resume and an interest of 6 months or more, anyone who does not meet the following requirements will not be accepted for this volunteer opportunity.*** A Free Bird (AFB) is a 501(c)3), nonprofit art therapy organization dedicated to helping young people with cancer explore the artist within, by inspiring, teaching and celebrating them as artists. Founded in 2011, our organization remains 100% volunteer. Please take a moment to visit our website, www.afreebird.org to gain a better understanding of who we are and what we do. AFB is at an exciting transformational moment as we move into the next stage of growth. What began as a startup is developing into a national and international movement with the capacity to encourage, nurture and uplift children with cancer and other debilitating and life-threatening diseases the world over. We have many ideas, plans, and projects that we’d like to execute and launch this year, including a couple capital projects that involve a new home for the organization in an abandoned theater, and setting up a branch office is Israel, among others. We are challenged to create a fundraising and development operation that will provide the annual revenue and a depth of support we need to ensure that our programs and organization are supported and sustained over the short and long term. The organization’s leadership is deeply committed to its fundraising success.To this end, the Board seeks a part-time, volunteer Director of Development to join our organization for the long term. At the end of the first year, a commission can be negotiated. The successful candidate must have an authentic passion for our mission, excellent management skills, demonstrated success as an engaging fundraiser and a highly articulate communicator, skilled at making a compelling case for support both on paper and in person. Ideally, here’s what we would like in our Director of Development: An established leader with at least 10-15 years of senior development experience with demonstrable achievements, both financial and operational Proven ability to build, manage, mentor, motivate, and hold accountable to high standards, a diverse volunteer team, located in remote locations A commitment to excellence and success in increasing the effectiveness of development staff through established objectives and methods Expertise in strategic and operational resource development planning (both short and long-term); demonstrated success in executing broad fundraising strategies Proven ability to personally develop strategies, cultivate, solicit and steward major and institutional donors at the six and seven-figure levels; the ability to inspire high-net-worth individuals and major foundations to financial leadership Strong written and verbal communication skills, including grants writing, with an emphasis on the ability to persuade Creative and innovative, with entrepreneurial and strategic inclinations A Bachelor’s degree; advanced degree preferred Commitment to working 20-hours per week (minimum of 10) Commitment to volunteering a minimum of one year with AFB How to apply: please send your CV along with a brief cover letter stating the reason for your interest, your ability to commit your time, and what you hope to receive in return. AFB does not discriminate on the basis of gender, age, race, ethnicity, national origin, creed, sexual orientation, disability, or any other status protected by law.
11201.title: Volunteer Director of Development

11201.description: Volunteers at Brooklyn Historical Society (BHS) offer valuable assistance to staff, visitors, and the general public in a variety of ways. Passionate about the past, present, and future of Brooklyn, volunteers are individuals who enjoy engaging with the diverse communities who make up our great borough. BHS welcomes volunteers 18 years and older who have a sincere desire to lend their time and their skills to the institution. Volunteer opportunities are subject to availability and applicant’s qualifications. Please see the below list of available volunteer openings. Waterfront Host Waterfront Hosts are knowledgeable and approachable and will operate throughout the Waterfront exhibit at BHS DUMBO; alert and responsive to visitor needs and are eager to meet and work with visitors; willing to take initiative in assisting visitors with navigating the Museum’s amenities, public offerings, and spaces; and critical in providing visitors a positive experience at BHS. Waterfront Hosts are NOT docents or tour guides. Waterfront Hosts will report directly to the Visitor Services Coordinator on duty. Responsibilities Help manage crowds waiting to use interactive elements Assist visitors with the operation of technology within the exhibit Time management; make sure visitors aren’t monopolizing interactive features of the exhibit Make sure moving parts of the exhibit (props, magnets, costume pieces, etc.) remain in their proper areas and are not being misused or mistreated Ensure the exhibit is neat, organized, and welcoming for visitors Be familiar and comfortable with the space and its features (location of restrooms, gallery elements, visitor services desk, exits, etc.) Required Skills Strong communication Flexible attitude Professional attire Reliability and punctuality Ability to move throughout the space and/or stand for extended periods of time; reasonable accommodations will be made for any volunteer when necessary Can lift 10lbs Recommended Skills Multi-lingual Experience working with and interacting with families and children Time Commitment - 2-3 hours of training with a Visitor Services staff member. Shifts will be on Fridays, Saturdays, and Sundays. Shifts will last 4 hours with one, 15 minute break per shift. Volunteers will be required to commit to a MINIMUM of 2 shifts per month for a period of 6 months. As an active volunteer you will receive the following benefits: Free admission to BHS for you and up to 2 guests Invitations to select BHS openings Admission to BHS public programs, when available Discount in the BHS shop Free admission to most museums in New York

11201.description: The City Tutors (CT) is looking for tutors to provide in-class academic support in reading and writing for the Division of Continuing Education at the New York City College of Technology (City Tech) for Spring 2018 semester. Embedded Tutoring will run in the evening from 6-9PM. Tutors are asked to commit 2-3 hours of their time a week. Tutoring Days are yet to be determined. This is a great opportunity for: Working professionals who wish to support their community students who are majoring (or have in the course area to enhance their knowledge and experience and who wish to enhance their content knowledge and/or grow their professional experience As an embedded tutor, you would collaborate with an instructor to improve students’ performance while being supported and guide by an experienced academic support professional. You would identify and support students who are struggling, participate during the lecture to augment the class topic discussions, and provide feedback to students so that they may improve their fundamental understanding of the material. You might also design assignments, identify/track students who are struggling and create differentiated instruction as the need arises. You will be supported throughout this process by the City Tutors staff. All tutors are also expected to complete a four session comprehensive, professional training regimen. 6 hours of live training, plus another hour and a half for orientation. This is a commitment of 7.5 hours of in person training, and 4 hours of supplemental training for a total of 11.5 hours of training over the course of the Fall semester. Training days will be determined based on your schedule and that of the Tutor Training Coordinators. CT's tutoring program has been successful in helping students gain access to support that they otherwise would not have received, given their limited time spent on campus. Having a tutor in the class early in the semester will allow us to employ strategies to reduce withdrawals and student failure rates. Your work with us would help the students’ overall subject area performance, and help us improve this educational support model, reaching more students and departments with comprehensive academic support. Learn more about the Division of Continuing Education here: http://www.citytech.cuny.edu/ce/ To apply, you must: Have received an A- or A in the introduction to the subject course you are applying to tutor Have a GPA at or above 3.2, or have completed a degree program Submit monthly reports, keep a log sheet of any tutoring appointments done outside of class, and regularly communicate with the tutor training coordinator.
11201.title: Evening In-class Writing Tutor needed for City Tech Division of Continuing Education in Spring 2018

11201.description: Volunteer: Help your community stop food waste and fight hunger by bringing excess food to homeless shelters. You will be walking with trays of excess food, which would have been thrown out by the restaurant, to the nearest homeless shelter. Please note you must sign up for an account, and after you confirm your account via email, you must go back to our website www.rescuinglftovercuisine.org to sign up for the event! Core Rescuer (2:30PM-5:30PM, 10 Hours per week): A core rescuer commits to leading 10 food rescue events a week. They always lead the same events every week. Core Rescuers are required to do all of the events every week. If they miss one event, they must make up their event hour that week, or a future date, but the event must be made up. The core rescuer position is also a 4 month commitment. Throughout the four month commitment, we will supply you with an unlimited metro card for each month to complete your events. There is also a $500 stipend at the end of the program. As a core rescuer, you will also be leading groups of volunteers during events, and actively engaging them. Core rescuers educate our volunteers on the issues of food waste and hunger, while leading them from the restaurant, to a nearby homeless shelter, where we drop off the food donations. Training is provided.
11201.title: Stop Food Waste & Feed the Hungry in Brooklyn (Core Rescuer/Volunteer Opportunities)!

11201.description: The ideal Social Media Specialist will embrace our mission to empower youth and young adults toward self-mastery and leadership. The Social Media Specialist will be tasked with supporting JAIA’s current social media presence while helping to increase the organization’s online reach. We are looking for a passionate and driven person with photography skills to attract and interact with targeted virtual communities, take photos and videos, then post at JAIA programming, and improve user experience through updating our social media pages. Our goal is to gradually increase online engagement, increase website traffic (page views and likes), and recruit volunteers, youth, and future donors who see the great work we do. If interested, please email your resume to volunteer@jaiayouth.org. Qualifications and position requirements are listed read below. Qualifications Exhibits the shared values of Collaboration, Commitment, Creativity, Initiative, Integrity, Responsibility, Service & Vision Excellent writing and communication Stellar interpersonal skills Knowledge of social media platforms Photography & video skills a plus Must be responsible Able to work independently as well as in a team A natural sense of urgency; ability to juggle many initiatives at the same time Willingness to experiment & is self-driven Experience with Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, and PowerPoint) and Google platforms Knowledge of the following online platforms: Instagram Facebook Twitter Pinterest Google+ Snapchat Adobe Photoshop Any relevant imaging software Basic Responsibilities Social media management across multiple social media platforms Produce photography and original ways to photograph/capture short videos at JAIA events Attend JAIA programming to capture images Experience and a comfort level with social media tools and techniques Establish new online relationships Research new marketing ideas and opportunities Increase user engagement, expand our social reach and build buzz for Your Tango Experts Assist in creation of marketing campaigns Identify, monitor, \"befriend\" and post comments on external blogs/forums where appropriate Experiment with new & alternative ways to leverage social media activities Monitor trends in social media tools and applications and appropriately apply them
11201.title: Social Media Specialist
11201.org: Just As I Am YOUth Empowerment

11201.description: JAIA (Just As I AM) YOUth Empowerment is a personal and spiritual development leadership program serving youth and young adults, ages 13-24. JAIA YOUth offers empowering self-development workshops, life coaching & leadership training. We are currently seeking professionals, passionate about youth & youth development, experienced in the areas of marketing, finance, fundraising, grant writing, technology, event planning, or non-profit business development, to serve on our Board of Directors. Our Mission: To empower youth/young adults towards self-mastery and leadership through the use of Life Principles & Mindfulness techniques, for the purpose of encouraging mental health & promoting positive youth development. Our Vision: To create national and global youth empowerment training programs, based on the teaching of Universal Life Principles that are for, led by and sustained by, youth and young adults. Programming Workshops: JAIA offers workshops of varied lengths, for teens/young adults. The workshops are broken up into 3 series: Leadership, Life Lessons, and Prosperity Series. Workshops can be delivered individually or in a series Residencies: We offer residencies in collaboration with schools or YOUth serving agencies of 3 months to 1year, culminating in youth-led individual presentations & group community service projects. Individual & Small Group Coaching: JAIA also provides individual & small group life coaching. Leadership Training: Trainings in Peer Mediation, Peer Coaching, Workshop Facilitation and Youth Organizing are available to youth who have taken JAIA YOUth workshops, and have shown beginning levels of self-mastery. These trainings are available to schools and youth serving agencies. Monthly Programming: JAIA Expressions, a spiritual open space/open mic for teens and your adults. The Board of Directors Ideal board members will embrace our mission to empower youth/young adults towards self-mastery andleadership. This is an exciting time in JAIA’s history as we are launching both our leadership training program, as well as, our web based international exchange program. The board will be charged with strategic planning; securing appropriate resources (i.e. funding, contracts and program space); and creating partnerships that will support consistent monthly programming and extend our youth reach. Our Board Members are volunteers who provide leadership and are hands-on ensuring that the organization does the best work possible in alignment with our vision. Board Members will all actively participate in fundraising events and will lead board committees. Qualifications Experience in any of the following areas: Accounting/Finance, Non Profit Administration, Strategic Business Planning, Operations, Grant writing, Fundraising & Event Planning, Legal, Marketing, Technology. Previous experience as a hands-on board member is highly desirable. Exhibits the shared values of Collaboration, Commitment, Creativity, Initiative, Integrity, Responsibility, Service & Vision Basic Responsibilities Participate in setting strategic direction regarding program, services and outreach efforts ensuring alignment with organizational mission & vision Ensure effective organizational planning Ensure organization is fiscally sound and operated with financial integrity; approve annual budgets Ensure organization is abundantly resourced Establish policies and procedures Actively participate in fundraising activities; give or get $1000 annually Attend board meetings, committee meetings and major events Lead and serve on committees Represent JAIA YOUth Empowerment and act as a spokesperson Stay informed about JAIA YOUth Work collaboratively in supporting the mission of the organization Ensure compliance with laws and regulations Oversee governance of JAIA YOUth Empowerment Time Commitment Serve for a term of two years, approximately 6 hours a month, including 8-10 board meetings per year
11201.title: Board of Directors
11201.org: Just As I Am YOUth Empowerment

11201.description: Just As I AM (JAIA) YOUth Empowerment Volunteer Oppotunity JAIA,Just As IAm YOUth Empowerment, is a personal and spiritual development leadership program serving youth and young adults ages 13-24. Our mission is to empower youth/young adults towards self-mastery and leadership through use of Universal Life Principles and Mindfulness techniques, for the purpose of promoting positive youth development. We are a 501(c)3 non profit organization, located in East New York Brooklyn, serving youth in the NYC area and abroad. We are currently seeking an Executive Assistant to support with the following: Executive Assistant Position Description ● Report to Founder and Executive Director of the organization ● Maintain communication with stakeholders (e.g. mailing lists, donor lists, emails, phone calls, newsletters, etc.) ● Assist in daily financial management tasks (e.g. placing orders, managing accounts receivable/payable, petty cash, and coordinating with JAIA's treasurer and bookkeeper) ● Organize and maintain filing system (electronic and paper) ● Perform additional administrative tasks as needed per Executive Director Requirements: History of office management, administrative or assistant experience Knowledge of office management systems and procedures Excellent time management skills and ability to multi-task and prioritize work Excellent written and verbal communication skills Proficiency in Microsoft Word, experience with social media platforms esp. FB, Twitter, Instagram Schedule: 2 days per week 8 hours Please forward all inquiries including a resume and cover letter to: volunteer@jaiayouth.org
11201.title: Executive Assistant
11201.org: Just As I Am YOUth Empowerment

11201.description: Help out an elderly neighbor by keeping them company on appointments! Heights and Hills is a 44 year old non-profit organization that promotes successful aging in the community. We provide free case management services and referrals to frail and homebound residents over the age of sixty and their loved ones in nineteen Brooklyn neighborhoods. Our goal is to ensure that all community members, regardless of age, can continue to be vital, vibrant, and visible members of the communities they have helped to build. We need your help! Many of the people we work with are looking for comapions to help them travel to and from important medical and other kinds of appointments. Senior Companion Volunteers help out on an as needed basis by meeting our clietns at their homes and providing company and a steadying arm as they travel to and from appoinments. Volunteers accompany them by car service, Access-A-Ride, taxi and even bus and subway. Volunteer assignments usually last between 3 and 5 hours. Become a Senior Companion Volunteer today!!
11201.title: Senior Companion Volunteer

11201.description: PowerPlay NYC is a non-profit organization (in New York City) dedicated to empowering and inspiring girls through our one-of-a-kind sport and academic enrichment program. The S.T.A.R.S (Sports Training and Role models for Success) after-school program gives underserved elementary, middle, and high school girls the space to develop leadership and build character through a sports and healthy living program. PowerPlay NYC is currently looking for skilled volunteer coaches who are passionate about empowering girls and has an interest in sports, fitness, and/or nutrition. As a volunteer coach, you will get the opportunity to develop classroom management skills, deepen knowledge on youth development, enhance civic engagement, and gain valuable work experience in the non-profit industry. PowerPlay NYC’s After School programs operate in a three season model with Fall, Winter, and Spring sessions. Each season lasts for about 10 weeks. Programs meet weekly for 1.5 to 2 hours, with two coaches leading the session. The start/end times differ from site to site, but all 90-minute sessions fall during the after-school timeframe of 2:30-6pm. Programs run only on weekdays 1-2 times/week and again vary by site. PowerPlay NYC provides ongoing trainings on various topics including but not limited to the latest coaching techniques and positive youth development practices. Volunteer coaches will be required to complete a background check and will be subject to completing New York City or State Department of Education fingerprinting and security forms. Coach Responsibilities Coaching Coach at one STARS after-school program sites (1.5 - 2 hours each). PowerPlay NYC will select the coaching sites, based on coach preference and availability. Coach for the entire duration of a season. You can work for one season or commit to the entire school year, which consists of three seasons (Fall, Winter, Spring). Follow designated curriculum and collaborate with co-coach in advance. Communicate with PowerPlay NYC Program Coordinator regarding lesson plans and any additional needs. Communicate with PowerPlay NYC staff regarding site issues. Training Coaches are required to attend pre-season trainings. Coaches must attend monthly program meetings. Administration Track attendance weekly and maintain program site roster.
11201.title: Youth Development Coach for all-girls after-school program

11201.description: YOUth, mindfulness, self-mastery and vision...that's JAIA YOUth Empowerment! Serving over 300 teens, JAIA delivers workshops empowering youth in leadership, personal and spiritual development. Using mindfulness as our focus, we expose youth to universal life principles, meditation, breathing and visualization techniques. Youth love being in our workshops because they can tell it's a safe space to get clarity about their lives. JAIA stands for Just As I AM and we want each teen and young adult to know they make a difference just as they are! We are seeking professionals who are passionate about youth development and possess a mastery level of experience in non-profit law, bookkeeping, accounting, marketing, operations, finance, fundraising, grant writing, technology, and/or non-profit business development, to serve on our Administrative Council. As part of the Administrative Council at JAIA, your leadership and professional skills would serve to support our organizational structure and support JAIA's growth in the following areas: non-profit development, fund-raising, event planning, program development, and finance. We’re looking for innovative, \"outside the box\" thinkers. We at JAIA place great value in creative expression, vision and collaboration in a safe space as we model these values for the youth we serve.
11201.title: Administrative Council Member
11201.org: Just As I Am YOUth Empowerment

11201.description: Since 1971, Heights and Hills has helped Brooklyn's older adults age successfully in their communities with independence, dignity and grace. Our Friendly Visiting program matches volunteers of all ages with home-bound and/or socially isolated seniors for weekly companionship - volunteers and clients go on walks, run errands, cook together, play cards, craft, talk about music, art, sports, politics or whatever else they find they have in common! Whenever possible Friendly Visitor volunteers are matched with seniors in their own neighborhood. Getting started is easy: fill out a short application and come into our office in downtown Brooklyn to speak with someone from the Volunteer Program. We look forward to hearing from you!
11201.title: Friendly Visiting

11201.description: Seniors in nursing facilities tend to have few visitors, but with a few hours of your time, you can provide the social interaction that is important to keeping their spirits soaring. There are a variety of projects with seniors such as knitting, gardening, and even teaching basic computer skills. Just a few hours of your time can help brighten up a senior’s week. Search our projects at www.newyorkcares.org/search/project Before you can volunteer on a New York Cares project, you must attend a one-hour orientation. After that, you can choose from hundreds of flexibly scheduled volunteer projects every month. Learn more about volunteering with New York Cares at www.newyorkcares.org.
11201.title: Seniors Projects with New York Cares in Brooklyn

11201.description: Volunteers on New York Cares' Hunger projects do more than just serve a meal -- they provide a warm smile, friendly conversation, and the reassurance that someone cares. These projects serve hundreds of men, women, and children at homeless shelters, churches, and senior centers each day. Search our projects at www.newyorkcares.org/search/project Before you can volunteer on a New York Cares project, you must attend a one-hour orientation. After that, you can choose from hundreds of flexibly scheduled volunteer projects every month. Learn more about volunteering with New York Cares at www.newyorkcares.org.
11201.title: Hunger Projects with New York Cares in Brooklyn

11201.description: On New York Cares' Health and Wellness projects, volunteers bring much-needed companionship to long-term hospital residents and individuals living with devastating illnesses, such as HIV/AIDS. Search our projects at www.newyorkcares.org/search/project Before you can volunteer on a New York Cares project, you must attend a one-hour orientation. After that, you can choose from hundreds of flexibly scheduled volunteer projects every month. Learn more about volunteering with New York Cares at www.newyorkcares.org.
11201.title: Health and Wellness Projects with New York Cares in Brooklyn

11201.description: Keeping kids active is an important part of their development, so help us get them off the couch! Some projects available for volunteers include sports, field trips, and even culinary activities. Sports and fitness projects keep children healthy and active, arts and culture projects help them discover their creativity, and recreational outings expose them to the unique activities and culture of New York City. Search our projects here: http://www.newyorkcares.org/search/project Before you can volunteer on a New York Cares project, you must attend a one-hour orientation. After that, you can choose from hundreds of flexibly scheduled volunteer projects every month. Learn more about volunteering with New York Cares at http://www.newyorkcares.org.

New York Cares' Children's Education projects help New York City's underserved children develop their academic skills at an early age, improving their chances of getting into college and preparing them for future success. Search our projects at www.newyorkcares.org/search/project Before you can volunteer on a New York Cares project, you must attend a one-hour orientation. After that, you can choose from hundreds of flexibly scheduled volunteer projects every month. Learn more about volunteering with New York Cares at www.newyorkcares.org.
11201.title: Children's Education Projects with New York Cares in Brooklyn

11201.description: New York Cares offers many programs serving adults and children with special needs. Our volunteers provide a little extra care and attention to the physically disabled, who often face limited recreational activities and educational opportunities. These projects provide important social interaction while teaching essential independent living skills. Search our projects at www.newyorkcares.org/search/project Before you can volunteer on a New York Cares project, you must attend a one-hour orientation. After that, you can choose from hundreds of flexibly scheduled volunteer projects every month. Learn more about volunteering with New York Cares at www.newyorkcares.org.
11201.title: Adults and Children with Special Needs Projects with New York Cares in Brooklyn

11201.description: Planning for a better future starts by believing that one is possible. On New York Cares' Adult Education projects, volunteers help capable but struggling New Yorkers, many of whom are transitioning out of homelessness, build a brighter future for themselves and their families. Search our projects at www.newyorkcares.org/search/project Before you can volunteer on a New York Cares project, you must attend a one-hour orientation. After that, you can choose from hundreds of flexibly scheduled volunteer projects every month. Learn more about volunteering with New York Cares at www.newyorkcares.org.

11203.description: Do you live or work in Flatbush/EastFlatbush? We are looking for kind, patient, firendly volunteers who are interested in getting to know their frail and/or hombound older neighbors. Become a Friendly Visitor and spend a few hours a week walking and/or visiting with an isolated older neighbor who will benefit from your company!
11203.title: Flatbush and East Flatbush needs Friendly Visiting volunteers!

11202.description: Looking for a fun summer internship? We offer a hands on opportunity for interns to work on our website, brochures, flyers, etc. Great experience, meet new people, casual atmosphere and great career builder. Assist with all aspects of creating promotional materials. Visit our website for more information about the Toy Museum, www.ToyMuseumNY.org. Email your resume along with a link to projects you have created.
11202.title: Graphic Design Summer Interns

11205.description: We are looking for volunteers that like working with children and would like to improved their tennis skills. Volunteers will be ask to attend a one day free training and must become a member of USTA. Once you are a member you will take a On line training course and you must pass a back ground screening. We will offer all volunteers free racquet stringing and at least one free private lesson.
11205.title: Youth Tennis Program at Fort Greene Park

11205.description: A Free Bird is a 501(C)(3)non-profit organization based in New York City. Our focus is to provide children, ages 6-18 who are patients or survivors of juvenile cancer, the opportunity to explore their artistic passions and give them the strength to fight their disease. We believe that artistic expression is critical for healing! A Free Bird supports children affected by cancer in their exploration of art, music, acting, poetry, writing, singing and any other artistic passion they may have. We are seeking a Marketing Intern who can commit 5-10 hours per week for minimum of 3 months (50 hours). Position is non-paid but can apply for school internship credit. This is not a filing and get coffee type internship. You will have REAL responsibilities and acquire marketable experience Responsibilities: Assist with daily project management of digital and traditional marketing, working with Marketing Coordinator on strategy, analytics and logistics Coordinate the working document to track projects cross-departmentally Assist in Managing timelines for e-appeals, campaigns, cultivations and optimizations (such as donor pages, homepage and confirmations); Assist with Managing timelines for vetting of direct mail pieces for six different appeals monthly; Assist with coordinating the Integrated Marketing Calendar of all fundraising and cultivation activities; Liaison with the Programs, Graphic Design/Web, Fundraising and PR departments Draft marketing copy for brochures, posters, presentations and other organizational collateral; Coordinate with the Graphic Design and Web department with copy for creative projects; Performing other responsibilities as may be required. Qualifications: Excellent writing and editing skills with ability to produce polished and compelling copy on tight deadlines Creativity in tapping and cultivating mainstream media and social networking communities A positive, energetic and proactive multi-tasker who can work independently or very collaboratively, as part of a team Ability to work effectively, efficiently, diplomatically and calmly in a high-pressure environment on issues that are often complex and politically sensitive Strong listener, with a high degree of professionalism and flexibility, including the ability to prioritize and effectively manage assignments in a timely fashion
11205.title: Marketing Volunteer

11205.description: A Free Bird is a 501(C)(3)non-profit organization based in New York City. Our focus is to provide children, ages 6-18 who are patients or survivors of juvenile cancer, the opportunity to explore their artistic passions and give them the strength to fight their disease. We believe that artistic expression is critical for healing! A Free Bird supports children affected by cancer in their exploration of art, music, acting, poetry, writing, singing and any other artistic passion they may have. We have launched a magazine to promote, communicate and support our organization's mission. Our premiere issue launched 9/23/13 and we are actively developing our next edition. We are seeking a talented editor with excellent time-management, team leadership and project management skills to perform a variety of editorial tasks, such as writing, editing, and copyediting, as well as supervising staff and keeping the magazine on schedule. Recent graduates or graduate students who held editor-positions with their school newspapers, school year books, or other school periodicals are strongly encouraged to apply. Non-Traditional/Continuing Education students strongly encouraged to apply Please review our premier edition at http://www.afreebird.org/magazine/ All applicants should anticipate a 1 month, with rigorous work between January 19th-February 5th.
11205.title: Magazine Editor

11205.description: Reading Partners needs volunteers like you to provide students in under-resourced elementary schools in your community with the proven, individualized reading support they need to read at grade level by fourth grade. Reading is the foundation for all future learning.The ability to read transforms lives and can empower children to reach their full potential. Research shows that when students can read at grade level by fourth grade, they have a greater opportunity to succeed in school and in life. With your help, we can equip students with the foundational skills they need to read at grade level. Each week, you will meet one-on-one with your student every week to help them develop strong literacy skills and discover a passion for reading. We'll provide a structured curriculum, in-person training, and ongoing support to help your student thrive. Rigorous research has proven that Reading Partners significantly increases reading proficiency. No teaching experience required and anyone over the age of 14 can volunteer. Flexible Monday to Thursday volunteer times between 9am and 5pm. Visit our website at www.readingpartners.org/volunteer to sign up and learn more.
11205.title: Become a reading partner- make a lifelong impact on a child (PS 54 Samuel C. Barnes, NYC)

11205.description: Hi All, We're looking for someone to join the team as the Security Advisor/Consultant. As we are still in start-up mode this will start as a volunteer position but once we are revenue positive we'd be open to transitioning the role into a full-time (or part-time) paid position. The main job of the Security Auditor/Consultant will be to review a clients location and policies, highlight the vulnerabilities (area's, times, assets), flag the gaps in their security frameworks, and provide suggestions for improvements. We are looking for someone with a background in security, someone who is a team player, and someone who is looking to put their skills to good use by helping to ensure the safety of people who have devoted themselves to making the world a better place.
11205.title: Organizational Security Advisor
11205.org: SECURITY TRAINING OPERATIONS AND AWARENESS INCORPORATED

11205.description: Do you love to knit and enjoy getting to know people? Especially your older friends and neighbors? Are you looking for a meaningful activity in your community? Female Friendly Visiting volunteers who love to knit are needed to visit with older homebound women for an hour or two a week. Socialize and knit together in Fort Greene and Prospect Heights. Must have week day availability, preferably on Mondays and/or Fridays. Join a vibrant group of local volunteers who provide companionship and support to homebound older adults in their own Brooklyn neighborhoods through weekly social visits, and/or assistance with small but meaningful errands and household projects. Become a friendly visitor today! Heights and Hills Friendly Visiting Program introduces volunteers and isolated elderly neighbors to each other for companionship and support. Volunteers visit with his/her friend once a week at a mutually convenient time. Friendly Visits can take place on the week-ends and in the evenings as well as the daytime during the week. Volunteers provide companionship and assistance with very light household tasks such as helping someone who is visually impaired sort their mail. Volunteers and clients go for walks, play cards, cook together, chat about music, art, sports, theater, movies, TV shows - it really depends on the two people involved! to chat, read together, share interests, etc. We believe that this special volunteer opportunity will enrich your life in ways that you may have never imagined, and will brighten the life of one other person: an isolated elderly neighbor. For more information or to become a Friendly Visiting volunteer please contact the Volunteer Coordintator, at (718) 596-8789 or email us at volunteer@heightsandhills.org
11205.title: Friendly Visitor Knitting Buddy

11205.description: Grant writing can be fast-paced. Grant writers may work on several projects at once under tight deadlines. The availability of funding also fluctuates, so grant writers must develop a diversified network of funding organizations. YTC is calling out to those at all levels of grant writing experience. College students and entry level volunteers are highly encouraged to apply for this amazing volunteer position.
11205.title: GRANT YTC WITH PROPOSAL WRITING

11204.description: A growing number of Mandarin Chinese-speaking women living in Brooklyn have a desire to learn English. Struggling to communicate in the native language where they live makes it extremely difficult to achieve healthy independence and greatly limits their ability to navigate supportive services and seek job opportunities. If you are fluent in both languages and want to empower women to achieve freedom from the isolation caused by communicational barriers, please email your interest and availability to Jennifer Groff, Community Engagement Director, at jgroff@use.salvationarmy.org.
11204.title: Help Teach English to Mandarin Chinese Speakers

11207.description: This is an opportunity to make a lasting contribution to the academic and social development of children in East New York, Brooklyn. The school's Board of Trustees is involved in the oversight of all aspects of the school's operations, including fiscal oversight, academic achievement, family programs and the school's character and leadership programs. The board meets monthly, along with periodic board committee conference calls. We are looking for people who are passionate about children's education and who are willing to share their expertise in support of the school, whether that be in education, the law, advocacy, community development, communications or other fields.

Brighter Choice Community School needs an interior designer to help transform a classroom into a teachers' lounge. Please let us know if you would be interedted and we can send you more information on how to get invlved!

11208.description: Take a brief tour of the Fannie Barnes Library located in Brownsville, Brooklyn, NY. We were asked to join forces with Northernstar Youth Initiative and the Fannie Barnes residence to recreate and rebuild their library. In addition we will be adding Adult literacy programs, and youth read alongs to promote literacy and the arts. 11208.description: Our youth and community center is searching for individuals who are open to working under a Village concept. We currently provide services to the community members in East New York, Bushwick, and Canarsie and other parts of Brooklyn with hopes and plans to expand to other boroughs. As a coalition of Non-Profits we will be providing workshops and classes to the community. We are looking for volunteers who will be able to assist with administrative tasks like attendance monitoring and taking. Filing paperwork and making phone calls. Running small groups and facilitating outreach programs when necessary.

08816.description: Position Summary: The Disability Allies (DA) is dedicated to providing a social and learning environment for young adults and children with disabilities. The Teaching Assistant is a part time volunteer position that involves a commitment of a few hours a week. The Teaching Assistant will work with the teacher to promote interactive and structured learning for students with disabilities. Responsibilities: The Teaching Assistant will work with the teacher to promote interactive and structured learning for students with disabilities. The Teaching Assistant will assist the Teacher with the following tasks: Reinforce lessons presented by teachers by reviewing material with students one-on-one or in small groups Enforce school and class rules to help teach students proper behavior Help teachers with recordkeeping, such as tracking attendance and calculating grades Help students with social disorders improve their communication skills Qualifications & Competencies: Excellent public speaking and presentation skills Must be able to meet deadlines and adjust to changing priorities Must be proficient in Microsoft Office Able to effectively communicate both verbally and in writing Ability to connect with others and develop relationships Committed to the mission of serving young adults with disabilities Ability to perform several tasks concurrently Strong time management and organizational skills Ability to maintain detailed records and confidential information The Disability Allies (DA) is dedicated to providing a social and learning environment for young adults and children with disabilities. Students are paired up with mentors who help them learn in fun and structured environment. Our mentors help them with their social skills, help develop a core academic curriculum and reinforce learning strategies that were taught in school. 08816.description: Position Summary: The Disability Allies (DA) is dedicated to providing social opportunities to connect young adults and children with and without disabilities. The Volunteer Social Worker is a part time volunteer position that involves a commitment of a few hours a week. He or she must be willing to join us at our monthly committee meetings at the Milltown Public Library at 10am on the Second Saturday of the Month. The Volunteer Social Worker will help participants at our events improve their social skills and interaction with other people. He or she will also obtain feedback from our participants and help resolve any conflicts. Responsibilities: Provide guidance, motivation, emotional support, and role modeling to our participants. Resolve conflict between our participants. Ensure that each participant is engaged in all the activities at our events. Encourage participants to interact with each other. Develop strategies to improve the social skills of our participants. Develop lasting relationships with our participants. Follow-up with participants and encourage them to attend our events attend our events. Obtain feedback from our participants about our events. Help pair up participants and mentors biased on their interests and disabilities. Essential functions/working conditions: Ability to work in a team setting Strong social and interpersonal skills Comfortable with mentoring individuals with disabilities Able to effectively communicate both verbally and in writing Ability to connect with others and develop relationships Committed to the mission of serving young adults and children with disabilities Ability to perform several tasks concurrently Strong time management and organizational skills About the Disability Allies: The purpose of the Disability Allies is to plan team building activities that connect young adults and children with and without disabilities. At our events we pair each individual up with a mentor. The job of the mentor is to help the participants with their social skills and insure that everyone interacts with each other. Our events are open to any young adult that has a disability, knows someone with a disability or is supportive of people with disabilities. Please visit www.disabilityallies.com to learn more. 08816.description: If you have an hour or more per week to give, Ascend Hospice welcomes your gifts of time and compassion. Whether you choose to work directly with patients and families or to volunteer in one of many other ways, you can make a profound difference in someone's life, including your own. Volunteers are an integral part of the hospice team. Volunteer Opportunities: Companionship Volunteers work directly with patients providing companionship, offering friendly visits, reading to patients, writing letters, offering a gentle touch or sharing a quiet moment. Complementary Volunteers are certified/trained professionals who can provide complementary modalities of reflexologly, music, Reiki, & massage. Ascend Hospice is seeking certified Reiki practioners to serve our end of life population in finding comfort, relaxation and peace during their final time with us. Your assistance is needed with reducing anxiety, relieving pain and providing a safe , comfortable environment. Training provided for volunteers. Reiki Certification is required. Pet Therapy Volunteers provide companionship from our certified therapy dogs. Pet therapy provides numerous benefits like encouraging movement and physical stimulation and it provides mental benefits like socialization, mental stimulation, companionship, and unconditional love. Please consider sharing your loving pet with us and bring some much needed smiles. Pets must be certified as therapy animals by an organization like TDI Therapy Dogs International- see website here http://www.tdi-dog.org/ Music Volunteers are volunteers who specialize in sharing songs or instrumental music with patients and their loved ones. Whether the Music Volunteer is sharing an existing musical skill or playing music via the radio or digital device, the goal is to enhance the quality of life of our patients. Often, regularly scheduled visits are requested, however Music Volunteers may also be asked to provide musical visits on an occasional basis for one patient/family or for a group of patients at a facility as outreach for the local hospice agency. Hospice is built on the philosophy that we care for our patients in mind, body and soul. Administrative Volunteers provide help in our Cranford office by assisting with typing, addressing cards, organizing newsletters, creating packets, collating manuals and other varied clerical duties Craft Volunteers consist of individuals or groups who touch patients in a special way by making lap blankets, shawls, memory bears and other articles for patients to enjoy. Bereavement Volunteers offer support to the families of patients who have passed. During the grieving process the bereavement volunteer can be a valuable resource, especially for those who lack a solid support network. They often make phone calls to check up on family members and also send cards of comfort and care. For more information about our free volunteer training and available opportunities, call our Volunteer Department or visit our website at Ascendhospice.com! We look forward to hearing from you! Please do NOT contact me with unsolicited services or offers.
08816.title: Hospice Volunteers - Companion, Musician, Pet Therapy, Reiki - East Brunswick

08816.description: Job Objective: The Disability Allies (DA) is dedicated to providing social opportunities to connect young adults and children with and without disabilities. The Volunteer Website/ Database Developer is a part time position. You must be willing to join us at our monthly committee meetings at the East Brunswick Public Library at 10am on the Second Saturday of the Month. As a developer you will work with technology team to deliver the new Disability Allies web site, develop, test, troubleshoot and enhance website features based on requests from the users and committee chairs/teams. You will Migrate content from old site to new site and provide assistance to create content while the site features are under construction. Technical requirements: At least 1 year of hands-on experience with CMS such as Joomla, Drupal or WordPress. The site is being developed using Joomla so experience with that is preferred. Familiar with web development using PHP, HTML, CSS and JavaScript. Familiar with databases and SQL Understands the 3-tier web design architecture Understanding of AWS hosting (bonus) Other Requirements Should be able to dedicate at least 4-6 hours a week on assigned tasks. Good communication skills and have a proactive attitude. Should be able to attend weekly 1-hour Skype/Google hangout calls on weekends and meet in-person once a month on a weekend Should be able to estimate time and effort on assigned tasks and provide weekly status updates. Able to work in a dynamic environment. The Financial Planner reports to the CEO and is responsible for all financial functions. The title of the position is subject to change before being hired. Responsibilities: The Financial Planner’s primary responsibilities are to handle all the financial functions of the Disability Allies. Supervise all accounting and finance functions Including accounting, billing, payroll and budgeting Prepare clear, concise and constructive reports and recommendations for the board and senior management Plan and direct the preparation of financial statements and reports Qualifications & Competencies: Excellent public speaking and presentation skills Must be able to meet deadlines and adjust to changing priorities Must be proficient in Microsoft Office Able to effectively communicate both verbally and in writing Ability to connect with others and develop relationships Committed to the mission of serving young adults with disabilities Ability to perform several tasks concurrently Strong time management and organizational skills Ability to maintain detailed records and confidential information About the Disability Allies: The purpose of the Disability Allies is to plan team building activities that connect young adults and children with and without disabilities. At our events we pair each individual up with a mentor. The job of the mentor is to help the participants with their social skills and insure that everyone interacts with each other. Our events are open to any young adult that has a disability, knows someone with a disability or is supportive of people with disabilities. Please visit www.disabilityallies.com to learn more.
