07052.description: The success of Walk MS is directly related to the wonderful volunteers who dedicate their time to the chapter. We welcome volunteers of all ages, abilities and talents to assist with a variety of volunteer opportunities. There is only one requirement - a desire to see a world free of MS! All Walk MS volunteers receive: Volunteer T-shirt Snacks and beverages Community service hours Plenty of smiles, high fives and thanks! Check out our Walk MS Volunteer Opportunities! Check-In Crew: Volunteers assist in event set-up, register walk-on participants, and hand out T-shirts. 7 AM - 11 AM Cheer Crew: Encourage and cheer-on our event participants. 9 AM - 2 PM Set-up/Break-down Crew: Volunteers will assist with setting up and breaking down tables and chairs, posting signage and moving boxes/other event supplies (must be able to lift boxes, stand for long periods of time and bend). Set-up: 6:30 AM - 11 AM Break-down: 10 AM - 2 PM Entertainers: We’re looking for musicians, DJs, face painters, magicians, clowns, balloon artists and more to donate their time and join the movement. Photographers: Using your own equipment, you will take photos capturing the magic of Walk MS including route, celebration and team photos. For more information, visit: www.walkms.org
07052.title: Join the Movement! Volunteer at Walk MS 2018 West Orange!
07052.org: National Multiple Sclerosis Society - New Jersey Metro Chapter

07052.description: Volunteers - NEEDED Join us on Saturday, May 19th from 8:00am - 12:00pm at the South Mountain Recreation Park, 11 Cherry Lane, West Orange, NJ 2018 New Jersey MDA Muscle Walk to benefit individuals living with neuromuscular diseases Job responsibilities may include/are not limited to: Accounting Team Captain Check-in Assisting with setting/cleaning up Assist individuals whom are differently-abled with art projects Assist with setting up vendor tables and vendor needs Replenish food/water as needed Greeters - responsible for welcoming guests upon arrival Traffic Control Runners - responsibilities include relaying information to team and MDA staff Please be flexible should we need you to help in other areas. We can provide you with a letter for your service hours if requested. Thanks for all your help in making a difference!
07052.title: MDA Muscle Walk of Central NJ 2018

07052.description: A Jersey Cares Project Coordinator will assist volunteers in mentoring students by leading book discussions, assisting students in studying for exams, helping in creative arts or just by talking about the everyday challenges of life. Volunteers are needed to help highly motivated, academically qualified, yet economically disadvantaged eighth grade students with their math and writing. The program’s goal is to develop future leaders through education. Students participate in a rigorous 14-month preparatory program that places them in competitive, primarily independent, secondary schools. NOTE: To participate in this project you must be a Jersey Cares volunteer. To sign up as a Jersey Cares volunteer: 1. Visit www.jerseycares.org 2. Click on \"Log-In\" 3. Click on \"Not a Member? Register\" 4. Fill out all necessary information. 5. Register for a project!
07052.title: Tutor and Mentor in West Orange

07052.description: Reading Buddies, a program of the RSVP Center of Essex and Hudson Counties at Jewish Family Service MetroWest, engages older adult volunteers in promoting childhood literacy in public schools. Volunteers age 55+ read to the same small group of students each week throughout the school year using a read-aloud format that supplements the school’s regular reading curriculum. Reading Buddies is a one of a kind program that uses volunteers to support children grades k-2 and educators in the classroom. This program is a one hour commitment once a week. All volunteers must submit to a background check. If you are interested in signing up to read to children or would like to know what schools we currently need volunteers in, please contact Stephanie Grove at sgrove@jfsmetrowest.org or 793-637-1766.
07052.title: Reading Buddies (Essex County)

07052.description: Life Choice Hospice is seeking Pet Therapy Volunteers to visit our hospice patients throughout Northern NJ. Providing our patients with loving touch and care from certified pet therapy animals and owners is beyond appreciated by both our patients and our staff. Your dog must be certified and the handler needs training by Life Choice Hospice as a hospice volunteer. Volunteer training and medical requirements are provided FREE by Life Choice. Please help bring companionship and joy into the life of a Hospice patient!
07052.title: Share Your Pet’s Love – Seeking Certified Pet Therapy Volunteers for Hospice!

07052.description: Description Utilize free time to be compassionate and genuine in order to reduce terminally ill patients’ loneliness and isolation. Please help us keep our patients happy and comfortable as they reach the end of their life due to a variety of health conditions including: cancer, Alzheimer’s, etc. Responsibilities of Companion volunteers: Contribute to our patients' quality of life Attend to Patients' Needs Communicate with Nurses by keeping them Up to Date about each Patient visited Maintain Patients' Confidentiality Travel and Visit patients in facilities in an area near you Read to them, give hand massage, assist in life review or memory building Massage Therapist, Raiki Certified, Pet Therapy Certified come and make a difference We offer you: FREE TB test and MMR Titer Extremely flexible assignments (anytime you can give is greatly appreciated) Convenient Orientation and FREE training and that fits your schedule
07052.title: Caring Hospice/Healthcare Volunteers Needed in West Orange, NJ

07050.description: Arts Unbound is a non-profit gallery and art studio in Orange serving people with disabilities and seniors. In May, Arts Unbound is hosting our fourth annual ArtBender. ArtBender is a series of creative events that raise funds for Arts Unbound programs and promote art in our daily lives. Join the 12-hour art-making marathon, attend an ArtBender party, help raise funds, or attend the silent auction. There will be events all weekend, May 5-6 and a silent art auction, May 11, 2018. Celebrate your creative nature...reveal the unrealized potential in all of us...and help Arts Unbound raise $50,000 to support artists with disabilities. We need volunteers to help make ArtBender a success. We are looking for local folks to help with the following: Distribute posters to local businesses Distribute postcards to local public places (libraries, coffee shops, groceries) and businesses Ask for refreshment donations for art marathon and auction Ask businesses, especially barbershops, hair salons, and nail salons, to participate Encourage people to host a bender or attend one Sell auction tickets In your reply, please tell us which tasks you'd like to take on.
07050.title: ArtBender Volunteer

07050.description: The Arts Unbound Advisory Council is seeking new members to provide their perspectives and input to our staff and board as people with disabilities, artists, artists with disabilities, caregivers, retail and arts professionals, or educators. The Arts Unbound Advisory Council is a group of community stakeholders and volunteers with specific expertise who provide input to the staff and board. Members of the Advisory Council support our mission by providing our organization with their professional expertise; their diverse knowledge of constituent perspectives; their connections to local or national resources, colleagues or peers; or other forms of needed assistance. The Advisory Council has no governing function within the organization. Meetings: Quarterly Membership: Nominated by staff or board; elected by the board of directors. Two-year terms. Expectations: Attend at least two meetings per year. Contribute your expertise and thinking to the current and future work of Arts Unbound, including our strategic plan and program development. Be available for four to five telephone calls each year from staff seeking advice. Inform the organization's triennial accessibility plan revisions. Interested candidates should contact Margaret Mikkelsen at mmikkelsen@artsunbound.org and attach a resume including any relevant volunteer, community, or work experience.
07050.title: Advisory Council Member

07050.description: Arts Unbound is currently seeking new board members for open seats on our volunteer board of directors. The board supports the work of Arts Unbound and provide mission-based leadership and strategic governance to help us reach our goals: To promote careers in the visual arts as an option for people with disabilities. To provide ongoing participatory arts programming to seniors to support their artistic expression and emotional well-being. To ensure artists with disabilities have equal access to resources and can express their own creative vision. While day-to-day operations are led by the executive director hired by the board, the Board-ED relationship is a partnership, and the appropriate involvement of the Board is both critical and expected. Specific board member responsibilities include: Leadership, governance, and oversight Serving as a trusted adviser to the ED as s/he develops and implements AU’s strategic plan. Approving AU’s annual budget, audit reports, and material business decisions; being informed of, and meeting all, legal and fiduciary responsibilities. Serving on committees or task forces and taking on special assignments. Representing AU to stakeholders; acting as an ambassador for the organization. Ensuring AU’s commitment to a diverse board and staff. Fundraising Board Members will consider Arts Unbound a philanthropic priority and make annual gifts that reflect that priority. So that we can credibly solicit contributions from foundations, organizations, and individuals, we expect to have 100 percent of board members make an annual contribution that is commensurate with their capacity. Board members are expected to actively contribute to fundraising efforts and complete an annual personal fundraising plan that raises a minimum of $2,000 in unrestricted funding for the organization. Interested candidates should contact Margaret Mikkelsen at mmikkelsen@artsunbound.org to be referred to the board development committee. Please attach a resume and provide any relevant information about prior volunteer or board service.
07050.title: Volunteer Board Member

07055.description: Assist in many ways to make the lives of seniors living in the community more satisfying. You can drive, deliver meals, visit at home, escort to Doctors appointments, help plan recreational activities/ privide support in-home to families with sprcial needs children
07055.title: senior companion/special needs respite

07055.description: There are a number of ways in which one can relate to senior citizens, reading to those who are visually impaired, driving for meals on wheels, joing our aging in place program and assisting in program planning and on site visits, serving lunch once a week, or newly added to our program, teaching and playing wii!
07055.title: Senior relationship volunteer

07054.description: We are looking for Volunteers that want to give back to the community and help our residents have fun in their home. I am looking for people that are good at games like cards, bingo, board games. I am also looking for people that are good at arts and crafts or even musicians that want to practice there musical talent. If you think you fit into one of these categories we would love to have you. if you don't think so we can work together and see what your strengths are. Boy Scouts and Girl Scout troops are more then welcome to join also.
07054.title: Activity Supporter

07054.description: The New Jersey Chapter of the Cystic Fibrosis Foundation welcomes you! Volunteers are the key to our success and the lifeblood of our organization. We have many opportunities for you to get involved. Your participation in any way will help us achieve our mission - finding a cure for all people with CF. Cystic Fibrosis Foundation-Greater New Jersey Chapter would like a few volunteers to help with office organization and to assist in preparing for upcoming events.
07054.title: Office Volunteers Needed
07054.org: Cystic Fibrosis Foundation Greater New Jersey

Providing our patients with loving touch and care from certified pet therapy animals and owners is beyond appreciated by both our patients and our staff. 07054.title: Great Opportunity for Healthcare Students!

11102.description: Are you a beauty enthusiast or a beauty professional? Would you like to donate an hour or more of your time to making seniors feel good? We are looking for people to donate an hour to do manicures on the seniors. We will provide all materials and take some pictures you can have as a keepsake! We have also recently lost our licensed person who did free haircuts. If interested please reply, asimmons@hanac.org. Saturday 10am-12:30 (brunch provided) Email me if you would like to help asimmons@hanac.org
11102.title: Manicures for seniors! Saturdays
11102.org: HANAC JVL Innovative Senior Center & HANAC Training and Employment

11102.description: adult volunteers to assist teaching staff with distribution collection of assignments, filing of results and helping with basic computer instructions, such as how to turn on equipment, set up email, etc.
11102.title: Adult Education program helpers
11102.org: HANAC JVL Innovative Senior Center & HANAC Training and Employment

11102.description: The Center for the Integration & Advancement of New Americans (CIANA) is a social services organization that works to integrate new immigrants from South Asia, the Middle East, North Africa and Latin America into the socio-economic and civic life of American society while maintaining pride in their cultural heritage. CIANA is seeking an Administrative/Program Assistant Intern for our Program & Administrative Manager to manage her schedule and the operations in the office 3-5 days per week. This is a great opportunity for a college student to gain hands-on experience in the workforce, or for retirees to make a meaningful contribution to a neighborhood organization. Responsibilities : Welcome guests to the office and direct them to the appropriate staff member Schedule meetings and help maintain our Manager's calendars Conduct general intakes with clients and provide them with information for the service requested (ESL, civics, legal, etc) Answer the main phone line, respond to inquiries, and take messages when necessary Answer the door Return calls to clients when needed Maintain inventory of office supplies biweekly Enter new clients’ info into database Maintain copies of documents (intake forms, flyers, assessments, etc) Keep common areas presentable for visitors Stock copy machine with paper and troubleshooting as needed Qualifications: Must have high school diploma or equivalent; bachelor degree candidates preferred Highly organized and detail-oriented Exhibits professional and courteous demeanor and phone etiquette Respectful and sensitive to other cultures Fluency in another language (especially Arabic, Spanish, and Bengali) is a big plus! How to apply: College students are encouraged to apply. Please send your resume and a detailed cover letter to: Kylen Button, Program & Administrative Manager at kylen@cianainc.org. Please include the position title in the subject line. Please note that applications without a cover letter will not be considered
11102.title: Administrative/Program Assistant Intern
11102.org: Center for the Integration and Advancement of New Americans, CIANA

11102.description: Description: Established in 2006, Center for the Integration & Advancement of New Americans (CIANA) is a social service organization that works to integrate new immigrants from South Asia, Middle-East, North Africa, and Latin America into American society. As CIANA provides basic services that seek to make daily life easier to navigate, we would like to expand our help to provide access to benefits and application assistance. Responsibilities: Assist our staff attorney, case manager, and/or program manager in interviewing non-English speaking clients Translating documents, materials, and web-based and paper applications into Spanish, Arabic, or Bengali Answering phone calls and assisting non-English speaking callers The volunteer must: be available at least 10 hours per week have superior people skills and enjoy working with diverse populations be highly organized, goal oriented, and a problem solver Language proficiency in Arabic Bengali, and/or Spanish How to apply: Please send your resume and cover letter, highlighting your language skills to volunteer@cianainc.org. Please include the position title in the subject line of the e-mail.
11102.title: Translator (Bengali, Arabic, or Spanish)
11102.org: Center for the Integration and Advancement of New Americans, CIANA

11102.description: The Center for the Integration and Advancement of New Americans (CIANA) is a small, community-based organization in Astoria, Queens that seeks to integrate new immigrants from the Middle-East/North Africa, and South Asia into the socio-economic and civic life of American society, with a focus on family and children’s services. CIANA seeks volunteer attorneys to support its work delivering immigration workshops in Queens public libraries. The Pathway to US Citizenship Program provides immigrants with important information about how to become US Citizens through the process of naturalization. Responsibilities: Deliver interactive immigration law workshops in libraries around Queens. Develop new materials to reflect rapidly changing immigration law landscape. Report to Director of Legal Services when clients need follow-up assistance. Qualifications: Independent, confident, and motivated to help immigrants in need of legal information. Demonstrated commitment to social justice issues. Willingness to travel to libraries around Queens on Saturday afternoons. Admitted to NY bar preferred. Fluency in a language other than English is a plus. JD 2+ years of immigration experience. To apply, please send your resume, cover letter listing your availability, and writing sample to volunteer@cianainc.org
11102.title: Volunteer Immigration Attorneys

11102.description: CIANA is looking for a friendly and bright individual to maintain order in the office while client services are being provided. We are currently looking for volunteers who can assist in providing services for our clients. Responsibilities range from keeping the office presentable to managing our client database, plus other assigned duties related to program operations.

11102.description: The Center for the Integration & Advancement of New Americans (CIANA) is a social services organization that works to integrate new immigrants from South Asia, the Middle East, North Africa and Latin America into the socio-economic and civic life of American society while maintaining pride in their cultural heritage. CIANA is seeking a volunteer teacher for our English as a Second Language classes, offered on Tuesdays and Thursdays from 10:30 AM to 12 PM. We have a diverse client population of Arabic, Spanish, and Bengali speakers. Our fall semester runs from September 12 to November 16, 2017, with the expectation that the volunteer will teach for all 10 weeks. Responsibilities: ESL classes are offered every Tuesday and Thursday 10:30AM - 12:00PM Write and deliver English lessons that incorporate reading, writing, speaking, and listening components based on a curriculum Provide life skills and practical English in a fun and accessible way Collaborate with ESL coordinator to assess students’ progress, needs, and feedback about instruction Qualifications: Highly organized and motivated to help students achieve their goals Possesses a growth-mindset and utilizes constructive feedback Is a dynamic and interactive communicator Engages with and is respectful of cultural differences Fluency in another language (especially Spanish, Arabic, or Bengali) is a big plus! Students enrolled in a TESOL program or retired teachers are encouraged to apply. Prior experience is not necessary but is preferred. Training will be provided for the right candidates. To apply, please send your resume to volunteer@cianainc.org. Please include \"Volunteer ESL Teacher\" in the subject line.
11102.title: ESL Teacher
11102.org: Center for the Integration and Advancement of New Americans, CIANA

11102.description: Astoria Artists & Musicians Needed for Saturdays! Weekday morning performances/classes are also possible. If you would like to volunteer your time and talents to teach or perform please contact me mordenana@hanac.org or asimmons@hanac.org. 11102.description: Established in 2006, the Center for the Integration & Advancement of New Americans (CIANA) is a social services organization that works to integrate new immigrants into American society. We have one open opportunity for an experienced grant writer to join us in preparing proposals and grants. This is not a teaching opportunity, please only apply if you have prior grant writing experience. The Grant writer intern will be responsible for applying to at least 2 grants per month. Credit is available for those in college. The grants we apply to are a mixture of municipal, corporate, and foundational of varying lengths for the purpose of supporting educational, legal, and civics-related programs or operational costs. Requirements: have 1-2 years of experience writing grants commit to a minimum once a week, part of which can be done remotely for the right candidate be available for a minimum of 3 months ​ To apply, please send your resume, cover letter, and a writing sample of no more than 5 pages to kylen@cianainc.org

11102.description: We have recently lost the head of our knitting club leader due to graduation. 11101.description: Welcome to our ESL Practice Program at The English Language Center! The ESL Practice Program needs volunteers to assist our adult English language students with small group conversation practice or one-on-one writing tutoring Evening Conversation Groups: Thursdays, April 19 - June 7 5:45PM to 6:45PM 1 hour per week (8 weeks) Evening Writing Partners: Wednesdays & Thursdays, April 25 - June 7 5:45PM to 6:45PM 1 hour per week (7 weeks) Afternoon Conversation Groups: Tuesdays & Thursdays, April 17 - June 7 1:00PM to 2:00PM Afternoon Writing Partners: Mondays & Wednesdays, April 18 - June 6 1:00PM to 2:00PM The aim of Conversation Groups is to further our students' speaking and listening skills. Many of our students live with family or friends and don't get to practice these skills outside of class. Writing Partners, on the other hand, help individual students with homework from their writing and grammar classes as well as help students improve their overall writing skills. Writing tutors should be able to assist students with English grammar and punctuation, forming paragraphs, brainstorming for ideas, organizing their writing, and using tools like the dictionary and thesaurus. Volunteers are asked to commit only one hour per week, though we are happy to have you more often if you like. Our students are very motivated and fun to work with, and they are very appreciative of any help you can give. For more information, please email: Evening Sessions: Marek Pena at mpena@lagcc.cuny.edu Afternoon Sessions: Margaret Culhane at mculhane@lagcc.cuny.edu

11101.description: The City Tutors (CT) is looking for tutors to provide in-class academic support in math for the Division of Continuing Education at LaGuardia Community College for the Spring 2018 semester. Embedded Tutoring will run in the evening from 6-9PM. Tutors are asked to commit 2-3 hours of their time a week. Evening classes run Monday, Tuesdays, and Thursdays, but subject specific tutoring days are yet to be determined. This a great opportunity for: working professionals who wish to support their community students who are majoring (or who have recently graduated) in the course area and who wish to enhance their content knowledge and/or grow their professional experience As an embedded tutor, you would collaborate with an instructor to improve students’ performance while being supported and guided by an experienced academic support professional. You would identify and support students who are struggling, participate during the lecture to augment the class topic discussions, and provide feedback to students so that they may improve their fundamental understanding of the material. You might also design assignments, identify/track students who are struggling and create differentiated instruction as the need arises. You will be supported throughout this process by the City Tutors staff. All tutors are also expected to complete a four session comprehensive, professional training regimen. 6 hours of live training, plus another hour and a half for orientation. This is a commitment of 7.5 hours of in person training, and 4 hours of supplemental training for a total of 11.5 hours of training over the course of the Fall semester. Training days will be determined based on your schedule and that of the Tutor Training Coordinators. CT's tutoring program has been successful in helping students gain access to support that they otherwise would not have received, given their limited time spent on campus. Having a tutor in the class early in the semester will allow us to employ strategies to reduce withdrawals and student failure rates. Your work with us would help the students’ overall subject area performance, and help us improve this educational support model, reaching more students and departments with comprehensive academic support. Learn more about LaGuardia Community College's Division of Continuing Education here: https://www.laguardia.edu/ce/ To apply, you must: Have received an A- or A in the introduction to the subject course you are applying to tutor Have a GPA at or above 3.2, or have completed a degree program Submit monthly reports, keep a log sheet of any tutoring appointments done outside of class, and regularly communicate with the tutor training coordinator.
11101.title: Evening In-class Math Tutor needed for LaGuardia Community College HSE Program in Spring 2018

11101.description: Parker Jewish Institute for Health Care and Rehabilitation has launched a Volunteer Hospice Doula program that provides emotional support and comfort to people who are approaching their final days. The Comprehensive Community Hospice Program of Parker Jewish Institute is looking for people who would like to volunteer as a doula, going out to patients' homes and extending the hand of reassurance, offering a smile that warms the heart, and the words that say everything will be okay. Volunteer Doulas will help patients and families cope with the process of dying, remaining at the bedside as life ends. \"Doula\" is a Greek word that means \"woman servant or caregiver.\" Today it is associated with individuals who provide physical assistance and emotional support during and/or after childbirth. This proposed program aims to mirror the concept by providing the same type of support at the final phase of a terminal illness. This initiative will place a focus on planning for death with the elderly patient and family if there is one, and will provide a continuous around the clock vigil as death becomes imminent. The program will help the elderly patient who lacks family or adequate caregiver support to die comfortably, without fear of being alone. Even when surrounded by loved ones, individuals with a terminal illness and those closest to them may feel isolated as they face the end of life. As the end of life approaches, patients and families struggle with anxiety and fear; exhaustion; loved ones often feel alone, unprepared and afraid; and opportunities to explore meaning go unaddressed. Hospice Doulas provide emotional support and comfort to patients and their loved ones in the final phase of a terminal illness. Our End-of-Life (EOL) Doula volunteers will receive thorough training in understanding the dying process and in the skills that help bring peace and comfort to all involved. This free two-day training includes learning how to do guided visualization, help create rituals, provide simple physical support, offer sacred presence, as well as how to create spiritual and emotional legacies. Parker Jewish institute will be hosting a free two-day Doula training workshop on Saturday 10/28/17 and Sunday 10/29/17 from 9:00am-6:00pm. Breakfast and lunch will be served. A certificate will be awarded upon completion of this workshop. If you are interested in attending, please call the Hospice Program's Volunteer Doula Coordinator at 718-289-2134, or email volunteer-nerken@parkerinstitute.org. Doulas can come from any background and no experience is required. They typically work in as part of a team. They usually sit quietly with a patient, talk with them and offer support, comfort and companionship. Parker Jewish institute will be hosting a free two-day Doula training workshop on Saturday 10/28/17 and Sunday 10/29/17 from 9:00am-6:00pm. Breakfast and lunch will be served. A certificate will be awarded upon completion of this workshop. If you are interested in attending, please call the Hospice Program's Volunteer Doula Coordinator at 718-289-2134, or email volunteer-nerken@parkerinstitute.org.
11101.title: Hospice Doula Volunteers Needed
11101.org: Parker Jewish Institute for Health Care

11101.description: The Afghanistan International Foundation For The Blind (AIFB) formally known as \"Afghanistan Blind Women and Children Foundation (ABWC)\": Enhancing the lives of blind individuals in the country since August 28, 2009, AIFB has been recognized by NY State as a non-profit foundation. Its mission is to empower Afghan blind women through healthcare and blind children through education and rehabilitation services in Afghanistan. The foundation accepts national and international students. The Afghanistan International Foundation For The Blind needs your time as a volunteer! Qualification and Commitment: Student must complete 3 months internship 5 days per week (6 hours per day), equalling around 500 hours per semester. Students are required to be fluent in English. Bilingual students who are fluent in Persian and Pashto are welcomed. Requirement: The foundation request the following for students: Your email address, mailing address and phone number College requirement forms from your department Resume One page short bio that explains your education background (your work experience in the past your current position as employee or student and volunteer experience in the past) Sample of writing 2 letters of references one from the university and one from colleagues and friends (not family members) along with their email addresses, mailing addresses and phone numbers The university internship department contact information (mailing address, email address, phone number, fax number, and cell phone). AIFB does not accept independent student interns, only one sponsored or approved by their university. The student must participate in face to face interviews before entering to the internship program.
11101.title: Student Intern Department
11101.org: Afghanistan International Foundation for the Blind (AIFB)

11101.description: Ballet For All Kids is a non-profit organization whose mission is to give every child, regardless of their abilities or disabilities, the opportunity to reap the benefits of a classical ballet education. We depend on the community to volunteer and help make a difference in the lives of kids with special needs. Come and assist students as they learn ballet technique. All volunteers must be passionate about our mission and comfortable working with children. No dance experience necessary. Consistent weekly volunteers preffered, but one-time help is also greatly appreciated! We hold classes Saturdays and Sundays in various locations in Manhattan, Brooklyn, and Queens. We have recently expanded to Jersey City, NJ as well! Please check our website for our current class schedule: https://www.balletforallkids.com/classes/ If you are interesting, please contact us to let us know which class you would like to join and when you would be able to start volunteering with us! Contact us today for more information.
11101.title: Dance class for kids with special needs

11101.description: There are more than 11,000 children in New York State whose mothers are imprisoned. The absence of their mother leaves them vulnerable, particularly the older children, who face increased risk of involvement with crime substance abuse and other anti-social behaviors. Without good care and attention, they become victims of the prison system. The core of Hour Children’s work is to reverse this outcome. Hour Friends in Deed mentoring program provides a child, between the ages of 4-17, with a caring adult who commits to building a healthy relationship with a young person. The mentor becomes someone that supports and guides the child with positive academic, career, and personal goals. We encourage mentors and mentees to find fun activities to do together. Both of you can pick to play sports, go to the movies, do arts & crafts, or any activity where you both will have FUN! Your positive influence will contribute to the growth and development of this child. We specifically need mentors for children who live in Staten Island. Each mentor, 18 years or older, commits to participate in the program for one year and to meet with his/her mentee for at least 4 hours per month. Become a mentor. Be part of the solution and make an impact on a child’s life!!!!
11101.title: Mentor a Child in Long Island City, Queens

This is a major need for the organization at this time and will only involve occasional commitments of 4 or 5 hours per month. Improve website design and general online presence Make web content updates Manage switching our website host provider over to a new company Lead the purchase of an additional URL Help implement an email address for Board members that ends in the website extension General trouble shooting as issues arise Required documentation: Current resume Email address, mailing address and phone number One page of professional biography in an essay format that will include their educational background, current position, their past work experience and their volunteer work in other organizations. 3 reference letters from individuals that are not family members, along with their email addresses, mailing addresses and phone numbers Face to face interviews are required.
11101.title: Web Designer
11101.org: Afghanistan International Foundation for the Blind (AIFB)

11101.description: Hour Children provides children (ages 5-12) with tutoring and many cultural enrichment activities. This special time lets you focus on and help guide them in the art of learning and knowledge. Volunteers provide homework help, reading to young children, and assistance with special activities such as music, Cantonese, and cooking.
11101.title: After School Needs Helpful and Fun Individuals

11101.description: Hour Children’s Food Pantry and Community Outreach is seeking volunteers to support efforts including: providing food, case management services, nutrition education, and assistance with food stamps to Hour Children families and local community residents.
11101.title: Distribution Volunteers Needed at a local Queens Food Pantry

11101.description: Volunteers will be assigned up to three women whom they will be expected to assist with locating and applying to various employment opportunities according to each woman’s experience and qualifications. Volunteers are required to be proficient in basic computer skills, Microsoft Suite, and internet browsing. Volunteers must also successfully complete a simple writing skills assessment test.
11101.title: Share your special skill with women from prison!

11101.description: Hour Children has three thrift stores that receive donations from all five boroughs. Staff and volunteers sort and clean these goods. The thrift stores are a valuable resource for the surrounding neighborhoods and help us build and maintain good relationships with our community. Thrift Store Locations: Hour Children's Shop 25-22 34 Avenue, Long Island City, NY 11106. Open Monday through Sunday from 10:00 AM to 7:00 PM. Fancy Thrift 12-10 36 Avenue, Long Island City, NY 11106. Open Monday through Sunday from 11:00 AM to 6:00 PM. Corner Thrift Shop 12-02 36 Avenue, Long Island City, NY 11106. Open Monday through Sunday from 10:00 AM to 6:00 PM.
11101.title: Volunteers Needed at Local Queens Thrift Shop

11101.description: Hour Early Learning Program is a licensed daycare center opened Monday through Friday from 7:30 AM to 6:00 PM. HELP is committed to helping children become happy, healthy, socially competent individuals who will enter school ready to learn. We do this in a comprehensive and developmentally appropriate learning environment that stresses experiential learning opportunities to ensure sure that children grow to their maximum potential. Volunteers will have the opportunity to ensure HELP's goal by working closely with the children, or assist with office/administrative tasks.
11101.title: Fun Daycare Needs Extra Happy Hands

11101.description: Protect our environment and the special place in which we live! Citizens’ Climate Lobby (CCL) wants you! As a volunteer, you’ll be a member of the fastest growing and most effective climate advocacy group. You will work with concerned New York citizens to slow the effects of climate change. Let's work together to protect our beautiful ecosystems, livelihoods and way of life. Please respond to our posting for an invitation to learn more. You will: Meet with Congressional leaders. Write letters to the editors and op-eds. Meet with local media. Educate your community about global warming and legislative solutions. We provide: Monthly national conference calls with expert guest speakers. Weekly skill building sessions. On-line network with CCL volunteers across the U.S. National conference and lobby week in D.C. Volunteers commit to an average of 4-6 hours a month. Some of our volunteers dedicate more time than that. We hold no upper limit on your dedication to a stable climate and livable world. To learn more about us, please join an Introductory Conference Call. The next call is Wednesday at 5:00 p.m. Pacific/6:00 p.m. Mountain/7:00 p.m. Central/8:00 p.m. Eastern. This is an opportunity to learn about CCL. It is one hour, and there will be opportunities to ask questions. The conference call number is 1-866-642-1665, passcode 440699#.
11101.title: Sustainable Climate Environment Advocate Long Island NY

11101.description: Tax Preparation Volunteers , Urban Upbound, formerly known as ERDA. Urban Upbound provides residents of public housing neighborhoods and other moderate, low- and very-low income New Yorkers with the tools and resources needed to achieve self-sufficiency and economic mobility, and to break intergenerational cycles of poverty. The target area we serve includes the 30,000 residents of five public housing neighborhoods in Western Queens: Queensbridge (the largest public housing community in the nation), Ravenswood, Astoria, Woodside, and Pomonok. The neighborhoods where these communities are located include Long Island City, Woodside, Astoria, and Flushing. One of Urban Upbound's most successful initiatives is our Free Tax Preparation Campaign, where we help low-income filers access the tax credits for which they are eligible - saving working families hundreds of dollars in unnecessary tax preparation fees. Additionally, tax filers have the opportunity to: enroll in Urban Upbound's workforce development program to receive assistance finding work; sign up for one-on-one financial counseling; get pre-screened for food stamps, public assistance and low or no cost health insurance; and, open a bank account. We are currently recruiting volunteers to help make this year's tax prep season another success! As a volunteer you will have the unique opportunity to work in a dynamic, high impact, results oriented community based organization. Qualified candidates will utilize their accounting and financial skills while giving back to the community. All volunteer tax preparers are asked to successfully complete the IRS online Link & Learn course. Long Island City does free taxes all year round! Skills and Qualifications Ability to work with diverse populations Commitment to social and economic justice Excellent time-management and organizational skills Independent self-starter Strong teamwork abilities Bilingual (Spanish; Mandarin, Korean) a plus Facility with numbers and commitment to learning tax law and Tax Wise software
11101.title: Tax Preparation Volunteers

11101.description: We are looking for volunteers interested in leading a workshop on sports and teaching sports in our after-school program in Riis Academy. We engage students in basketball, football, soccer, and more. Volunteers interested in teaching sports to middle school students are encouraged to apply are sports are welcome. Volunteers would play with middle school students and provide support and expertise in sports to youth. Afterschool program is weekdays 3:00pm-6:00pm. Volunteers have to be patient, helpful, and have prior experience working with youth.
11101.title: Sport Clinic Facilitators

We welcome student interns for this position, especially in the field Social Sciences. Qualification and responsability: Volunteer must be proficient in basic computer skills Must be able to read, write, and communicate in a professional matter, Must be punctual Must have basic office management skills Must follow the rules and regulation of the office Required documentation: Current resume Email address, mailing address and phone number One page of professional biography in an essay format that will include their educational background, current position, their past work experience and their volunteer work in other organizations. 3 reference letters from individuals that are not family members, along with their email addresses, mailing addresses and phone numbers Face to face interviews are required

Description: The AIFB Foundation is seeking DEDICATED board members to improve the quality of life for blind individuals in Afghanistan. As a board member, you will have the opportunity to have a major impact on the medical, educational welfare, rehabilitation, and community services to help over 400,000 blind indivduals in Afghanistan. Qualification and responsability: The primary work of the Board of Director is to make decision on behalf of the foundation and work as a team to make sure that decisions made by the board are executed legallyThey will be required to participate in Board meetings every 3 months, if an individual misses 3 board meetings without giving prior notice they will be removed from the board. Must be able to commit 6 months to 1 year Must cast the majority of board of director's vote in order to become a member Be able to answer any questions that arise from the board members Must be able to support the foundation in the amount of 300$ annually or encourage people to support the treasury of the organization Their responsibility as a board member will be to help us extend our contact network, recruiting or improving board of director functions, fundraise, and make accurate decisions that benefits the mission and vision of the organizations. Requirement Must have strong leadership skills Must be able to make decisions that benefit the welfare of the organization Be able to conduct and participate in fundraising events Individuals who are willing to become Board of Directors need to submit the following documentation: Current resume Email address, mailing address and phone number One page of professional biography in an essay format that will include their educational background, current position, their past work experience and their volunteer work in other organizations. 3 reference letters from individuals that are not family members, along with their email addresses, mailing addresses and phone numbers Face to face interviews required.

11101.description: There are more than 11,000 children in New York State whose mothers are imprisoned. The absence of their mother leaves them vulnerable, particularly the older children, who face increased risk of involvement with crime substance abuse and other anti-social behaviors. Without good care and attention, they become victims of the prison system. The core of Hour Children’s work is to reverse this outcome. Hour Friends in Deed mentoring program provides a child, between the ages of 4-17, with a caring adult who commits to building a healthy relationship with a young person. The mentor becomes someone that supports and guides the child with positive academic, career, and personal goals. We encourage mentors and mentees to find fun activities to do together. Both of you can pick to play sports, go to the movies, do arts & crafts, or any activity where you both will have FUN! Your positive influence will contribute to the growth and development of this child. Children live in Manhattan, Queens, Brooklyn, Bronx or Staten Island. Each mentor, 18 years or older, commits to participate in the program for one year and to meet with his/her mentee for at least 4 hours per month. Become a mentor. Be part of the solution and make an impact on a child’s life!!!!
11101.title: Woman Mentors in the Bronx Needed!

11106.description: Energy Tech High School is launching a new mentoring program for our Year 13 students! We are looking for volunteer career mentors who are currently working within STEM fields, specifically in companies or organizations related to Engineering, Technology, Construction, and Architecture. As a mentor in this program you will be paired with college students who attend LaGuardia Community College working toward an associate degree in either Energy Technology or Engineering, with a focus in Mechanical or Electrical. The mentoring program is an integral component of the school’s commitment to connect what students learn in the classroom to the realities of the workplace. We believe mentoring helps students gain new skills and explore career options.
11106.title: Energy Tech High Career Mentor

11106.description: Hour Teen Scene is a program for the adolescents at Hour Children and the Hour Friend in Deed Mentoring Program. As a weekly program, Hour Teen Scene engages youth in various activities to help shape them into thoughtful and compassionate adults. Students play sophisticated team building games to help foster community. Hour teens are open to any and all ideas, projects, activities that will enhance their lives. We are in need of the following volunteers to teach: Piano, Step Dance, Martial Arts, ELA, Yoga Instructor, Manners, Finacial Literacy, Healthy Relationships, Time Managment, Boys Empowerment, Girls Empowerment, How to set and reach goals, Lifeskills
11106.title: Volunteer with Hour Teens

11106.description: Our client choice, supermarket-style food pantry runs three distributions per week for two hours each. Our distribution hours are Mondays, 2:00 - 4:00; Tuesdays, 10:30 - 12:30; and Thursdays, 3:00 - 5:00. We seek volunteers for all three shifts, but especially Mondays and Thursdays! Your time commitment will involve arriving at least one hour prior to the start of distribution, and staying through the entire two hour shift. Responsibilities include stocking shelves, sorting and storing produce, helping clients shop, breaking down boxes, and routine clean up. We are also seeking a dedicated desk volunteer who is responsible for checking in clients when they arrive. This is energetic, fast-paced work with a lovely group of core volunteers from the community! We strive to provide food to those in need in the most welcoming, warm way possible. Bring your customer service skills! Bilingual abilities are definitely a plus as well. Please apply ONLY if you will be committing to volunteer with us at least once per week for at least one month. We are unable to train volunteers for a one-time shift.
11106.title: Help feed the hungry in Queens!
11106.org: Hour Children Community Outreach and Food Pantry

11104.description: Sunnyside Community Services’ program, called Sunnyside Up, provides parents with an alternative pre-K option. The program is run out of 39-01 Queens Blvd. The Sunnyside Up program offers free half-day programs, with a fee for those parents who want their child to remain in pre-K after care for the remainder of the day. We are looking for volunteers, over the age of 19, who can assist the pre-school teachers with a variety of tasks. The key responsibility will be to support and work with the assistant teachers for a productive learning environment. Interact with the kids whether in the form of reading to them or playing with them. This position is needed thru June 19 only. Volunteers need to arrive by 2:30 pm and assist with dismissal until approximately 5:30 pm. No teaching experience required and anyone over the age of 19 can volunteer. Our greatest need is for Wednesdays and Fridays 2:30 pm to 5:30 pm. The language requirement is English with Spanish a plus. This is a part-time, unpaid position. If interested, please send your resume and cover letter to Czarinna at candres@scsny.org Indicate \"Volunteer for pre-K aftercare\" in the subject line. Note that the days and times are somewhat flexible from Mondays to Fridays 2:00 - 5:30 pm however a specific day/time commitment is expected.
11104.title: Volunteers for pre-K after care

11104.description: About: For many families, the Social Adult Day Program offers a welcome alternative to a nursing home. Seniors can remain living in their homes, and caregivers can make time for their careers, for other family members, or for themselves. As a volunteer, under the direction of program staff you will be assisting with seniors activities and meal times. The welcoming and home-like center includes a kitchen, a dining area, and activity room. Our highly qualified staff can assist with medication reminders, personal care, and grooming. A low staff-to-participant ratio enables us to offer each senior individualized assistance as needed. Activities include: Therapeutic music, art, and dance sessions Sensory activities Storytelling Gentle exercises Reminiscence groups Arts and crafts The program serves a hot, nutritious lunch each day. We also offer door-to-door transportation in a van that is accessible to people in wheelchairs and people with limited mobility. Requirements: Make at least a 3-month commitment Must have a medical clearance and an up-to-date (within 2 years) PPD test Choose you day/s, Mondays through Fridays; hours are set, 10am to 3pm Qualities: Ability to develop and maintain effective working relationships with staff, volunteers, and clients Ability to communicate effectively Sensitivity to diverse cultures Be caring, considerate, compassionate, patient
11104.title: Adult Day Services for Seniors Volunteer

11104.description: The Senior Center provides around 200 meals a day to seniors. Volunteers will provide assistance in the senior center dining room and kitchen for lunch service, which includes food preparation, distribution and clean up. WHAT WILL I BE DOING? Under the direction of the kitchen supervisor you might be: Wrapping silverware Preparing components of the meals Serving meals Providing table service Assisting with clean up Washing dishes/pots and pans Wiping down tables Signing in Seniors YOUR QUALITIES: Commitment and Consistent Considerate and patient Available Mondays through Fridays 9am to 2pm Work well with staff, volunteers, and clients Ability to communicate effectively Sensitive to diverse cultures Food handler OR OSHA certified preferred but not mandatory
11104.title: Help Serve Lunch to Seniors at Sunnyside!

11104.description: I currently have a lovely senior in Maspeth that need a volunteer to help her clean her parrot's large cage! They are both engaging and fun to talk to! Can you help? Once a week for an hour? This volunteer opportunity would include helping her clean the cage and visiting as a friend. I've never met a bird like this- he's really cool!! Studies show that having a pet can significantly improve a person's mental and physical health. Many seniors have pets, but need a little help caring for them. HELP A SENIOR KEEP THEIR PET!! Volunteers are needed to visit with the senior, and help them care for their pet. The volunteers might walk a dog, clean a litter box, pick up pet food or litter, take a pet to the vet and/or foster a pet if the senior becomes hospitalized. We are looking for volunteers to do some or all of these things. Friendly visiting is an easy, fun, rewarding way to become involved in your community. We only ask for one hour per week (or more if YOU chose)! Many seniors want to play cards or games and go for walks. This is a great way to make a difference in someone's life and their pets life! The Friendly Visitor Program is run by Sunnyside Community Services and covers areas of Western Queens including Astoria, Elmhurst, East Elmhurst, Jackson Heights, Corona, Forest Hills, Flushing, Maspeth, Middle Village, Long Island City, Ridgewood, Sunnyside, Woodside, Rego Park and more. Friendly Visitors are volunteers who visit home bound elderly for about an hour each week in their homes. Volunteers reduce feelings of isolation, and help improve seniors' mental and physical health. Seniors are able to stay in their homes and communities longer. Volunteers can dramatically improve the quality of a seniors' life. The Friendly Visitor Program is funded by grants from CityMeals-on-Wheels and Amie's Place Foundation and serves homebound seniors who receive meal deliveries. Clients receiving visitors are often unable to go outside on their own and depend on visitors for social interaction. Friendly Visitors receive training, support and feedback from the Friendly Visiting Coordinator. We will match you with someone who shares your interests and schedule and is located (ideally) within 30 minutes of your home or office.
11104.title: Pet Pal needed in Maspeth!  Help a senior keep her PARROT!!

11104.description: I currently have a senior with lovely Pitbill in Howard Beach! Her dog needs to be walked- please help us help her keep her dog! Could you walk her dog, even once a week for six months? Studies show that having a pet can significantly improve a person's mental and physical health. Many seniors have pets, but need a little help caring for them. HELP A SENIOR KEEP THEIR PET!! Volunteers are needed to visit with the senior, and help them care for their pet. 11105.description: We are looking for volunteers who would be able to help youth with their homework. Our students range in age between 5 and 17 years old and need help in everything from basic math and reading and writing all the way up to Chemistry and Biology Regents. We are also looking for people who are passionate about Art to volunteer to help run our arts classes and those who enjoy empowering women to work on our women's empowerment agenda. We are also looking for Grant writers and fund raisers who can help us become sustainable in the long term.We also have a rock star volunteer opportunity, which is open to anyone who presents us with a project or an idea for a project that can benefit the community. If there is something you feel passionate about that you believe will help others, we want to support you.
11105.title: Volunteer as a Homework Helper

Meet People In Your Community, Choose Your Own Service Project, Trips, College Tours, SAT Prep, Administrative/Office Skills And Public Speaking Help. Join Woodside on the Move And Beacon Community Center, Service Woodside Queens Area. Beacon After School Programs, Decorate Buildings, Community Projects, Volunteer With Elderly In Sunnyside Community Services, And Clean Park. Opportunities To Meet YLC Committees Around Different Boroughs.
11377.title: YOUTH VOICE COUNTS, Become a Youth Voice Leadership Volunteer

11377.description: NYC Youth Leadership Council A youth leadership council is a \"working group\" of trained young people who work in partnership with adult leadership on issues of public policy, practice and advocacy service, towards a shared goal of improving effectiveness of policies and practices that impact the lives and communities of all New Yorkers, but particularly those that pertain to young people.
11377.title: YOUTH VOICE COUNTS, Become a Youth Voice Leadership Volunteer

11377.description: Volunteer with the ReStore team and help us raise funds for Habitat for Humanity NYC! GENERAL SUMMARY: Habitat for Humanity NYC’s ReStore sells building materials, appliances, tools, and home décor items at 50-80% off the original retail value. Proceeds from the sales of these items help cover the administrative costs of the affiliate and contribute to further homebuilding efforts. ReStore volunteers have the opportunity to help with a variety of tasks including; assiting customers, staging the sales floor, pricing and merchandising, repairing donations, and even donation procurement! *All volunteers interested in volunteering at the ReStore are required to complete a ReStore Volunteer training.* HOW TO SIGN UP: Trainings are held in person at the ReStore and Online. In-Person Trainings: Trainings are held at our ReStore located at 62-01 Northern Blvd, Woodside, NY 11377. Create a new account on http://restore.habitatnyc.volunteerhub.com/events/index After logging in, select \"ReStore\" from the home page Select a \"ReStore Volunteer Training\" You will receive a confirmation email Online Trainings: Online trainings are quick, easy, and convienient! Start volunteering today by completing the online training via this link: http://bit.ly/NYCReStoreTraining Learn more about Habitat NYC: www.habitatnyc.org/volunteer
11377.title: Habitat for Humanity NYC ReStore Volunteers Needed!
11377.org: Habitat for Humanity New York City

07945.description: Please join Schiff members, staff, and volunteers as we embark on an outdoor land steward project to improve the Schiff Natural Land Trust. Our volunteer work days are great for teens, adults, church groups, service groups, scout troops, or anyone else looking to earn community service or environmental karma credits! Come lend a hand with trail maintenance, fence repair, invasive species removal, native plant garden maintenance, and home repair. Wear weather appropriate clothes, sturdy work boots, and yard gloves. We will provide water, snacks, and insight into the importance of the preservation work we do here at Schiff. Ages 15+, please. Schiff membership is encouraged, but not required. Please register in advance so that we know you are coming!
07945.title: Volunteer Day at Schiff Nature Preserve

You CAN decide which program you want to be a part of: Administrative Volunteers Basic Clerical Tasks, such as Filing and Data Entry Become familiarized with Homecare Homebase software Work on Special Projects when needed Companion Volunteers Contribute to our patients' quality of life Visit patients in facilities in an area near you Read to patients, share special talents, play games, watch TV, and much more Benefits Increase purpose and meaning in your life by positively impacting other lives Experience significant opportunities for personal growth and development Convenient FREE training that fits your schedule Internship Credit (if applicable) Develop interpersonal skills Build your resume Reference Letter after a period of commitment
07945.title: Hospice Volunteers in Mendham, NJ - No Experience Needed

07945.description: Join our team of volunteers. Participate in our engaging and flexible volunteer program. Help play a key role in supporting terminally ill patients and their loved ones. You CAN Decide Which Program You Want to be Part of: Administrative Volunteers Basic Clerical Tasks, such as Filing and Data Entry Become Familarized with Homecare Homebase Work on Special Projects as needed Companion Volunteers Contribute to our patient's quality of life Visit patients in facilities or their homes in an area near you Read to patients, share special talents, play games, watch TV, and much more Specialized Volunteers Certified Pet Therapy Volunteers Certified Reiki Practitioners Licensed Message Therapists Program Benefits Increase Meaning and Purpose in Your Life by Positively Impacting Other Lives Experience Significant Opportunities for Personal Growth and Development Convenient FREE Training that Fits Your Schedule Free TB Test Develop Interpersonal Skills Build Your Resume Reference Letter Join this fun opportunity and help make a difference!
