Pets must be certified as therapy animals by an organization like TDI Therapy Dogs International- see website here http://www.tdi-dog.org/ Music Volunteers are volunteers who specialize in sharing songs or instrumental music with patients and their loved ones. Whether the Music Volunteer is sharing an existing musical skill or playing music via the radio or digital device, the goal is to enhance the quality of life of our patients. Often, regularly scheduled visits are requested, however Music Volunteers may also be asked to provide musical visits on an occasional basis for one patient/family or for a group of patients at a facility as outreach for the local hospice agency. Hospice is built on the philosophy that we care for our patients in mind, body and soul. Craft Volunteers consist of individuals or groups who touch patients in a special way by making lap blankets, shawls, memory bears and other articles for patients to enjoy. Bereavement Volunteers offer support to the families of patients who have passed. During the grieving process the bereavement volunteer can be a valuable resource, especially for those who lack a solid support network. They often make phone calls to check up on family members and also send cards of comfort and care. For more information about our free volunteer training and available opportunities, call our Volunteer Department or visit our website at Ascendhospice.com! We look forward to hearing from you! Please do not contact me with unsolicited services or offers.
07601.title: Hospice Volunteers - Companion, Music, Pet Therapy, Reiki - Hackensack

07601.description: As part of our mission we deliver workshops to existing clients and the public on a variety of small business topics. The topics range from very tactical such as how to use specific accounting software to strategic planning for a business. We are seeking a few people to help grow our workshop program by helping us define and develop workshops to be delivered in the Northeast NJ area. The right candidate will understand how to define what topics are needed based on market research and past program performance. They will be able to seek out and establish relationships with presenters. They will evaluate the content and presenters and submit them for approval by the Workshop committee. The Workshop developer will review the client feedback to determine if the workshop should be repeated, the frequency and any changes required to make the program more effective. The actual execution of the workshops may be turned over to workshop administrators or retained as appropriate and desired. The work can largely be done remotely but occasional meetings at our office in Hackensack NJ will be required as will attendance at some number of workshops.
07601.title: SCORE Northeast NJ - Workshop Leader/Development

07601.description: BVMI is seeking individuals to conduct financial screening of new and existing patients to determine qualification according to established eligibility criteria. Screeners collect required financial records and other documents, and utilize a custom spreadsheet as well as BVMI's medical record software during the interview process. Interviews are done by appointment. There is a need for interviewers who speak English, Spanish and/or Korean.
07601.title: Patient Interviewer

07601.description: BVMI provides free primary healthcare to low-income Bergen County residents who do not have health insurance. Our patients come from many different backgrounds, so we are always in need of interpreters. BVMI is looking for special volunteers to help interpret for patients and practitioners. We are primarily in need of Spanish speakers, especially those with a medical background. However, other languages, including Korean, are also needed.
07601.title: Interpreter

07601.description: BVMI is looking for volunteers to assist with administrative tasks that keep the healthcare center running! If you are good with the computer, like to make phone calls, love helping with special events or just like to stuff envelopes, we can put you to work. We have a special need for individuals who are bilingual Spanish.
07601.title: Office Volunteer

07601.description: BVMI is looking for volunteer nurses, nurse practitioners and other healthcare professionals to treat patients. Volunteer nurse interactions with individual patients include taking vital signs, reviewing chief complaint, past medical history, medication review, education and discharge instructions. Charting on the electronic medical record is required. The nurse will be working one-on-one with an individual physician or nurse practitioner in care of the patient. Our volunteers work, on average, four-hour shifts every other week and have schedules that provide flexibility for vacation, work and/or travel. Volunteers must have valid license to practice in NJ. Fluency in Spanish is an asset
07601.title: Nurse Volunteer

11224.description: Have some extra time? Enjoy conversation? Have a like for kittens and Cats? Well, here is a great opportunity! Friendly Visiting NY, funded through Citymeals on Wheels, has partnered up with NYC Department for the Aging to help alleviate isolation in the senior population. 1 hour a week is all it takes. Although our office is located in Coney Island, we serve seniors across Brooklyn and can try to accommodate our volunteer requests. Whether you prefer a female, someone in your area that you can walk to, or someone who enjoys cards games, there is a senior who will enjoy your presence. To learn more, respond to us and let us know you are interested! Visit us on the web at www.friendlyvisitingny.org or call 718-449-5000 ext. 2311 for more information!
11224.title: Senior's love for Cats
11224.org: Jewish Community Council of Greater Coney Island

11224.description: As the warmer weather approaches we continue to look for volunteers who will join our wonderful program, and bring a bit of warmth and sunshine to our sernior friends. Find out what you can do to help the seniors of your community by calling us at 718-449-5000 ext. 2311
11224.title: Our senior friends would love to meet you!
11224.org: Jewish Community Council of Greater Coney Island

11224.description: Visit a homebound senior in your area! Not only will you make a difference in their lives but you will learn so much form them! We have a few seniors who are pet lovers and would enjoy a friendly visit where they can introdice their pets to you! Learn more by visiting us at www.friendlyvisitingny.org and register online or call us at 718-449-5000 ext. 2212.
11224.title: Cat's got your tongue? Friendly Visiting
11224.org: Jewish Community Council of Greater Coney Island

11224.description: If you live in Brooklyn or travel to Brooklyn on a weekly basis and can commit to one hour a week for at least 6 months, this is the program to be part of! You won’t regret it! The majority of our seniors live alone without any regular visitors. Having outlived spouses, siblings, friends, and even their own children, they are often extremely isolated. Almost every one of our seniors don't interact with anyone - ever - except the person who we match to visit them. Our Friendly Visiting program provides much-needed companionship for these homebound elderly in Brooklyn... but we need you! Visit us at www.friendlyvisitingny.org and find out more or simply enter your info on our site to be contacted. We will meet with you and match you with the senior that is right for you!
11224.title: Can you spare 1 hour?
11224.org: Jewish Community Council of Greater Coney Island

11224.description: Volunteers needed to partner with senior clients to help then get to and from medical appointments/centers/temples. This program aims to offer assistance and support to our senior clients as well as to provide an important social network. It is often a challenge for seniors to travel to and from appointments, and they are often forced to stay home unable to leave for days at a time. With your help the client can get where they need or wouldlike to get to safely and at an appropriate time while also decreasing the feeling of lonliness.
11224.title: Senior Buddy-Socialization at it's Best!
11224.org: Jewish Community Council of Greater Coney Island

11224.description: Retired? Have extra time on your hands? You can help! Do you have extra time on your hands that you're looking to fill in a meaningful way? If so this is perfect for you. We are in need of retired volunteers to visit homebound seniors in Boro Park, Bensonhurst and Sheepshead Bay. Visits are scheduled based on your availability. Just 1 hour a week is all it takes. If you can commit to visiting someone each week, this opportunity would be great for you. For more information please call Friendly Visiting (718) 449-5000 x 2205 or e-mail t.lieberman@jccgci.org. Just 1 hour a week really can make a difference in homebound senior's life.
11224.title: Friendly Visiting - Retired Volunteers to Visit Homebound Seniors
11224.org: Jewish Community Council of Greater Coney Island

11224.description: Our mission is to serve homebound seniorsa sense of connection through our volunteers. Our seniors live alone, without family or friends nearby. Their interaction with others is often limited to our visits. Our weekly visits make a world of difference to our survivors. Provide emotional support thorough conversations, games, walks etc....
11224.title: Visit and learn from a Holocaust Survivor
11224.org: Jewish Community Council of Greater Coney Island

11224.description: Can you spare one hour a week? Why not make that one hour count! Join the Friendly Visiting Program and that one hour will make a difference in the life of an isolated senior. Visit a senior and discuss fond memories, recent encounters, play games or read and discuss a book together. Help relieve feelings of isolation and loneliness experienced by the senior citizens of your community. For more information call 718-449-5000 ext. 2311.
11224.title: Friendly Visiting- Help Bring a Smile to a Senior's Face
11224.org: Jewish Community Council of Greater Coney Island

11030.description: Do you enjoy making a difference with interesting conversation, and helping students over a cup of coffee or chocolate? Sign up for Table Wisdom's innovative online program to mentor a recently admitted international student as he or she attends a university in the U.S. or a young professional. You will video-chat with your mentee and provide them with an opportunity to practice conversational English, learn about American culture and practical living, and share information about their own culture. Some of the mentees in the past have attended U.S. schools like the University of Southern California and Washington University in St. Louis. You (or someone you know) must be a native (or fluent) English language speaker, 50+ years old, know how to video-chat (Skype, Face Time, or a similar program), be available once a week for 55 minutes at a time, and willing to work with the time zone difference of your mentee. After four weeks, you can decide if you would like to continue. If not, then simply let us know and we'll take care of the rest! If you find fulfillment in chatting, learning about different cultures, and sharing your wisdom, then this is the perfect program for you. Please watch this short 1-minute video to give you an idea: http://bit.ly/2pBMKEb Thanks and we look forward to hearing from you!
11030.title: Do You Like to Chat?  Have Fun and Video-chat with Our Foreign-Born Students!

11030.description: North Shore University Hospital in Manhasset is looking for caring volunteers to join our Pet Therapy Program. Pet Therapy volunteers, along with their therapy dogs, bring much needed comfort to patients, families, visitors and staff. Therapy Dogs International (TDI) certification preferred. We offer flexible shifts 7 days a week. At North Shore University Hospital we believe that people deserve exceptional care. That's why patient experience is a central focus and the driving force behind our volunteer services department. Join our cause, make a difference, and become a volunteer.
11030.title: Pet Therapy Volunteer

11030.description: North Shore University Hospital in Manhasset is looking for caring people to join our \"MealTime Mate Feeding Program.\" MealTime Mate volunteers are specially trained to provide assistance and companionship to those patients who need help with their meals. Breakfast, lunch and dinner shifts are available 7 days a week. At North Shore University Hospital we believe that people deserve exceptional care. That's why patient experience is a central focus and the driving force behind our volunteer services department. Join our cause, make a difference, and become a volunteer.
11030.title: MealTime Mate Feeder Volunteer

11030.description: Women's Comprehensive Health Center in Manhasset is looking for vibrant, energetic people to greet patients, provide directions and escort as needed. If you are willing to give us a few daytime, weekday hours, we need your compassion and !
11030.title: Ambassador

07310.description: Art House Productions (AHP) seeks a volunteer Grant Writer. The person in this position works in close collaboration with the Director of Development to help Art House meet its institutional fundraising goals. We are looking for volunteers who are passionate about our mission and have grant writing/fundraising skills. Art House Productions (AHP) sprung from the desire to connect a devastated community through art and dialogue after September 11th, 2001. Since then, AHP has established itself as a pioneer of artistic and cultural programming in Hudson County. Now in its 16th year, AHP brings Northern NJ audiences a professional season of theatrical performances and visual art exhibitions as well as the free, city-wide arts festival, JC Fridays. AHP engages, inspires, entertains and challenges audiences with high quality visual and performing arts programs; we provide arts education programs that promote life-long learning to a diverse community; and we celebrate the essential power of the arts to illuminate our common humanity. AHP provides a home for innovative performing, visual, and literary artists to develop new work. We present emerging and under-recognized artists who are making significant contributions to their respective fields, and serve as a safe space for established artists to take creative risks. We are also a place where young people can find their voice through our theater education programs. As a grant writer/fundraiser, you will be helping prepare grant proposals, beginning by performing research. To develop proposals,you familiarize yourself with our organization's programs, goals and financial needs. You will also look into potential funding sources and help secure funds for programs and overhead costs needed. Core responsibilities: Write and prepare proposals and letters of inquiry to new and existing institutional funders, including foundations, corporate foundations, and government agencies. Write and prepare reports to funders. Maintain and update document templates for standard proposals and reports. Provide annual narrative reports to other departments as needed. Identify and research existing and prospective institutional funders, and assist with cultivating relationships with institutional contacts. Collaborate with Executive Director in ongoing fundraising strategy development and implementation. Qualifications: Bachelor’s Degree Exceptional writing, editing, and communication skills. Strong interpersonal skills and ability to translate others’ input into narratives. Highly detail-oriented with excellent organizational and time management skills. Strong computer skills. Experience using a fundraising database and grant research tools. Commitment to the mission of Art House Productions. Experience creating project budgets and financial reports a plus. Grant writing experience specific to education programs and/or arts programs a plus.
07310.title: Grant Writer for Non-Profit Theater

07310.description: MusicLink is in need of music teachers in New Jersey. With MusicLink, students (children under 18 years old) who show an interest in taking music lessons, but cannot afford full fee lessons, are linked with qualified music teachers willing to reduce their fee by at least half to make the lessons more affordable. MusicLink teachers are able to take advantage of a variety of offers and discounts from our growing list of Business Partners as well as additional benefits directly from our foundation. MusicLink teachers are qualified, professional teachers seeking to share their love of music with a deserving child. All MusicLink teachers are required to pass a criminal background check.
07310.title: Music Teachers for Underprivileged Children

10023.description: Hola! Somos una organizaci?n sin fines de lucro que ayuda a la comunidad inmigrante latina y no latina de Nueva York en el aprendizaje del idioma ingl?s, en la preparaci?n para el examen de ciudadan?a estadounidense y en el desarrollo de otras actividades de empoderamiento para la comunidad inmigrante. Tambi?n ofrecemos clases de espa?ol para no hispanohablantes, con lo cual contribuimos adem?s a la difusi?n de la cultura y valores hispanos en los Estados Unidos. Estamos a la b?squeda de profesores de Espa?ol (voluntarios) para nuestras clases de primavera 2018 (mayo 3 - junio 22 2018). Las clases son una vez por semana (jueves) de 6:00 pm a 9:00 pm. Esta es una posici?n de voluntariado (sin pago). Si te gusta ayudar a la gente y a la comunidad por favor comun?cate con nosotros respondiendo este aviso. Habr? una sesi?n de entrenamiento previo al inicio de clases fecha tentativa. Muchas gracias!
10023.title: Volunteer Spanish Teachers

10023.description: Centro NYC seeks dedicated volunteers with a passion for intercultural exchange and learning who can be available weekday evenings to ensure the smooth running of our ESL and Spanish programming at our new home near Lincoln Center. Core responsibilities: -Greeting students and managing class check-in, as well as new student registrations -Facilitating nightly \"intercambio\" break sessions between classes, by preparing/breaking down snack preparations, managing snack sales, and encouraging students to practice language skills -Participating in major marketing initiatives for the organization -Admin office tasks such as assisting teaching staff, checking voicemails and returning calls Commitment: Volunteers will be expected to meet either Tuesdays OR Thursday evenings from 6:00-9:00pm beginning Tuesday, May 1 st and ending on Thursday, June 21 st. We also hope volunteers can be present during our end of term celebration on Friday, June 22 nd. If time constraints exist, there may be flexibility around start/end times for shifts. Eligibility: Foreign language experience a plus. How to apply: Email us at info@centronyc.org or apply through our volunteer form online. About us: Centro NYC (El Centro de Educación de Trabajadores) has provided a place of community and assistance for recent immigrants in New York City since 1975. Learn more about us at centronyc.org and facebook.com/CentroNYC2018/ Volunteers find a real sense of community at Centro, often staying for many years, and bringing their friends, family, and coworkers to join too. Volunteers themselves are welcome to take any class offered free of charge.
10023.title: Operations/Admin Volunteer - Tuesday or Thursday Evenings

10023.description: Centro NYC, a non-profit organization serving the immigrant community in New York City, seeks volunteer ESL teachers for its 2018 spring term, beginning May 1 and continuing through June 22. However, we hope that you will continue to volunteer with us in the fall. Classroom English teaching experience is preferred. However we do recruit new teachers with strong English communication skills and a good feel for grammar, even if you don't know all the rules! New teachers are partnered with and mentored by experienced teachers. Time commitment: One Tuesday or Thursday evening per week teaching plus the time required for lesson preparation (usually every other week.) Classes meet Tuesdays and Thursdays from 6:30-9:00 p.m. near Lincoln Center in Manhattan, and teachers are asked to arrive 6-6:15 to set up. In addition, there will be one staff meeting in April, and possibly one mid-semester. We have openings for teachers of beginning, intermediate, and advanced students. Please respond by email to Susan at susan@CentroNYC.org. Include your resume and tell us the evening(s) that you're available for teaching. Learn more about us at centronyc.org and facebook.com/CentroNYC2018/
10023.title: Adult English / ESL Teachers ? VOLUNTEERS NEEDED!

10023.description: Event Preparations A team of ten Volunteers are needed to help set-up and event, May 19th 2018. 11:00 am to 4:00 pm Positions Sign-in-Desk- 2 Volunteers Room Set-up all Volunteers Bar Table ( wine and water) 2 volunteers Food table- three Volunteers, (finger food) Room Monitors- 3 Volunteers If you are interested please contact my by April 10th, 2018 The position will be removed when we reach the amount needed. I can be reached at descort@projectfind.org Please visit our web-site www.projectfind.org
10023.title: Volunteer  Cecbration

10023.description: Help us assemble and \"delineate\" the AIDS Walk New York route before the Walk starts and break down the route once walkers have completed it. Delineator Volunteers must be comfortable with physical activity and lifting. Be prepared to get a little dirty! AIDS Walk Shift: Sunday, May 20 from 7 a.m. - 4 p.m. Meet at Central Park West and 72nd Street.
10023.title: Delineators - AIDS Walk NY 2018

10023.description: Our business internship program provides a unique opportunity for volunteers to economically empower small business owners in east Africa. After learning about each business owner’s situation and challenges, volunteers present ideas, opportunities, and solutions. After the internship program, participants will be able to put international consulting, leadership, and other valuable experiences on their resumes. Volunteers will also have the opportunity to experience a world-class safari at the end of the trip. Because the program is strengthened by diverse experience and expertise, the program is not limited to business minds only. All are welcome to apply. www.marafikiafrica.org
10023.title: Volunteer as a Business Intern in Africa!

10023.description: Our pre-health program is specially catered to students preparing for medical school and other health professions. During the course of the trip, volunteers explore health, hygiene, and nutrition in the developing world. We have the ability to cater the experience in Africa to medical school, dental school, nursing school, and other pre-health career needs. Volunteers gain valuable first-hand experience in clinics, orphanages, and communities. We will be happy to write a letter of recommendation on your behalf at the end of your service. Volunteers will also have the opportunity to experience a world-class safari at the end of the trip. www.marafikiafrica.org
10023.title: Volunteer as a Medical Intern in Africa!

10023.description: Volunteers participate in the development of impoverished communities in East Africa by partnering with village leadership and the community. In most cases, leadership in remote areas seek help in accomplishing their goals for education, health, and business but often lack sufficient resources and expertise to achieve those goals. Marafiki Africa volunteers help them to achieve their goals and experience the rich culture of East African tribes. A few examples of past projects include a water pipeline, school restoration, medical clinic restoration, and hygiene kit distribution. Volunteers will also have the opportunity to experience a world-class safari at the end of the trip. marafikiafrica.org
10023.title: Volunteer in Africa!

10023.description: Description: CentroNYC seeks dedicated volunteers with a passion for intercultural exchange and learning who can help manage promotion of our programs through major online social media platforms. The Social Media Lead would work closely with Marketing and be responsible for curating thoughtful content and populating our pages with recent activity updates on a weekly basis. Commitment: This volunteer will be expected to be onsite a minimum of 4 times in addition to remote work throughout the course of the Spring term on Tuesdays OR Thursday evenings. The term runs from Tuesday, May 1 st to Thursday, June 21 st. The volunteer will also be expected to join us for our end of term celebration on Friday, June 22 nd. Eligibility: Volunteers should have a passion for intercultural exchange, immigration rights, and community education, and demonstrate alignment with our mission and goals. Foreign language experience a plus. Volunteers find a real sense of community at Centro, often staying for many years, and bringing their friends, family, and coworkers to join too. Volunteers themselves are welcome to take any class offered free of charge. How to apply: Email us at info@centronyc.org or apply through our volunteer form online. About us: Centro NYC (El Centro de Educación de Trabajadores) has provided a place of community and assistance for recent immigrants in New York City since 1975. Learn more about us at centronyc.org and facebook.com/CentroNYC2018/
10023.title: Volunteer Social Media Lead

10023.description: Description: Centro NYC is seeking an experienced volunteer who can lead our Operations team to ensure the smooth running of our ESL and Spanish programming at our new home near Lincoln Center. Core responsibilities: -Manage a team of 5-8 operations team volunteers across Tuesdays and Thursdays to maintain adherence to Centro processes -Work closely with Centro Coordinating Committee to improve upon daily administrative process -Serve as go-to person for any issues that emerge with building partner as they arise -Ensure that teachers, operations team, and students have access to the resources they need Commitment: Volunteer will be expected to be on-site both Tuesdays AND Thursday evenings from 6:00-9:15pm beginning Tuesday, May 1 st and ending on Thursday, June 21 st, as well as during our end of term celebration on Friday, June 22 nd. Eligibility: Foreign language experience a plus. Volunteers find a real sense of community at Centro, often staying for many years, and bringing their friends, family, and coworkers to join too. Volunteers themselves are welcome to take any class offered free of charge. How to apply: Email us at info@centronyc.org or apply through our volunteer form online. About us: Centro NYC (El Centro de Educación de Trabajadores) has provided a place of community and assistance for recent immigrants in New York City since 1975. Learn more about us at centronyc.org and facebook.com/CentroNYC2018/
10023.title: Volunteer Chief of Staff, Operations

10023.description: Are you fascinated by architecture? New York City? History? Are you an avid photographer with a love of documenting the built environment? Are you looking for a way to exercise these interests, while helping in the fight to protect the physical history and human scale which give New York its unique and beloved character? If so, we're looking for your help. LANDMARK WEST! is a preservation watchdog and advocacy group that has been fighting for the protection of architecture on Manhattan's Upper West Side for over 30 years. We are currently working to catalog all the landmarks in our historic districts, and we are looking for some dedicated volunteers to photograph buildings in these districts The job entails walking throughout the Upper West Side, photographing the facades, stoops, and windows of buildings. We have lists of the gaps in our photos, and you can simply take one of these lists and make your way down a street, photographing as you go. Then when you return to our office or your computer, you will label each shot with the appropriate address, so we can match them to our entries. Requisites: Must have a steady hand and a good eye. If you have your own DSLR that would of course be a plus, but we have been shooting on our phones so far, so a DSLR is not necessary. Photoshop experience very much appreciated, as photos will have to be resized for the web. Hours: Flexible, an afternoon a week, perhaps, at a time that works with your schedule. Our office hours are 9 AM to 6 PM, Monday through Friday. You can also take the pictures when it is convenient for you and send them along to us as you take them.
10023.title: Historic Architecture Photographer

10023.description: Coordinate all event participation and outreach on behalf of Blue Star Families to increase local engagement in our Chapter locations throughout: NYC Long Island Westchester Hudson Valley New Jersey Southern Connecticut Collaborate with Blue Star Families Regional Director to develop and lead local volunteer team. 3 events per quarter minimum.
10023.title: Chapter Directors- NYC and Tri-State Area

10023.description: Serve as the main event and outreach coordinator for one of the boroughs in NYC. Work closely with Regional Director and Volunteer Leadership Team to coordinate community engagement opportunities. Plan 6 events per quarter minimum.
10023.title: New York Community Manager

10023.description: This opportunity is available every night! Help rescue excess pastries, salads, and sandwiches from a Lincoln Center bakery! These leftover goods will be delivered to Next Step Men's Shelter, located at 30 W 68th St, New York, NY 10023. Medium weight: the average amount of food rescued is 30-50 pounds. Sign up directly on our website: http://www.rescuingleftovercuisine.org/calendar
10023.title: Fight Food Waste & Feed the Hungry in Upper West Side 9:30PM

10023.description: Generation 180 is dedicated to driving a cultural shift in energy awareness and advancing the transition to clean energy. The organization is looking for volunteers to support its clean energy campaigns.The Generation 180 volunteer teams will lead workshops that encourage community members to adopt clean energy solutions, support local schools in going solar, and encourage businesses to stop energy waste. Generation 180 is committed to empowering its volunteer teams with ongoing training and support to be effective in making positive changes in your community. Please visit www.generation180.org to learn more. There will be a local volunteer team launch on March 22, 2018. If you're interested in attending, click \"I'm in\" on the Generation 180 volunteer page and keep your eye out for an invitation and more details! You can RSVP on the event page here: https://www.eventbrite.com/o/generation-180-15229533676 To connect with us, please visit www.generation180.org/volunteer to sign up for a webinar call with Tish Tablan, National Volunteer Organizer, to learn more and get acquainted. Follow us on Twitter (twitter.com/gen_180) and Facebook (facebook.com/generationoneeighty/) to learn about our upcoming webinar trainings about clean energy issues and advocacy.
10023.title: Clean Energy Volunteer- New York, NY

10023.description: Music on the Inside, Inc. (MOTI) Connects incarcerated youth and at-risk youth with seasoned musicians to offer learning opportunities, creative encouragement and inspiring role models through the rehabilitative power of music. www.musicontheinside.org MOTI seeks two driven, inspired, and energetic individuals for a development Internship positions and an experienced office manager to help with day to day operations, systems, follow-up and correspondence. The Development Interns will work with MOTI’s Founder and team to support the organization’s fundraising efforts in identifying new funding prospects; prospect outreach; special events, including planning for MOTI’s Benefits; data research, tracking, and collection, etc. He/she will play an essential role in helping to bring MOTI’s advocacy, leadership, and membership efforts to the next level by assisting the organization in scoping out new funding opportunities. The ideal candidates have interest in fundraising, as well as advocacy and grassroots movement building, is a motivated, self-starter who is effective in a fast-paced environment, and possesses a great sense of humor. With our bold and ambitious goal and unique theory of change through music and mentorships for incarcerated and at-risk youth, this is an exciting professional opportunity. The right candidates can have a significant impact on redefining rehabilitation in corrections and justice in America. Requirements: * Candidates must demonstrate interest in incarceration reform, effective rehabilitation through music, addressing racial disparities in the criminal system, and a belief in the power and efficacy of music for encouraging leadership and social change. * Development Interns are expected to commit to a minimum of 20 hours per week for the duration of the internship, as well as remote working capabilities (as needed). Development Interns must be willing to be on site at correctional facilities, meetings and events to support all of MOTI’s advocacy, leadership, membership, and development/fundraising efforts as needed. * Excellent writing skills is a must as he/she will be assisting with drafting emails, proposals and other relevant communications distributed both internally and externally. These are unpaid internships but can be credit-bearing and Music on the Inside, Inc. will work with academic institutions to ensure credit approval, if applicable. Please submit with your interest in applying the following: Your interest in criminal justice reform and advocacy; Why you want to intern at Music on the Inside, Inc; The strengths and experience you bring to the team; Your time availability for a minimum of 2-3 days; And what you are looking to experience? Only applicants selected for interviews will be contacted. Music on the Inside, Inc. (www.musicontheinside, inc.) is an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without unlawful discrimination based on race, color, creed, national origin, sex, age, disability, marital status, sexual orientation, military status, prior record of arrest or conviction, citizenship status, or curretn employment status. Music on the Inside values diverse experiences, including with regard to the justice system.
10023.title: Development and Administrative assistance for Music on the Inside, Inc.

10023.description: Your unique collection of life experiences can make a tremendous impact on the lives of young people new to America. By volunteering as a mentor with Table Wisdom you will have the chance to cultivate invaluable relationships as a mentor while helping foreign born students and young professionals practice their conversational English skills. It's as easy as signing up, getting paired, and starting a conversation. You and your mentee set the schedule and the student is expected to prepare topics for conversation. Our pairs talk about everything: from sports and culture to industry-specific skills and knowledge, what you discuss is up to you and your mentee. We do our best to pair people in similar disciplines so our mentees can learn from your career-specific experience, and you can learn more about what's new in your field. By having fun yet meaningful conversations you will help students build their confidence and fluency in English. All you need is the ability to video chat and the desire to meet someone new. Help a young foreign born person improve their quality of life in America. Join Table Wisdom: https://www.table-wisdom.org/join-us \"Although our lives are so different and perhaps distant, it is encouraging that there is so much that we share trying to be our best selves and making this a better world.\" -- Alan, mentor \"I feel so blessed to have met my excellent English language mentor. He always encourages me to speak out and taught me some idiomatic English which I didn't learn from a textbook.\" -- Zachary, mentee
10023.title: Share your experience! Mentor foreign born students and young professionals

10023.description: Teens for Food Justice works to ensure universal equitable access to healthy, fresh, affordable food.We train youth in 21st century hydroponic urban agriculture techniques, entrepreneurship, and health/nutrition education and advocacy, empowering them as change agents who can lead themselves and their own food insecure communities towards healthier futures. We’re seeking an experienced photographer to help us capture high-quality photos of our program at work and the communities we serve. Photographing our program is a fun opportunity to check out some cutting edge indoor farming technology and interact with a bright, enthusiastic group of students! To learn more about us, visit Teensforfoodjustice.org. We are also interested in a micro-project that includes a Humans of New York-esque approach to highlighting the amazing youth and adults in our community. Requirements : * Prior photography experience and your own, high quality camera * A linkable portfolio with up-to-date examples of your work * Comfort working around and interacting with children (6th - 12th graders) If you’re interested in joining us or would like to learn more, please email Joshua Serrano at jserrano@teensforfoodjustice.org with a brief description of your availability and a link to your portfolio. We look forward to hearing from you!
10023.title: Photographer Needed for Community Events and After School Programming
10023.org: Teens for Food Justice, powered by Students for Service

10023.description: Volunteer opportunity - ACS Making Strides Against Breast Cancer/ Central Park Volunteers Needed! Are you looking to get more involved with your local community? Do you enjoy working with and meeting new people? Are you passionate about helping others and finishing the fight against cancer? If this sounds like you, the American Cancer Society needs you! The Making Strides Against Breast Cancer Walk of Central Park is one of the largest breast cancer awareness events in the nation. The money raised through the event helps save many lives by funding groundbreaking breast cancer research, providing free comprehensive information and support, and helping people take steps to reduce their risk of the disease or find it early when it’s most treatable. As the largest voluntary health organization in the country, we count on volunteers and volunteer driven organizations, agencies and companies to help make this event run smoothly and efficiently. The walk is on October 14th, 2018 located in Central Park and we need your help! Our volunteers help with important event details such as check in, water stations, information, and more. You’re there to help make the event truly special and to join, encourage, and support those in the fight against breast cancer! With just a few hours, you can help make a difference in countless lives and create a world with more birthdays! If interested, please contact our Event Manager Denise Solorzano, at Denise.Solorzano@cancer.org or by phone at 212-237-3813.
10023.title: Making Strides Against Breast Cancer-- Central Park Volunteer

07931.description: The Arc Foundation of Somerset County is seeking an intern for 3 to 4 hours a week who is interested in learning the day to day tasks within the fundraising and marketing arm of The Arc Foundation of Somerset County. Duties include: Learning/Working with a donor application program for entries and reporting Learning/Working with the creation and design of new/revised agency department brochures and website content Learning/Working and supporting the planning, organizing, and day to day functions that lead up to a Golf Fundraising Event on September 17, 2018 (new event) and Arc Angel Gala on November 2, 2018. This includes ongoing marketing, sponsorship solicitation, community outreach, social media marketing, recruiting, and all on-site day of event operations. Learning/Working on the Camp Jotoni Capital Campaign including assisting with outreach and marketing Website content and social media development for \"The Achievement Center\" at Raritan Valley Community College The hours needed for this internship will vary based on the individual's schedule, however, we are looking for a total of 3-4 hours per week Monday-Friday during business hours.
07931.title: Marketing/Event Planning/Fundraising Intern Wanted

07932.description: This is an excellent opportunity for groups or businesses to volunteer! Since 2002 we have hosted a free STEM (Science Technology Engineering & Math) competition for middle school students in north NJ. This program challenges the students to work as a team to create a model solar powered car. In the process they learn communication skills, alternative energy technology, the engineering design process and have best of all they have fun! We award students for Speed, Engineering, Craftsmanship, Best Use of Recycled Materials and Progress Journal. We need volunteers to assist with the Speed portion of the competition by being Start Line and Finish Line Judges. We need Vehicle Judges to score cars in Engineering, Craftsmanship and Best Use of Recycled Materials. We have remote volunteer opportunities as well for scoring the students digital Progress Journal. We need volunteers to help at our Fix-It Table to repair broken cars. We need volunteers to distribute a digital survey for teachers and students. Most of all, we need volunteers that will be a positive and supportive voice as hundreds of middle school students present their creations. We need our volunteers to be able to arrive at 7:30am. Students arrive at 8:30am and racing begins at 9am. The award ceremony concludes at noon the latest and then we take down the event. This is an outdoor event but if we have inclement weather, we move indoors. You will be provided with an official \"Volunteer\" shirt to wear all day as well as a thank you present for your time. If this sounds like something you'd be interested in, please reach out to me at ktomasicchio@transoptions.org or call our office at 973-267-7600.
07932.title: Volunteer at County Finals for Model Solar Car Competition!

07932.description: JerseySTEM Girls Who Code Clubs are led by Facilitators, who are 18+ and can be computer scientists, parents, college students or volunteers from any STEM background or field. Our Club Facilitators guide Club girls through the curriculum , helping them to build sisterhood within the Club and learn to use computer science to impact their community. Clubs are run by 2-4 facilitators and are supported by our curriculum team and provided training as they join. Be the change you want to see. Volunteer 2 hours/week an make a difference in the life or Girls in your community.
07932.title: GWC: Girls Who Code facilitator in Florham Park

07932.description: Grace Healthcare Services welcomes is looking for Hospice volunteers. We welcome your gifts of time and compassion. Whether you choose to work directly with patients and families or to volunteer in one of many other ways, you can make a profound difference in someone's life, including your own. Volunteers are an integral part of the hospice team. Volunteer Opportunities: Companionship Volunteers work directly with patients providing companionship, offering friendly visits, reading to patients, writing letters, offering a gentle touch or sharing a quiet moment. Complementary Volunteers are certified/trained professionals who can provide complementary modalities of reflexology, music, imagery and touch therapies such as Reiki, massage, therapeutic touch and healing hands. Pet Therapy Volunteers provide certified/trained pets who visit with patients. These animals provide loving memories for some and give unconditional love helping our patients feel connected to a larger world. Administrative Volunteers provide help to the staff in our Edison office by assisting with typing, addressing cards, organizing newsletters, creating packets, collating manuals and other varied clerical duties Craft Volunteers consist of individuals or groups who touch patients in a special way by making lap blankets, shawls, huggable dolls/bears and other articles for patients to enjoy. Junior Volunteers consist of groups such as girl/boy scouts or young people who wish to honor our patients by making holiday cards, posters, wall hangings and memory books. Bereavement Volunteers offer support to the families and friends of patients who have passed. During the grieving process the bereavement volunteer can be a valuable resource, especially for those who lack a solid support network. Hospice training classes are required for Companionship and Complementary Volunteers. They are free of charge and offered on an ongoing basis. Grace Healthcare Services serves counties throughout New Jersey. Areas where you are needed include: Atlantic County, Bergen County, Cape May County, Essex County, Hudson County, Mercer County, Middlesex County, Monmouth County, Morris County, North Passaic County, Ocean County, Somerset County, South Passaic County, Burlington County, Camden County and Union County. For more information about our free volunteer training and available opportunities, contact our Volunteer Department or visit our website at Gracehcs.com!
07932.title: Hospice Volunteers Needed!

07932.description: Do you like to help organize events? Help us at any one of our upcoming events: Wine and Food Pairing Benefit Night on June 2, 2018, Golf Event and/or Halloween Trick or Trot. Put your creative skills to work, and help us to make our events successful to help those in need! Our next event is on June 2, 2018. Help us make our Second Annual Wine and food Pairing event a fun and successful evening. It will be \"An Evening in Italy\" event.
07932.title: Special Events Coordinator

07932.description: If you have an hour or more per week to give, Ascend Hospice welcomes your gifts of time and compassion. Whether you choose to work directly with patients and families or to volunteer in one of many other ways, you can make a profound difference in someone's life, including your own. Volunteers are an integral part of the hospice team. Ascend Hospice serves counties throughout New Jersey. Areas where you are needed include: Atlantic County, Bergen County, Cape May County, Essex County, Hudson County, Mercer County, Middlesex County, Monmouth County, Morris County, North Passaic County, Ocean County, Somerset County, South Passaic County, Burlington County, Camden County and Union County. Sometimes all it takes is a smile or sharing a story to make somone feel important. All Modalities are welcome. Volunteer Opportunities: Companionship Volunteers work directly with patients providing companionship, offering friendly visits, reading to patients, writing letters, offering a gentle touch or sharing a quiet moment. Complementary Volunteers are certified/trained professionals who can provide complementary modalities of reflexologly, music, Reiki, & massage. Ascend Hospice is seeking certified Reiki practioners to serve our end of life population in finding comfort, relaxation and peace during their final time with us. Your assistance is needed with reducing anxiety, relieving pain and providing a safe , comfortable environment. Training provided for volunteers. Reiki Certification is required. Pet Therapy Volunteers provide companionship from our certified therapy dogs. Pet therapy provides numerous benefits like encouraging movement and physical stimulation and it provides mental benefits like socialization, mental stimulation, companionship, and unconditional love. Please consider sharing your loving pet with us and bring some much needed smiles. Pets must be certified as therapy animals by an organization like TDI Therapy Dogs International- see website here http://www.tdi-dog.org/ Music Volunteers are volunteers who specialize in sharing songs or instrumental music with patients and their loved ones. Whether the Music Volunteer is sharing an existing musical skill or playing music via the radio or digital device, the goal is to enhance the quality of life of our patients. Often, regularly scheduled visits are requested, however Music Volunteers may also be asked to provide musical visits on an occasional basis for one patient/family or for a group of patients at a facility as outreach for the local hospice agency. Hospice is built on the philosophy that we care for our patients in mind, body and soul. Craft Volunteers consist of individuals or groups who touch patients in a special way by making lap blankets, shawls, memory bears and other articles for patients to enjoy. Bereavement Volunteers offer support to the families of patients who have passed. During the grieving process the bereavement volunteer can be a valuable resource, especially for those who lack a solid support network. They often make phone calls to check up on family members and also send cards of comfort and care. For more information about our free volunteer training and available opportunities, call our Volunteer Department or visit our website at Ascendhospice.com! We look forward to hearing from you! Please do not contact me with unsolicited services or offers.
07932.title: Hospice Volunteers - Companion, Music, Pet Therapy- Florham Park

07932.description: RSVP Center of Essex and Hudson Counties is a comprehensive community service organization sponsored by JFS MetroWest designed to mobilize members of the community who are 55+ to give back to their own neighborhoods in Essex and Hudson counties through volunteer services. For potential volunteers, RSVP Center of Essex and Hudson Counties provides a single location where they can review a number of local volunteer opportunities and receive the help of a trained Volunteer Coordinator. This assistance ensures that volunteers are placed in a position that matches their skills, desired time commitment and interests. RSVP has a need throughout Essex County for Senior Companion Volunteers. Each volunteer is matched one-on-one with a homebound senior living in their own home or a managed care facility. Volunteers visit the same senior once a week or once every other week for an hour. Volunteer provide companionship, friendship and a listening ear to someone who is often isolated and overlooked. Senior Companions make a real difference in the lives of the people they visit. To learn more, please contact the RSVP Director Stephanie Grove at 973-637-1766 or sgrove@jfsmetrowest.org.
07932.title: Senior Companion

07932.description: The Retired & Senior Volunteer Program Center (RSVP) Center of Essex and Hudson Counties is a comprehensive community service organization through JFS MetroWest NJ designed to mobilize members of the community who are 55 and older in giving back to their own neighborhoods through volunteer service within Essex and Hudson Counties. For potential volunteers, RSVP Center of Essex and Hudson Counties provides a single location where they can review a number of local volunteer opportunities and receive the help of a trained Volunteer Coordinator. This assistance ensures that volunteers are placed in a position that matches their skills, desired time commitment and interests. RSVP also provides volunteers with supplemental insurance while volunteering, annual volunteer recognition events and connection to a nationwide network of volunteers. We are currently placing volunteers in opportunities where they can assist childen, people with developmental disabilities, domestic violence victims, aging adults, hungry families, etc. Our placements occur throughout local hospitals, non profits, daycares, food pantries, public agencies, and many more. Contact us for a full listing of opportunities.
07932.title: RSVP Center of Essex and Hudson Counties

07932.description: Help older adults live as independently and safely as possible in their own homes by offering assistance and companionship. Friend advocates can assist with reading mail, bill paying, filing paperwork and obtaining public benefits and access to community services. All volunteers receive training and ongoing supervision and support from professional Friend Advocate staff.
07932.title: Friend Advocate Program

06831.description: Welcome to the ASD Climber Foundation! ASD stands for Autism Spectrum Disorders. We are working with a family in your area with a child on the autism spectrum. The family wants to train volunteers to help them run a home based social skills program called the Son-Rise Program. No experience necessary. Free training provided. Time commitment is 4 hours a week for 6 months or more. PLEASE READ: After completing the \"I want to help\" page, you will immediately receive an auto reply email with our Volunteer Profile. Please fill this out, and we will forward it directly to the family in your area that requires help. ***please add asdclimberfoundation@me.com to your safe list and check your junk mail if you do not see an immediate response in your inbox*** Thank you for your time!
06831.title: Greenwich, CT: Autism Volunteer

10607.description: The National MS Society is looking for volunteers to help with our upcoming event - Dystel Gold Classic on Monday, June 4 at the Metropolis Country Club! Be part of a spectacular day on the green to help create a world free of MS. Photographer Date: Monday, June 4, 2018 Time: There are two different volunteer shifts available 10:30 a.m. - 1:00 p.m. and 5:00 p.m. - 8:00 p.m. Location: Metropolis Country Club, 289 Dobbs Ferry Road, White Plains, NY 10607 *Must provide own camera If you have any questions, please contact: Sarah Johnston - Specialist, Volunteer Engagement at Sarah.Johnston@nmss.org
10607.title: Photographer Volunteers Needed for Dystel Gold Classic
10607.org: National MS Society - New York City

07936.description: STEM Mentors act as coaches for the purpose of inspiring, motivating, and educating the students in a science, technology, engineering and mathematics (STEM) subject matter. S/he answers student questions about the professional work environment. Staying with the same group of students throughout the day, and throughout each of the three visits during the school year, s/he is an ambassador for sponsor corporations. The Mentors makes themselves available to answer questions about the career application of the laboratory techniques being used and insures safety of the students. HOURS - 8:30am to 3:00pm on days when students are present.
07936.title: STEM Mentors

07936.description: STEM Instructors for Students 2 Science (S2S) are subject matter experts who provide instruction and guidance to students who visit the organization's $4 million laboratory in East Hanover where the students are able to conduct scientific experiments. The STEM Instructor provides information in a clear and concise manner, encouraging participation, helping to reduce the intimidation often associated with laboratory work, and shares his/her interest and/or passion for science. The Instructor strives to generate confidence and enthusiasm for the scientific technique being used while insuring the safety of participants. There are also Virtual lab opportunities for scientists serving as Instructors. HOURS-- 8:30AM to 3:00PM on days when students are present If you are interested, please apply at http://www.students2science.org/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=86&Itemid=251 or contact S2S at (973) 947-4880. To learn more about S2S, see our About Us video at https://students2science.wistia.com/medias/hbxylzpw5o. If you have additional questions, please email us at volunteers@students2science.org.
07936.title: STEM Instructors

07939.description: VA Deputy Representative Leaders needed! Put your people skills to use helping veterans through Soldiers’ Angels! As the VA Deputy Representative, you will assist and help organize fun and engaging programs to boost the morale of veterans! From recruitment of volunteers to coordinating the distribution of goods and services to hosting special events for veterans, you and the volunteers will show our veterans how much we appreciate their service. This position will be assisting with documentation of donations and the monthly reporting for the volunteers. Are you ready to represent an amazing nonprofit through great works at your local VA Hospital? Reach out today for more information!
07939.title: VA Deputy Representative

07939.description: Patient Visit Volunteer Bring joy to veteran patients through the Veteran Support program at Soldiers’ Angels! When loved ones are in the hospital, we all know how it brightens their day to get a visitor. Our veterans deserve that same love! Join our Veteran Support program and visit patients at the VA hospitals. Distribute blankets and hygiene kits and more to boost their morale. Or simply join them for a conversation or a game of cards. Are you ready to be the joy in someone’s day? Reach out today for more information!
07939.title: Bring joy to veteran patients through the Veteran Support program at Soldiers’ Angels!

11212.description: Do you believe every child and family deserve the right to buy and eat fresh produce and healthy food at affordable prices? Are you into food justice and do you believe healthy eating is a civil right? Then, work with students, parents, educators and the community to build school-run Hip2B Healthy Market/Farmstand/Fleas in Brownsville, Brooklyn and in Flatbush, Brooklyn. Both these neighborhoods are ranked among NYC's most food-insecure zones, by the NYC Health Dept. and multiple studies. There is limited access to fruits and vegetables and overwhelming junk food options. These neighborhoods have among the highest obesity, diabetes, heart disease rates in the city - mainly due to lack of access to affordable fresh produce and healthy activities. Be the change! Seeking volunteers on these days! Choose any: In school, working with elementary and/or middle school students (btw 8 am and 3 pm, hours optional) - Tuesdays am - Help prep market in Flatbush (hours flexible) - - Wednesday am - Help run market - 7 -10 am (and offer any special cooking, recipes, etc.) - Thursdays - any time all day in Brownsville (help prep for market and cook with kids) - Friday am (Brownsville) - 7-10 am - Help run market and other activities - Saturdays, 9-3 pm (Brownsville) - Help run market and do activities with kids and families, including yoga, fitness like zumba, art, tutor, cook healthy recipes, etc. Do you garden? Do you want to help children grow food as well? Let us know. Looking for anyone who wants to work with students and families and educators and the local commuity to effect sustainable change by building local capacity. All talents and skills welcome - even an hour-long yoga class. Yes, we give internships (and welcome students of all ages to get community service credits, internship credits, etc.) Can you cook healthy? Please offer a recipe, a demo or class, whatever you'd like to share. We can schedule together and we will promote your business. Want to join a new flea? Have a home business and want to get more exposure? Join us. WE LAUNCH BROWNSVILLE ON FEB. 3 AND FLATBUSH ON MARCH 7. Saturday Market: Set-up: 9-10 am Activities: 10 am - 2 pm Breakdown: 2-3 pm School days - we arrange with you. Do you cook or want to share a healthy recipe that day? Even hot oatmeal or smoothies? Then help us run our Hip2B Healthy Markets.. No experience necessary - just a passion for healthy food and sharing nutrition and a quality life with all. Do you want to lead a healthy workshop - even with friends? A cooking demo or a dance class? In health profession? Can you do blood pressure screenings, offer nutrition or diabetes education or more? Anything more? Please join us. Parents are asking! You can also offer any kind of physical activity - dance, zumba, soccer, yoga - just for an hour in the gym. Seeds in the Middle is a joyful partnership with volunteers and communities to have fun while getting healthy and empowering kids to create their own healthy environments, when there's nothing around them. Central Brooklyn is one of 3 neighborhoods with the highest obesity, diabetes and heart disease rates - due to lack of accessible, affordable fresh food and fitness. Let's change that together. Everyone is welcome. All ages welcome, families, too! Students - get community service credits. And let us know if you want to continue to volunteer for Saturday markets! More info? Email - info@seedsinthemiddle.org
11212.title: Food! Health! Help Brownsville, Flatbush BK kids launch healthy market days!

11212.description: BkMSCC is seeking motivated educators , humanitarians, and those who want to help other. Those d edicated, ambitious, and committed to student success and education reform. Qualified candidates must demonstrate records of achievement, high degrees of personal responsibility, and the drive to do whatever it takes to ensure that every child achieves academic success. This individual must be committed to excellence, led by example, and see collaboration as a key component of success. Position Description You are the backbone of Brooklyn Multi-Service Community Center, Corp. You will help perfect our programs. This position is ideal for candidates that wish to fully pursue a crede ntialed lead teaching position, activism, and other community based programs. Becoming an educational associate serves as an internship for candidates who wish to develop their expertise through observation and experience in preparation for a meaningful and successful teaching career. QUALIFICATIONS/SKILLS Applicants must possess strong communication and administrative skills; an understanding of arts education; the capacity to multi-task and to work independently; along with the ability to problem solve. Ideal candidates must also have a strong knowledge of photography-its history, techniques, and aesthetics. A familiarity with computer programs such as Microsoft Office and Photoshop are required. Must have excellent customer service skills and thrive in a high-energy, fast-paced environment. BENEFITS I nterns are also invited to attend private openings and artist talks. Part of programing. Compensation * Modest honorarium awarded to intern upon completion of internship * School credit/letter of recommendation Required education: * High school or equivalent
11212.title: Community and Instructional Programs

11212.description: ABOUT Great opportunity for a creative, ambitious college student or recent graduate looking to gain professional experience in all aspects of the event planning industry. Must be personable, detail-oriented, and comfortable working in a fast-paced work environment. STATUS Hours are flexible, but we prefer to set a definitive schedule with a minimum commitment of 15-20 hours per week. Can work virtually REPORTS TO Event Coordinator and or Board ACADEMIC CREDIT If intern wishes to receive academic credit for the internship, it will be the intern’s responsibility to make arrangements with his or her school. BkMSCC will provide the necessary job description and performance review upon request. POSITION SUMMARY The Intern serves as a key member of the Brooklyn Multi-Service Community Center, Corp. (BkMSCC) team. Upon completion of the internship, candidates leave with a foundation of knowledge for producing successful events and ideally have the tools with which to tackle producing an event of their own. Duties will include but are not limited to the following: Assist in all aspects of event coordination including planning, design, marketing, fundraising, and sponsorship Perform responsibilities as assigned at BkMSCC events (some evenings and weekends necessary) Meeting preparation: scheduling and coordination of appropriate materials for client and new business meetings Research new event spaces, restaurants, and resources related to our industry Office reception: answering phones, receiving deliveries, ordering supplies Mailings and list management: compiling and updating mailing lists, tracking RSVPs for events, and coordinating large mailings Being creative, collaborative, and having fun! Qualifications: Good writing and communication skills Strong computer skills including Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint Strong organizational skills and exceptional attention to detail Internet research Ability to handle multiple tasks Availability to work occasional evenings and weekends Interest in pop culture, food, arts, travel, health and wellness, and nonprofit fundraising Required education: High school or equivalent
11212.title: Event Planner

11212.description: The Volunteer Services Department at the Brookdale Hospital and Medical Center is seeking volunteers to participate in their Volunteer Child Life Program. The volunteers will assist the Child Life Specialist in providing a safe and developmentally appropriate environment for the children in the hospital. Volunteers are trained by a certified Child Life Speacialist in child development and hospital policies so they feel confident working with the children. Child Life volunteers work directly with the children and their families by bringing toys, games, crafts, movies, music or other resources to the children's room. Volunteers also bring childen to the playroom where they can play games and hold arts and crafts activities. We are seeking compassionate, caring individuals who enjoy working with children.
11212.title: Child Life Volunteer
11212.org: THE BROOKDALE UNIVERSITY HOSPITAL AND MEDICAL CENT

11212.description: Surgical Advocate Volunteers provide an important link for communication and support to family members of surgical patients to obtain non-medical information regarding the status of the patient.
11212.title: Surgical Advocate Volunteer
11212.org: THE BROOKDALE UNIVERSITY HOSPITAL AND MEDICAL CENT

11212.description: Volunteer Greeters are trained to provide a warm and welcoming atmosphere for patients and visitors at The Brookdale University Hospital and Medicla Center, and will provide diretion to locations throughout the hospital. Greeters work collaboratively with hopsital and medical staff to help maintain our commitment to ALWAYS provide the highest personalized quality care and service excellence.
11212.title: GREETER PROGRAM
11212.org: THE BROOKDALE UNIVERSITY HOSPITAL AND MEDICAL CENT

11212.description: Volunteers provide health literacy assistance and education to our outpatient population in an effort to teach basic health literacy skills to enable compliance with appropriate understanding of medication labels, assistance with managing multiple medications and maintaining a medical journal.
11212.title: Pharmacy Partners Volunteer Program
11212.org: THE BROOKDALE UNIVERSITY HOSPITAL AND MEDICAL CENT

11212.description: The purpose of this volunteer program is provide assistance to patients being treated in the Emergency Department, their family members/escorts. Volunteers will interact with family members/escorts of those patients keeping them appraised of the patients' progress. Volunteers will provide only non-medical information. Other duties will include: * Escorting patients and or family members to treatment areas. *Providing general information to persons waiting in the Emergency Department, * Assisting medical staff with patients as needed.
11212.title: EMERGENCY DEPARTMENT CARING LINKS PROGRAM
11212.org: THE BROOKDALE UNIVERSITY HOSPITAL AND MEDICAL CENT

11212.description: A hospital stay for a child can be a lonely, frightening experience. Reading books and telling stories can brighten a young persons hospital stay and stimulate the imagination. Volunteer are needed to read to pediatric patients at Brookdale University Hospital and Medical Center. You must be 18 years of age, and have a good command of the English language. Experience with children is highly preferred. Volunteers are required to commit to a minimum two hour shift one day per week and a total of 150 hours. To find out more about our reading program, or to inquire about other exciting volunteer opportunities, please call the Volunteer Services Department at Brookdale University Hospital and Medical Center at (718) 240-5277between 9:00am- 5:30pm, Monday through Friday.
11212.title: Bedtime Storybook Reader
11212.org: THE BROOKDALE UNIVERSITY HOSPITAL AND MEDICAL CENT

11212.description: Several volunteer opportunities exist in the hospital and/or nursing home. These include: Clerical, Surgical Advocate, Emergency Room, Pediatric Storybook Reading, Elderly Friendly Visiting, Pastoral Care, Book Cart, Recreation Therapy, plus more..
11212.title: VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNTITIES
11212.org: THE BROOKDALE UNIVERSITY HOSPITAL AND MEDICAL CENT

11213.description: Fiver Children's Foundation is seeking a motivated youth Co-Facilitator in Brooklyn to join the Fiver team and support its mission of empowering the youth through character cultivation year round. Every month, Fiver Children's Foundation hosts Fiver Club, a program where Fiver participants learn character building traits that align with Fiver's three pathways to success: Education and Careers, Service and Leadership, and Healthy Life Choices. Fiver's Youth Co-Facilitator will assist Fiver's Program Supervisor at Fiver Clubs as a support staff by facilitating certain curriculum pieces and handling behavior management. This position is responsible for creating a safe and productive environment, ensuring a high level of program quality, and working to establish a positive relationship with Fiver participants. Fiver's Youth Co-Facilitator will review curriculum with Fiver Program Supervisor prior to the dates of Fiver Club. Responsibilities include, but are not limited to Leading and assisting with curriculum activities and games with Fiver participants that align with Fiver's three pathways to success Supporting the Fiver Program Supervisor Monitoring participants behavior Adequately observing participants activities and enforcing safety regulations and program expectations Qualifications Experience working with the youth, preferably 5th through 8th grade Flexibility Creativity Behavior management and conflict resolution skills Verbal communication skills Leadership and facilitation skills Must be willing to commit to monthly Fiver Clubs on the dates listed below Dates for Fiver Club in Brooklyn, St. Johns Recreation Center Wednesday, March 21st at 4pm - 6pm Wednesday, April 25th at 4pm - 6pm Wednesday, May 16th at 4pm - 6pm Thursday, June 7th at 4pm - 6pm
11213.title: Youth Co-Facilitator in Brooklyn, St. Johns Recreation Center

11213.description: Love soccer? Want to share the joy of the game with underserved kids in central Brooklyn? Join us for this exciting opportuntiy to build a brand new league for youth who need it in Crown Heights! We need players to coach kids ages 3 and up and help lead teams. Most children have never played soccer and some come back every season - so there's a variety of levels. This is a neighborhood with limited healthy options - to eat or get physically fit. So, you'll play a role in not only building teamwork, but empowering youth and families to get active. Seeking anyone who can play soccer or support the program starting now through end of summer. Weekends - Saturdays and Sundays. Thursday evenings also possible. Have fun, play ball, make a difference. Attn, Students! Yes, we give community service credits. Our program started in 2009 just to get kids active. Now, we want to expand a nascent league. . Kids love it, but don't know the game so we need your help. We're also seeking LEAD COACHES, who can set up schedules and organize volunteers and parents. Great experience. Recommendation letters given. Can you play in a fundraising opening soccer game? We can schedule in March! SCHEDULE - April 21 - June 23 APRIL 21 - JUNE 23 SATURDAYS, 1 PM - 3 PM SUNDAYS, 4 PM - 6 PM INFO: No coaching experience needed. Just love of the game and able to collaborate with others. Of course, we'd love it if you have experience... Practices are co-ed, and players range from 3 to 12 years old and are at beginner to intermediate level. If we have enough players, will create boys and girls only teams for ages 10 and up.. If you're self-motivated, love kids and are good with them, can handle the unexpected, and just love this game and want to share it, you're for us. Looking for reliable and flexible players who can commit to at least 2 practices. This is a great community service opportunity for high school and college students. Yes, we do give letters and service hours. WE ASK VOLUNTEERS TO COMMIT TO AT LEAST 2 TIMES ON THE FIELD. If you aren't able to coach, but still want to help, we need folks to: - advertise with flyers, post flyers, drop off flyers at schools and community areas - blast on social media - take attendance and register players - other administrative tasks Please send us information about you- a resume or some information on your background so we get to know you a little to soccer@seedsinthemiddle.org If you have other times you are available - even to do a workshop in a school, let us know. YOU CAN ALSO LIKE US ON FACEBOOK - facebook.com/seedsinthemiddle https://www.facebook.com/brooklyncrown.heightssoccer https://www.facebook.com/Soccer-for-Harmony-204551942961230/ Instagram: @seedsinthemiddle
11213.title: Soccer Players!  Share joy of game, help NEW league for Brooklyn  kids!

11213.description: The New York Crusaders are in search for a few well organized, passionate and high energy individuals to help manage the day to day operations of a growing adult amateur football program. Individuals will work hands on with coaches, players, and executive staff to executive football related initiatives as needed. While no extensive experience is required, candidates should be able to learn quickly, work independently, and implement effective strategies as needed. The Crusaders needs its general managers to spearhead the following the matters but are not limited to: 1. Organizing practice and game schedules 2. Taking player attendance at practices and games 3. Responding to player and coach inquires, issues, and questions 4. Engaging in community outreach programs such as kid field days, reading to kids, etc 5. Administration task that include keeping player attendance logs, ensuring field permits are in order, etc 6. These task are done in conjunction with the coaching staff and executive staff; Vice President and President
