11433.description: Reading Partners needs volunteers like you to provide students in under-resourced elementary schools in your community with the proven, individualized reading support they need to read at grade level by fourth grade. Reading is the foundation for all future learning.The ability to read transforms lives and can empower children to reach their full potential. Research shows that when students can read at grade level by fourth grade, they have a greater opportunity to succeed in school and in life. With your help, we can equip students with the foundational skills they need to read at grade level. Each week, you will meet one-on-one with your student every week to help them develop strong literacy skills and discover a passion for reading. We'll provide a structured curriculum, in-person training, and ongoing support to help your student thrive. Rigorous research has proven that Reading Partners significantly increases reading proficiency. No teaching experience required and anyone over the age of 14 can volunteer. Flexible Monday to Thursday volunteer times between 9am and 5pm. Visit our website at www.readingpartners.org/volunteer to sign up and learn more.
11433.title: Become a reading partner- make a lifelong impact on a child (PS 48 William Wordsworth, Queens)

11430.description: Travelers Aid at JFK International Airport is seeking volunteers to welcome passengers and provide information regarding a variety of travel-related services. This is an excellent opportunity to be a welcoming ambassador for travelers from all over the world, improve your communication skills and gain experience assisting and working with people. Volunteers are placed at key locations throughout the airport. Shifts are available 7 days a week from 10-2 and 2-6. We require one four hour shift per week. In addition to the satisfaction of helping travelers, volunteers also receive transportation (local subway and bus fare) and meal reimbursement! Please contact us at (718) 656-4870 to arrange a tour of our program! Visit and like Travelers Aid JFK Airport at facebook.com/travelersaidjfk.
11430.title: Travelers Aid JFK Volunteer

07642.description: If you have an hour or more per week to give, Ascend Hospice welcomes your gifts of time and compassion. Whether you choose to work directly with patients and families or to volunteer in one of many other ways, you can make a profound difference in someone's life, including your own. Volunteers are an integral part of the hospice team. Ascend Hospice serves counties throughout New Jersey. Areas where you are needed include: Atlantic County, Bergen County, Cape May County, Essex County, Hudson County, Mercer County, Middlesex County, Monmouth County, Morris County, North Passaic County, Ocean County, Somerset County, South Passaic County, Burlington County, Camden County and Union County. Sometimes all it takes is a smile or sharing a story to make somone feel important. All Modalities are welcome. Volunteer Opportunities: Companionship Volunteers work directly with patients providing companionship, offering friendly visits, reading to patients, writing letters, offering a gentle touch or sharing a quiet moment. Complementary Volunteers are certified/trained professionals who can provide complementary modalities of reflexologly, music, Reiki, & massage. Ascend Hospice is seeking certified Reiki practioners to serve our end of life population in finding comfort, relaxation and peace during their final time with us. Your assistance is needed with reducing anxiety, relieving pain and providing a safe , comfortable environment. Training provided for volunteers. Reiki Certification is required. Pet Therapy Volunteers provide companionship from our certified therapy dogs. Pet therapy provides numerous benefits like encouraging movement and physical stimulation and it provides mental benefits like socialization, mental stimulation, companionship, and unconditional love. Please consider sharing your loving pet with us and bring some much needed smiles. Pets must be certified as therapy animals by an organization like TDI Therapy Dogs International- see website here http://www.tdi-dog.org/ Music Volunteers are volunteers who specialize in sharing songs or instrumental music with patients and their loved ones. Whether the Music Volunteer is sharing an existing musical skill or playing music via the radio or digital device, the goal is to enhance the quality of life of our patients. Often, regularly scheduled visits are requested, however Music Volunteers may also be asked to provide musical visits on an occasional basis for one patient/family or for a group of patients at a facility as outreach for the local hospice agency. Hospice is built on the philosophy that we care for our patients in mind, body and soul. Bereavement Volunteers offer support to the families of patients who have passed. During the grieving process the bereavement volunteer can be a valuable resource, especially for those who lack a solid support network. They often make phone calls to check up on family members and also send cards of comfort and care. For more information about our free volunteer training and available opportunities, call our Volunteer Department or visit our website at Ascendhospice.com! We look forward to hearing from you! Please do not contact me with unsolicited services or offers.
07642.title: Hospice Volunteers - Companion, Music, Pet Therapy, Reiki - Hillsdale

07643.description: Education Coach Internship Description: Every Monday and Wednesday Under the direction of the MFSC Staff, Homework Coaches will work with children from K-12 to provide academic support. Homework Coaches will be coaching a group of 5 children similar in age. The coaches’ primary responsibility is to ensure that the children have completed their work accurately as well as assisting them when needed. This is a part-time volunteer position. Homework coaches should have previous experience working with children; however relevant coursework will be considered. This position is a good fit for an aspiring teacher or youth worker with a background in working with kids. Internship Requirements: Interns must be flexible, may require some nights Internship is Unpaid Interns are able to create their own schedule, including hours per week and monthly commitment Currently enrolled in college or currently has Associate’s or Bachelor’s Degree, preferably with relevant coursework and or previous work with children Comfortable with children and all/most subject areas from Elementary to High school Strong communication, organizational, and professional demeanor MFSC will work with College/University if credits/hours are required; however, this requirement is not necessary for an internship position with the MFSC
07643.title: Education Coach

07643.description: Tutor and coach K-12 students withe academic support at the Meadowlands Success Center.

07643.description: Project Coordinators (PC's), volunteer in a leadership capacity at our volunteer opportunities and provide organization and a team atmosphere for every volunteer experience. We encourage these exceptional community leaders to make a commitment at one specific program usually once or twice monthly for the span of six months. Project Coordinators (or PCs) provide leadership in Jersey Cares’ recurring volunteer opportunities by serving as a liaison between volunteers, nonprofit partners, and Jersey Cares. They encourage volunteers to \"Be the Change\" and provide directions during projects. It’s a fun learning opportunity where you get to network with nonprofits and other community leaders while being supported by a cohort of other volunteer leaders. Project Coordinators commit to 1+ projects per month for 6 months at a time. READ MORE: https://www.jerseycares.org/JC_Project_Coordinator Contact: Dawn Browning Programs Manager, Leadership Development Dawn@jerseycares.org (973) 533-1993, ext. 20
07643.title: Project Coordinator - Be a Leader

07647.description: Your unique collection of life experiences can make a tremendous impact on the lives of young people new to America. By volunteering as a mentor with Table Wisdom you will have the chance to cultivate invaluable relationships as a mentor while helping foreign born students and young professionals practice their conversational English skills. It's as easy as signing up, getting paired, and starting a conversation. You and your mentee set the schedule and your student prepares topics for conversation. Our pairs talk about everything: from sports and culture to industry-specific skills and knowledge, what you discuss is up to you and your mentee. We make matches based on student need to make sure our mentors are able to provide the most value possible. By having fun yet meaningful conversations you will help students learn about a new culture while building their confidence and fluency in English. All you need is the ability to video chat and the desire to meet someone new. Help a young foreign born person improve their quality of life in America. Join Table Wisdom: https://www.table-wisdom.org/join-us \"Although our lives are so different and perhaps distant, it is encouraging that there is so much that we share trying to be our best selves and making this a better world.\" -- Alan, mentor \"I feel so blessed to have met my excellent English language mentor. He always encourages me to speak out and taught me some idiomatic English which I didn't learn from a textbook.\" -- Zachary, mentee
07647.title: Share your story! Mentor foreign born students and young professionals

07645.description: Case Manager(s) *You need to be located within the state of NJ or Rockland County. Duties range from assisting a client with intake paperwork, reviewing completed pet intake forms, collecting documents required to show proof of ownership, collecting veterinary documents, and getting all the information collected and added to our shared drive. The caseworker coordinates the intake and discharge of the pets. They stay in communication with the case worker and transporter. They provide communication and pet updates to the case worker and staff. The Case Manager is in charge of updating and maintaining the SOP Case Tracking Spreadsheet. Knowledge, Abilities and Skills Ability to- Transmit information promptly and clearly to Foster Director and Chair. Adhere to strict confidentiality policy. Update and maintain case log. Preferred: Experience working with animals AND people in stressful situations. Shelter Our Pets is an all-volunteer nonprofit corporation serving New Jersey and beyond. Our mission is to provide a safe haven for the pets of victims of domestic violence who are fleeing their abusive situations. Shelter Our Pets assists people seeking safety from violence by providing alternatives to giving up a beloved pet, leaving a pet behind in a potentially dangerous situation or continuing to subject themselves and their pets to abuse. A recognized 501(c)3 charity located in New Jersey
07645.title: Case Manager - Pet Foster Program

07901.description: JerseySTEM Girls Who Code Clubs are led by Facilitators, who are 18+ and can be computer scientists, parents, college students or volunteers from any STEM background or field. Our Club Facilitators guide Club girls through the curriculum , helping them to build sisterhood within the Club and learn to use computer science to impact their community. Clubs are run by 2-4 facilitators and are supported by our curriculum team and provided training as they join. Be the change you want to see. Volunteer 2 hours/week an make a difference in the life or Girls in your community.

07901.description: JerseySTEM is volunteer, grassroots non-profit agency dedicated to bridging the innovative, opportunity, and gender gaps in STEM education for children in New Jersey’s underserved communities. We are dedicated to partnering with local schools and other organizations to create and enhance STEM-oriented educational opportunities for students in grades 5-8 as part of their paths towards college and career readiness. We provide free of charge after-school, project-based, and hands-on structured programs in Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics. Classes include: Robotics, Coding, Engineering, Life Sciences, etc. Classes last up to 10 weeks and are predominantly taught by trained volunteer college students. Volunteers typically donate an average of 2 hours/week to the success of the program. Position Description The Field Reporter will interview our corporate sponsors, host sponsors, coaches, parents, and anyone else involved with an event. These reporters are expected to be local to the NY/NJ area. We prefer people with time flexibility who may deviate from the responsibilities of a 9-5 job. They will be expected to submit details and stories about the event along with photo and videos, if possible. We will occasionally send a professional photographer and videographer to assist in the documentation of some of our most important events. This position reports to the Director of Marketing What’s in it for the Volunteer Work with savvy entrepreneurs and business leaders and gain experience at a nonprofit startup Gain experience working with cutting-edge technologies and tools Build professional network and references. Our executive and management teams are experienced business leaders who are committed in the applicant’s personal success Essential Functions of the Volunteer Position Partner with our field crew and interview our host and corporate sponsors including parents and their kids Partner with photographers and videographers, and identify interesting stories that have the potential to be featured in national media and education-focused TV/Radio/Podcasts shows Partner with backend PR team and help craft stories as they work with media partners and social media collaborators Spend 3-4 hours a day at events that excite you most Create your own schedule and be accountable for the reporting of the entire event Act as a journalist who is willing to change the world through his/her personal craft Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities Excellent oral and written communication skills Interview and reporting skills Demonstrate dependency and commitment to job responsibilities Have a passion for kids, and education and tech savvy graphic designing Required Education and Experience Bachelor’s degree or equivalent Weekly Time Commitment Required 6~8 hours per event Location Position will be performed locally in NJ; various locations depending on event venue
07901.title: MKT: Field Reporter

07901.description: We realize the importance of cultivating partnerships with corporations and community organizations to further our mission, and we like everyone to see the important work that our staff and hundreds of volunteers do daily. Besides giving employees an opportunity to do something positive for the community, corporate volunteering is good for PR, helps build team morale, develops employee skills and helps with local connections. SAGE offers multiple ways your group can help. We are always open to suggestions! Meals on Wheels For either one Day of Caring, or for an ongoing basis, volunteers deliver meals and spend a few minutes with home-bound, isolated people. Monday through Friday from 11:00 - 12:30 Up to 6 \"teams\" (cars) of employees can come to SAGE to pick up meals. Our staff supplies each team with everything they need and instructions. Local businesses have also chosen to do this on an ongoing basis if employee schedules allow. We also ask community members to \"guest\" volunteer during the month of March for the national March for Meals promotion. We also have a small Food Pantry, so non-perishables are always welcome! Spend A Day SAGE’s adult medical day center provides a safe and fun environment for vulnerable older adults. Corporate volunteers can come (best hours between 10:30 and 3:00) and work on a project with the clients, whether it be art, gardening, entertainment, oral histories, photography, etc. The staff welcomes outside groups for socialization and to supplement the calendar of activities. Maximum group size is 15. Sensitivity Training The ultimate team building experience, SAGE’s Sensitivity Training is a unique opportunity for your team to experience what it feels like to age in a series of exercises that simulate age related physical and mental conditions. The program is customizable and flexible with time - lasting from 45 minutes to 3 hours. Skill Based Volunteers We welcome the help of your expertise! We can always use skilled consultants - anything from planning events to helping with fundraising to serving on our board.
07901.title: Day of Caring for Corporations and Community Organizations

The programs last 10 weeks and are taught predominantly by volunteer college students that we recruit, train, transport and mentor as they donate 2 hours/week to the program. Position Description Under direction of organization leadership, you will plan, organize, direct, and manage finance activities including budgeting, cash flow, expense reimbursement, matching gifts management, and corporate/local sponsorship. You will advise volunteer and organization leadership on finance-related issues and will develop, coordinate, and implement finance policies and procedures across the organization. Essential Functions of the Volunteer Position -Effectively manage and lead the finance team -Serve as liaison between the finance team and the rest of the organization -Oversee all reporting and fiduciary tasks -Ensure organization and all volunteers follow proper finance procedure as set forth by you and your team Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities -Experience as a manager of people or as a team leader -Solid experience in finance, accounting and/or business management -Exceptional written, verbal, and interpersonal communication skills -Well organized, with strong attention to detail
07901.title: FIN: Finance Director

07901.description: JerseySTEM promotes Science, Technology, Engineering and Math programs for students K-12. Minimum commitment is for 10 hours (5 times 2 hours, or 10 times one hour or 1 time 6 house and 1 time 4 hours). You are responsible for your transportation to and from the makerplace. You need to go through a training/orientation held the 1st Sunday of every month You will be provided a certificate of volunteering that can be used for If you volunteer 40 hours in the year, you will be provided a letter of recommendation. 07648.description: If you have an hour or more per week to give, Ascend Hospice welcomes your gifts of time and compassion. Whether you choose to work directly with patients and families or to volunteer in one of many other ways, you can make a profound difference in someone's life, including your own. Volunteers are an integral part of the hospice team. Ascend Hospice serves counties throughout New Jersey. Areas where you are needed include: Atlantic County, Bergen County, Cape May County, Essex County, Hudson County, Mercer County, Middlesex County, Monmouth County, Morris County, North Passaic County, Ocean County, Somerset County, South Passaic County, Burlington County, Camden County and Union County. Sometimes all it takes is a smile or sharing a story to make somone feel important. All Modalities are welcome. Volunteer Opportunities: Companionship Volunteers work directly with patients providing companionship, offering friendly visits, reading to patients, writing letters, offering a gentle touch or sharing a quiet moment. Complementary Volunteers are certified/trained professionals who can provide complementary modalities of reflexologly, music, Reiki, & massage. Ascend Hospice is seeking certified Reiki practioners to serve our end of life population in finding comfort, relaxation and peace during their final time with us. Your assistance is needed with reducing anxiety, relieving pain and providing a safe , comfortable environment. Training provided for volunteers. Reiki Certification is required. Pet Therapy Volunteers provide companionship from our certified therapy dogs. Pet therapy provides numerous benefits like encouraging movement and physical stimulation and it provides mental benefits like socialization, mental stimulation, companionship, and unconditional love. Please consider sharing your loving pet with us and bring some much needed smiles. Pets must be certified as therapy animals by an organization like TDI Therapy Dogs International- see website here http://www.tdi-dog.org/ Music Volunteers are volunteers who specialize in sharing songs or instrumental music with patients and their loved ones. Whether the Music Volunteer is sharing an existing musical skill or playing music via the radio or digital device, the goal is to enhance the quality of life of our patients. Often, regularly scheduled visits are requested, however Music Volunteers may also be asked to provide musical visits on an occasional basis for one patient/family or for a group of patients at a facility as outreach for the local hospice agency. Hospice is built on the philosophy that we care for our patients in mind, body and soul. Craft Volunteers consist of individuals or groups who touch patients in a special way by making lap blankets, shawls, memory bears and other articles for patients to enjoy. Bereavement Volunteers offer support to the families of patients who have passed. During the grieving process the bereavement volunteer can be a valuable resource, especially for those who lack a solid support network. They often make phone calls to check up on family members and also send cards of comfort and care. For more information about our free volunteer training and available opportunities, call our Volunteer Department or visit our website at Ascendhospice.com! We look forward to hearing from you! Please do not contact me with unsolicited services or offers.
07648.title: Hospice Volunteers - Companion, Music, Pet Therapy, Reiki - Norwood

07648.description: Life Choice Hospice is seeking Pet Therapy Volunteers to visit our hospice patients throughout Northern NJ. Providing our patients with loving touch and care from certified pet therapy animals and owners is beyond appreciated by both our patients and our staff. Your dog must be certified and the handler needs training by Life Choice Hospice as a hospice volunteer. Volunteer training and medical requirements are provided FREE by Life Choice. Please help bring companionship and joy into the life of a Hospice patient!
07648.title: Share Your Pet’s Love – Seeking Certified Pet Therapy Volunteers for Hospice!

07648.description: Description Use what you have learned in the classroom to help improve the quality of life for hospice patients. Utilize free time to be compassionate and genuine in order to reduce terminally ill patients’ loneliness and isolation. Please help us keep our patients happy and comfortable as they reach the end of their life due to a variety of health conditions including: cancer, Alzheimer’s, etc. How can you benefit by being a volunteer? Build your resume: Volunteer experience shows proof of motivation, commitment, initiative, dependability, and flexibility Develop interpersonal skills Increase meaning and purpose in your life Experience significant opportunities for growth and development Responsibilities of Companion volunteers: Contribute to our patients' quality of life Attend to Patients' Needs Communicate with Nurses by keeping them Up to Date about each Patient visited Maintain Patients' Confidentiality Travel and Visit patients in facilities in an area near you Read to them, give hand massage, assist in life review or memory building We offer you: FREE TB test and MMR Titer Extremely flexible assignments (anytime you can give is greatly appreciated) Convenient Orientation and FREE training and that fits your schedule Receive Internship Credit (if applicable-unpaid)
07648.title: Great Opportunity for Healthcare Students!

06840.description: Since 2001, the Multiple Myeloma Research Foundation’s family-friendly 5K walk/run program has raised both awareness and funds to support urgent multiple myeloma research. Today, the series is held annually in thirteen cities and participation offers hope, camaraderie and knowledge sharing within our myeloma community and beyond. We’ll be at New Canaan High School on Sunday, June 10th, and need your help in making this year’s event a great day for our patients as well as their friends and family members! Volunteers can assist in a variety of ways, serving as part of the Welcome Team, Course Team, Event Team or Flex Team. Volunteers will also receive a free t-shirt on the day of the race! Groups welcome! To register, please click the link below: https://walkrun.themmrf.org/tristate18/Account/Register Contact volunteers@themmrf.org with questions or for more information.
06840.title: MMRF Team for Cures 5K Walk/Run Tri-State

06840.description: Bring your enthusiasm for and experience with beading and simple jewelry making to a group of adult patients (age 18+) in one of our transitional living programs. The ideal time for this group will be on Friday morning at 10:00 a.m. or on the weekends. Your and other volunteers' ongoing weekly presence offers you and the patients an opportunity to develop a rapport and to pick up any threads of conversations from the previous weeks. It's all in good fun and gives patients a creative, relaxing outlet. To ensure that you will have what you need each time you volunteer, you may select simple supplies and the hospital will reimburse you for your purchases. We hope to hear from you soon!
06840.title: Beading/jewelry making group

06840.description: Share your love and experience with dance and movement with the teens in our adolescent transitional living program. We have carved out Sunday and Monday at 4:00 p.m. as the ideal days/times on our patient program schedule. Ideally you have taken some creative movement and dance classes in your community or at school and have some experience leading groups. Volunteers are required to attend a hospital orientation (the first Monday of the month except when this Monday falls on a holiday then the training is on the second Monday of the month) and also submit to a criminal background check. Please tell us more about your personal and professional background and send a resume to lruggiero@silverhillhospital.org or call 203-801-2320 for additional information.
06840.title: Movement/Dance Group for Adolescent Program

06840.description: Volunteers and their dogs who have been certified by a pet therapy program (e.g., Good Dog Foundation, Pet Partners, Therapy Dogs International) visit with their dogs on Wednesday and/or Saturday mornings in one or two of our patient programs. All visits are approximately 30 minutes in length and are in a group setting. New volunteers will receive an orientation from the director of volunteer services and supervision by our staff during each pet therapy visit. We love pet therapy at Silver Hill! We hope to hear from you soon and have you join our existing pet therapy team. If you have a loveable dog and would like to learn more about how to become a certified pet therapy team, contact the pet therapy certification programs listed above to learn more. Please contact Lisa Ruggiero 203-801-2320 or lruggiero@silverhillhospital.org for additional information about the pet therapy program and pet therapy visit schedule at Silver Hill Hospital.
06840.title: Seeking certified pet therapy teams!

06840.description: We are seeking mature college students, recent college graduates or graduate students who are interested in the mental health field and who would like to volunteer to support our teen patients (ages 13-17) during their school time period on weekday mornings (Monday-Friday 9:15-11:15 a.m.). Volunteers choose the days they are available and work with the teacher to support teen patients while they complete homework assignments or engage in other structured activities (puzzles, arts/crafts, board games). Volunteers provide supportive, positive dialogues that motivate and support our youngest patients who are in treatment for a psychiatric or addictive disorder. After being selected for this position, volunteers must complete a one-day hospital orientation that takes place on the first Monday of the month (except on holiday Mondays). Candidates must also provide one written reference and provide documentation of a negative PPD (TB screening). We look forward to hearing from you. Please contact Lisa Ruggiero at lruggiero@silverhillhospital.org or 203-801-2320.
06840.title: School Time/Group Activity Assistant-Adolescent Program

06840.description: Please volunteer at Silver Hill to share your love of baking and some simple recipes that allow a group of patients enjoy Friday or Sunday morning with you, each other and the staff. Our baking group volunteers arrive at 10:45 a.m. to set everything up in the kitchen of a residential program. You will teach the residents how to follow a recipe, organize the ingredients, and end up with a tasty (and sometimes healthy) treat for all to enjoy. You select the recipe and we will buy the ingredients or you may do so and we will reimburse you. You do not have to be a professional pastry chef; however you should be mature and comfortable with yourself and others. Ideally, we would like you to participate in one of our hospital orientations that take place on the first Monday of the month (except holiday Mondays). A background check (hospital conducts) and a current reference (you provide) are required.
06840.title: Calling all Sunday morning bakers!

06840.description: Show patients in our new residential eating disorders program located on the second floor of our Main House how to knit and to also appreciate the value of knitting. Choose Monday, Tuesday OR Friday from 6:30-7:30 pm to offer your talents and supportive conversation. Your ongoing (weekly) presence offers you and the patients an opportunity to develop a rapport and to pick up any threads of conversations from the previous weeks. It's all in good fun and gives patients a creative outlet for eating disorder recovery. To ensure that you will have what you need each time you volunteer, you will select easy to use (simple) knitting supplies and yarn and the hospital will reimburse you for your purchases. Hospital orientation and criminal background check are required and ongoing volunteer supervision is provided.
06840.title: Knit One, Purl Two: Teach Knitting to Patients

06840.description: We seek mature, personable, and discreet individuals to greet and direct visitors to the inpatient adolescent unit during regularly scheduled family programs and visiting hours on the weekends (12:45-2:30PM Saturday and Sunday). This volunteer position will afford you with an opportunity to interact with patients, family members and staff and gain exposure to the operations of a psychiatric hospital and various staff roles and functions. You will also learn about the types of services offered to individuals with psychiatric or addiction disorders. Volunteers may select available weekend dates that work with their availability.
06840.title: Adolescent Unit-Greet Visitors on Weekends

06840.description: We seek mature individuals to share their love of art in a relaxed home atmosphere with adult patients on Mondays at 10:00 a.m. You do not have to be a professional artist; however, if you love art, you have likely been dabbling in it for a while as a hobby or in a classroom setting. Alternate your volunteer schedule with other volunteers who also support this program that provides an enjoyable pastime for our patients. Hospital orientation required and ongoing supervision is provided. Please tell us more about yourself by writing to volunteer@silverhillhospital.org
06840.title: Monday 10:00 a.m. Art Group for DBT Program

06840.description: Patients at Silver Hill Hospital who are struggling with addiction or psychiatric illness engage in many therapeutic activities, including volunteer-led groups that also allow volunteers to share a hobby, pasttime or talent. We are seeking volunteers to share their love of music and their musical talents (e.g., voice, guitar, keyboard) once or twice per month on an ongoing basis on Tuesday or Wednesday before lunchtime. You don't have to be a virtuoso, concert master or a stage performer, but you should be comfortable working in a group setting and have a relaxed, warm manner. We will provide you with an orientation and staff support. Please contact Lisa Ruggiero at 203-801-2320 or volunteer@silverhillhospital.org
06840.title: Do you play an instrument or sing?

06840.description: Using any format that you practice, lead a 30-45 minute group of adult patients in a seated movement and/or meditation session that helps patients achieve a more relaxed state and acquire new skills. You must possess outstanding communication skills, practice meditation in your personal life and be comfortable leading an educational group. All volunteer-led groups are monitored by our professional staff. Hospital orientation and training session required. Must provide one reference and authorize a criminal background check. All volunteers must also have a recent TB screening test (PPD) prior to starting as a volunteer.
06840.title: Meditation/Seated Movement Group Leader

06840.description: We seek mature, personable, and discreet individuals to greet and direct visitors for our Main House facility during regularly scheduled family visiting hours and patient dining hours on the weekends (12:30-2:30PM Saturday and Sunday). This volunteer position will afford you with an opportunity to interact with patients, family members and staff and gain exposure to the operations of a psychiatric hospital and various staff roles and functions. You will also learn about the types of services offered to individuals with psychiatric or addiction disorders. Volunteers may select available dates that work with their availability.
06840.title: Greet Patients & Families During Weekend Visiting Hours

06840.description: Have you made a difference in your community? Here's a great idea, change a life - with just one hour per week you can help a blind person continue toward their goal of independent living. Read their mail, drive them to the grocery store or bank, help them label household items. It's easy and you can set your own schedule! This is a great way to spring into action and dust off to achieve that olde New Year's Resolution to make your world a better place!
06840.title: Spring into Action:  Can You Change a Life in One Hour a Week?
06840.org: Department of Rehabilitation Services; Services for the Blind

06840.description: Patients in our Women's Transitional Living Program (28-day program) attend volunteer-led 12-step discussion groups and workshops as part of their therapeutic program and personal recovery journey. Volunteers who are women in recovery play an integral role in this process by sharing their personal stories of strength, hope and recovery and how they maintain sobriety and a healthy lifestyle. Volunteers use AA literature like \"Living Sober\" and \"The Big Book \"and discuss a variety of themes/topics, i.e., Slogans, Acceptance, Living Sober, Relapse Prevention with small groups of women at our Barrett House residence
06840.title: Women's Group 12-step Meeting Leader

06840.description: Adolescent patients in treatment for substance abuse disorders participate in a wide variety of therapeutic programs and also attend 12-step based discussion groups as part of their recovery journey. Volunteers, who are also in recovery, active in a 12-step program and working with a Sponsor, play an integral role in this process by sharing their personal stories of messages of hope, as well as how they maintain sobriety and a healthy lifestyle. Daytime and evening volunteer opportunities are available in our adolescent inpatient and transitional living program (residential, 28-day program).
06840.title: Help Teens Overcome Addiction (12-step group)

06840.description: Patients living with psychiatric disorders participate in a wide variety of therapeutic programs designed to augment their medication protocols and provide them with new ways to understand their mental illness, along with better ways to relate and cope. Volunteers, who are living happier lives while in recovery from a psychiatric illness, play an integral role in this process by sharing their personal stories of strength, hope and healing, and how they maintain a balanced life while living with a mental illness.
06840.title: Psychiatric Peer Support Group Leader

06840.description: Patients at Silver Hill participate in a wide variety of therapeutic programs and also attend 12-step practicum meetings as part of their recovery journey. Volunteers, who are personally active in a 12-step program and are working with a sponsor, play an integral role in this process by sharing their personal stories of strength, hope and recovery and how they maintain sobriety and a healthy lifestyle. Daytime and evening volunteer opportunities are available for both adult and adolescent inpatient and transitional living program (residential).
06840.title: 12-Step Discussion Group Leader

06840.description: Work directly with our patients and recreational therapy staff to provide recreational activities that enrich and enhance our patients' existing treatment programs in our adult psychiatric unit on weekdays at 2:00 p.m.
06840.title: Recreational Group Assistant

06840.description: Join our volunteer team as a Library Resource Assistant! We are seeking volunteers to serve as ambassadors to our residential houses to ascertain the residents' current book preferences and to make these matierials available to them using the resources of our library. The Silver Hill patient library boasts a broad selection of self-help, fiction and nonfiction books, magazines and newspapers for our patients and their families. Your job will be to help bring these resources to the residents in our houses and also help ensure that materials are returned before patients discharge. We prefer volunteers who could be available during the week to interact with patients during their free time (Mon-Fri 10:00-11:30 or late afternoon). Volunteers will receive a hospital orientation (offered on the first Monday of the month 10:00 a.m. to 5:00) and also access to our on-site medical education seminars. This is a great opportunity for a college or graduate student, recent college or graduate school graduate , or individuals wishing to enter the healthcare and mental health field in the areas of nursing, social work, medicine or clinical psychology. Please contact Lisa Ruggiero at volunteer@silverhillhospital.org or 203-801-2320. We look forward to hearing from you!
06840.title: Library Resources Assistant/Ambassador

06840.description: We are seeking a few volunteers to assist us with routine office tasks in the social work department, including serving as the front desk receptionist from 12:00-1:00 pm on weekdays when the office manager goes to lunch. Volunteers are scheduled on the weekdays when they are available. Other routine tasks include assembling binders of information for our patients and placing follow up calls to outside professionals to whom we have referred our patients after discharge. We invite all of our new volunteers to attend a hospital orientation which is held on the first Monday of the month (except for Mondays when it is a holiday) from 9:00 a.m. to 5:00. The orientation will familiarize you with our hospital programs and policies and procedures. Please contact Lisa Ruggiero at lruggiero@silverhillhospital.org or 203-801-2320 to set up an interview. We look forward to hearing from you.
06840.title: Social Work Department Assistant

06840.description: The Admissions Office at Silver Hill Hospital is where individuals experiencing distress due to psychiatric or addiction challenges first come to determine where they will be assigned in the hospital to receive the best possible treatment. You will work alongside the admissions staff, who are expertly trained to help people in crisis and to ensure that each patient will receive the most appropriate care. After training as an Admissions Office Greeter, you will use your interpersonal skills and empathy for others to offer support to patients and their families by providing written information, food and beverages, and descriptions of our programs and facilities. Your calm presence and good people instincts will guide you so that patients are made to feel welcome, respected and encouraged. Volunteer candidates are selected on the basis of their maturity, ability to handle sensitive situations in a discreet and professional manner and a willingness to also accept supervision and ongoing feedback.
06840.title: Family & Patient Greeter-Admissions Office

07869.description: Morris Habitat for Humanity is building 3 homes in 9 days in Mine Hill. Begins June 6th-June 16th We are looking for volunteers in the following areas: Manning Pods and Trailers Hospitality: Shuttle, Traffic Control, runner, food support and so much more! Please call or email Stephanie Sayki, Director of Volunteer Services 973-891-1934 x103 Stephanie.sayki@morrishabitat.org
07869.title: Blitz Build-Hospitality & Support Committee

07869.description: Grace Healthcare Services welcomes is looking for Hospice volunteers. We welcome your gifts of time and compassion. Whether you choose to work directly with patients and families or to volunteer in one of many other ways, you can make a profound difference in someone's life, including your own. Volunteers are an integral part of the hospice team. Volunteer Opportunities: Companionship Volunteers work directly with patients providing companionship, offering friendly visits, reading to patients, writing letters, offering a gentle touch or sharing a quiet moment. Complementary Volunteers are certified/trained professionals who can provide complementary modalities of reflexology, music, imagery and touch therapies such as Reiki, massage, therapeutic touch and healing hands. Pet Therapy Volunteers provide certified/trained pets who visit with patients. These animals provide loving memories for some and give unconditional love helping our patients feel connected to a larger world. Administrative Volunteers provide help to the staff in our Edison office by assisting with typing, addressing cards, organizing newsletters, creating packets, collating manuals and other varied clerical duties Craft Volunteers consist of individuals or groups who touch patients in a special way by making lap blankets, shawls, huggable dolls/bears and other articles for patients to enjoy. Junior Volunteers consist of groups such as girl/boy scouts or young people who wish to honor our patients by making holiday cards, posters, wall hangings and memory books. Bereavement Volunteers offer support to the families and friends of patients who have passed. During the grieving process the bereavement volunteer can be a valuable resource, especially for those who lack a solid support network. Hospice training classes are required for Companionship and Complementary Volunteers. They are free of charge and offered on an ongoing basis. Grace Healthcare Services serves counties throughout New Jersey. Areas where you are needed include: Atlantic County, Bergen County, Cape May County, Essex County, Hudson County, Mercer County, Middlesex County, Monmouth County, Morris County, North Passaic County, Ocean County, Somerset County, South Passaic County, Burlington County, Camden County and Union County. For more information about our free volunteer training and available opportunities, contact our Volunteer Department or visit our website at Gracehcs.com!
07869.title: Become a Hospice Volunteer!

07869.description: Want to learn new skills, serve your community and help build a house all at the same time? Volunteer at the Morris Habitat ReStore! The Morris Habitat ReStore is a successful retail outlet that provides new and gently-used building materials and home furnishings. Volunteers are vital in keeping the ReStore operating! All proceeds from the ReStore help build decent affordable housing. Volunteer areas are: Administrative Support: General knowledge of computers to help set-up and/or maintain record-keeping files, tracking volunteer hours, answer phones. Good computer skills, including experience with Word and Excel. Warehouse Support: Help with pricing and appraising, floor assistance or furniture repairs ReStore Truck Helper: Assist on our box truck to pick up donations to bring back to the ReStore. Cashier: Ring up customers Customer Service Support: Assist customers shopping with current sales and answer general questions ReStore Collections Team: Research items to determine value, monitoring and updating our store, speaking to potential donors, helping to ship and photograph items. We are also looking for individual subject area experts such as Art, Coins and valuables. Contact Stephanie Sayki for more information Stephanie.sayki@morrishabitat.org
07869.title: ReStore Warehouse Support

07869.description: About our Building Program Our sites are opened to volunteers Monday-Saturday from 8:30am-4pm. All are welcome, no special skills are needed! All we ask for is a smile and a willingness to help. Construction volunteers do everything from pouring footings to roofing and final interior finishes. General Information : 1. We build most Mondays through Saturdays at sites in and around Morris County. Current Active Sites: Dover, Budd Lake, and West Milford. More site starting this Spring. 2. Our construction day is 8:30 AM to 4:00 PM. Unless otherwise advised, volunteers should bring a bag lunch. Lunch is 12:00 PM - 12:30 PM. 3.Construction volunteers must be 16 years of age to be present on an active build site. Youth volunteers ages 16 or 17 years old must be accompanied by an adult chaperone. Chaperones must be 21 years of age. One adult chaperone is required for every 5 youth. What to Expect: 1. A Site Supervisor is in charge of the work and volunteers each work day. 2. All are welcomed-No special skills are needed! 3. All we ask for is a smile and a willingness to help. We will send you home tired, dirty and happy! Contact Stephanie Sayki on how to sign up for a day: Stephanie Sayki-stephanie.sayki@morrishabitat.org
07869.title: General Construction-New Builds and Home Repair

07869.description: Want to learn new skills, serve your community and help build a house all at the same time? Volunteer at the Morris Habitat ReStore! The Morris Habitat ReStore is a successful retail outlet that provides new and gently-used building materials and home furnishings. Volunteers are vital in keeping the ReStore operating! All proceeds from the ReStore help build decent affordable housing. We are also looking for individual subject area experts such as Art, Coins and valuables. Contact Stephanie Sayki for more information Stephanie.sayki@morrishabitat.org
07869.title: ReStore Donations Truck Helper

07869.description: Special Events Committee Events Committee: Planning and coordination Support Committee: Setup, cleanup, work day of event Contact Stephanie Sayki Stephanie.sayki@morrishabitat.org
07869.title: Special Events Committee

The Morris Habitat ReStore is a successful retail outlet that provides new and gently-used building materials and home furnishings. Volunteers are vital in keeping the ReStore operating! All proceeds from the ReStore help build decent affordable housing. Contact Stephanie Sayki for more information Stephanie.sayki@morrishabitat.org
